We think this could be a new prepaid product and it is likely to offer free unlimited basic internet similar to  ,   and the new  . Effectively this could put an end to pay per use charges for internet which U Mobile currently charges RM0.20/MB.

author: soyacincau
title: TM Unifi now offers faster speeds for less but with some compromises
tags: HSBB,New Unifi Plans,TM,TM Unifi,TM Unifi 30Mbps,TM Unifi 30Mbps Upload,TM Unifi Asymmetrical Speed,TM Unifi Plans,Unifi 30Mbps,Unifi 50Mbps,Unifi 50Mbps Upload
contents: Ever since TM had   High Speed Broadband service 5 years ago, nothing much has changed when it comes to their Home broadband plans. Just recently we had a glimpse of its faster   but they are limited to selected test areas within the Klang Valley. You could get 50Mbps for only RM263.94/month (inclusive of GST) which is the same price as their current VIP 20 plan with 20Mbps connectivity. The folks at Lowyat had just   that the new plans are now officially available in all Unifi service areas. So now you can enjoy 30Mbps speeds at RM210.94 a month, which is the same price as their current 10Mbps plan. While it sounds good, there are some differences you should know before making the switch. TM’s current VIP Home Plans – VIP 5, VIP 10 and VIP 20 are having symmetrical bandwidth where you get the same upload speeds as your download speeds. So if you signed up for VIP 10, you get 10Mbps speeds for both download and uploads.  For the new 30Mbps and 50Mbps plans, the speeds are asymmetrical where its upload speeds are much slower than downloads. The new 30Mbps plan gets just 5Mbps for upload while its 50Mbps plan settles for 10Mbps. Is this a big deal? It all depends on your usage. For normal web browsing, video and music streaming, 30Mbps for download is a significant jump from 10Mbps and the lower upload speeds shouldn’t be much of an issue.  However if you upload a lot content especially Full HD or 4K videos, the 5Mbps upload speed would be a bottleneck. It will be the same story as well if plan on uploading huge files or doing video broadcast from your home. Despite a dip in upload speeds, the new Unifi plans are still offering unlimited quota until further notice.  Another big difference is the lack of free landline phone calls. For the current VIP plans, each subscriber can make unlimited phone calls for free to any TM fixed line nationwide. Meanwhile phone calls to mobile numbers are charged at 11sen/minute, which is quite reasonable. On the new 30Mbps/50Mbps plan, there are no free calls included and all calls will be charged at 21sen/minute for both domestic fixed lines and mobile numbers. If someone in your household is making a lot of phone calls especially to land lines, you can top up additional RM21.20/month for its voice pack that gives you 600 minutes of voice calls to any local number. After finishing your 600 minutes, you can still make unlimited phone calls to any fixed line for free, while extra calls to mobile numbers are charged at 11 sen/minute.  By default, all Unifi subscribers get HyppTV with a couple of free channels bundled in. On the newer 30Mbps/50Mbps plans, you get the extra option of either HyppTV Aneka, Varnam or Ruby Packs, which is about 9-12 extra channels depending on your choice. It all depend on your usage. If symmetrical connectivity with higher upload speed and unlimited phone calls are critical, the existing VIP plans would be your preferred option. If 5Mbps upload is sufficient and download speeds are more important, the newer plans offer faster download speeds for less. Essentially the new plans give you more than 2X the download speed but it cuts down your uploads by half for the same monthly subscription. Phone calls to fixed lines are now chargeable on the new plans but you can top up extra RM21.20 each month for the same option as before. To balance the lack of phone calls would be the additional HyppTV channels that you’ll get at no extra charge.  The new plans are available and you can sign up at your nearest TM Point outlet. However do note that existing subscribers will be tied to a fresh 2 year contract when you make the switch. So if you’re on TM’s VIP 10 and VIP 20 plans, would you switch to these newer option? Let us know in the comments below.

author: soyacincau
title: Sony’s PROselfie smart phone, the Xperia C4 Dual has arrived
tags: Android,Dual Sim,smart phone,Sony,sony xperia c4,sony xperia c4 dual,Sony Xperia C4 Dual Malaysia,Sony Xperia C4 Malaysia,Sony Xperia C4 Price
contents: If you love taking selfies, the   is now officially available in Malaysia with the retail price tag of RM1,299. It was   last month alongside the   and its new flagship  . This is the successor of the   and the new model offers better specs all round. The Xperia C4 Dual features a 5.5″ Full HD display and under the hood it gets a 64-bit MediaTek MT6752 1.7GHz Octa-Core processor that’s mated to 2GB of RAM. On-board it has 16GB of storage which can expand up to 128GB extra with microSD. The main camera of the Xperia C4 has been bumped up to a 13MP Exmor RS sensor, while the front has a 5MP camera that even comes with an LED flash for better lit selfies. There are couple of selfie features built-in including AR mask and beautification.  With a 2,600mAh capacity battery, the Xperia C4 Dual weighs 147 grams and has a thickness of just 7.9mm. Out of the box, it runs on the latest Android 5.0 Lollipop and it also supports 4G LTE, unlike the M4 Aqua for Malaysia that’s limited to just 3G HSPA+. The Xperia C4 Dual is availale in black, white and vibrant mint colours. For more info, head over to Sony’s   product page.

author: soyacincau
title: Redmi Note 2 passes certification and here’s how it looks like
tags: Android,Redmi Note,Redmi Note 2,Redmi Note 2 Specs,smart phone,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Redmi Note 2
contents: The   is dire need of a new successor and the   should be announced very soon. Just recently a new model has just passed TENAA, China’s certification body and this gives us the first dibs on what to expect with the upcoming affordable phablet.  In terms of design, it looks more squarish with a matte looking finishing similar to its current  . The front still maintains a 5.5″ size screen but this time it pushes a Full HD display (1920×1080) with thinner bezels. The Redmi Note 2 is thinner too at 8.05mm and it weighs 159 grams, according to its certified specs in the database. As comparison, the original Redmi Note is thicker at 9.5mm and it weighs close to 200 grams. The Redmi Note 2 is spotted with 2 variants, one with  , and another with more bands including  . Under the hood, they didn’t mention the type of processor but it is listed to be a 2GHz Octa-Core unit (likely MediaTek) that’s mated to 2GB of RAM. On-board it has a larger 16GB of storage which can be expanded with microSD. For its cameras, the Redmi Note 2 is listed to carry a 13MP main and a 5MP front unit, similar to the Mi 4i. From the back, the Redmi Note 2 maintains the same centre aligned placement for its camera and LED flash but this time it gets a circular lens design. The loud speaker has a longer grill placed at the bottom with a little stub that’s also similar to the Mi 4i. Like most new Xiaomi products, you can expect 4G LTE support on dual-SIM slots.  So far there’s no word on its availability yet, but who knows it might be announced alongside their   this week.

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung Galaxy A8 now official. Thinnest Samsung Smart Phone at 5.9mm
tags: Android,galaxy a8,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy A,samsung galaxy a8,samsung galaxy A8 malaysia,Samsung Galaxy A8 Malaysia Spec,Samsung Galaxy A8 Official,Smart Phone dual SIM
contents: After  , the   is now official with a thickness of just 5.9mm. While it won’t break any new world records, the Galaxy A8 is the thinnest smart phone that Samsung has ever produced, beating its previous 6.3mm record on the  .  From the exterior design, it still maintains the same unibody approach like the rest of its Galaxy A series but the A8 inherits some design cues from their current flagship. For starters, the metal frame has some chiseled design and the front looks like a larger Galaxy S6. Even the home button has a fingerprint scanner which unlocks at a single touch. With a bigger model number, the Galaxy A8 has a 5.7″ Full HD Super AMOLED display, which is 0.2″ larger than the Galaxy A7. Under the hood, it gets a similar Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa-Core processor (4x 1.5GHz, 4x 1.0GHz) that’s mated to 2GB of RAM and has 16GB or 32GB of on-board storage. The Galaxy A8 for China supports 4G LTE and it has dual-SIM slots, but the 2nd slot is a hybrid where it doubles up as a microSD slot which accepts up to 128GB capacity. In the imaging department, the main shooter is a 16MP camera with f/1.9 that’s similar to the Galaxy S6. For the front, it gets a wide angle 5MP shooter. Double tapping the home button will launch the camera app at anytime and it also supports wide selfie as well.  With a larger screen, the Galaxy A8 gets a decent 3,050mAh capacity battery, which is about 17% larger than the Galaxy A7 which comes with a 2,600mAh unit. The Galaxy A8 is 10 grams heavier at 151g. For Malaysia, the Galaxy A8 was recently spotted in SIRIM’s database and word has it that it would be   with a RM1,888 price tag.  For more info, you can check out the Samsung China’s   product page.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Samsung Galaxy S6 edge+ and Note 5 tipped to launch August 12
tags: galaxy note 5,galaxy S6 edge,mobile device,rumour mill,Samsung,samsung galaxy note 5,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Plus
contents: We’ve been hearing off and on that the is set to be launched soon, and according to new information it will be launched on August 12th, alongside the Samsung Galaxy S6 edge+. The report also brings to light some new details about the phones as well. For starters the Galaxy Note 5 will look like a larger version of the   smartphone and won’t have a microSD slot, but will be home to a very thin bezel. The S Pen will also has apparently undergone a bit of an evolution, making it look more like a pen and it will share the same colour as the smartphone it belongs to. Other rumoured specs include an octa-core 64 bit processor, 4GB RAM and a 4,100mAh battery. So far the   and the upcoming  are the only devices that officially use the same type (LPDDR4) of RAM. For the S6 edge+ on the other hand, is said to have Samsung’s home brewed Exynos 7420 SoC under the hood instead of a Snapdragon 808 chipset. There will also be 3GB RAM for the device, which is the same amount of memory residing in the Galaxy S6. In terms of other specs, the S6 edge+ is expected to have a 16 megapixel rear camera and a 5 megapixel front snapper as well as a 3,000mAh battery plus 32GB internal storage. The Note 5 will be available in silver, gold, white and black colour options and both devices are apparently set to go on sale starting August 21st. No word yet on what the pricing will look like, but we expect that they will be close to that of the original flagships.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: ZTE outs a new flagship smart phone with 4GB RAM but it’s not coming our way
tags: android 5.1.1,axon,mobile device,smartphone,ZTE,zte axon,zte axon smartphone,zte flagship smartphone
contents: has come out with a hot new premium device that’s not from its Nubia series, but instead goes by the moniker Axon, which is something totally new coming from the brand. In terms of design, it looks a lot like an early days HTC Desire or HTC One X but it comes with a premium metallic body in Ion Gold, Chromium Silver and Phthalo Blue and it also sports a dual camera configuration. The phone was made mostly with the US market in mind, considering ZTE tends to make phones mainly focused on the Asian region only. Under the hood, you will get an 2GHz octa-core Snapdragon 810 soC in conjunction with 4GB RAM, 32GB non-expandable storage as well as a 5.5 inch QHD LCD display. The rear camera combo will be a 13 megapixel and 2 megapixel snappers, with dual-LED flash and 4K video capture and a 8 megapixel selfie cam up front. Powering all this is a 3,000mAh non-removable battery with quick charge support and Android 5.1.1 will be running the show. To top it off, it will have 4G LTE support. The device will retail for $449.98 (about RM 1712) and is currently open for preorders from ZTE, with a bonus TPU case and JBL earbuds if you do. We won’t be officially getting the phone here but you can still order from Amazon, Newegg and eBay should it tickle your fancy.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Redmi 2 Enhanced is landing this 16th July for RM 459
tags: Redmi 2,redmi 2 enhanced malaysia,redmi 2 enhanced malaysia launch,Redmi 2 Enhanced Version,Redmi 2 Malaysia,Xiaomi Redmi 2
contents: Mi Malaysia has just   that the   version will begin sale in Malaysia this Thursday starting 12PM, for RM 459 on Mi.com. It will be available in 2 colours – Dark Grey and White.  The device is literally hot on the heels of the rather popular   which went on sale this March, with a   that went into effect earlier this month. For those looking for a better Redmi 2, this is the ticket. In terms of specs, it still has a lot in common with the Redmi 2. For starters it gets the same 4.7″ IPS HD 720p display, Qualcomm 1.2GHz Quad-Core Snapdragon 410 processor, Dual-SIMs with 4G LTE support, 8MP main + 2MP front cameras along with a removable 2,200mAh capacity battery. The only difference here is you get 2GB RAM as opposed to the original’s 1GB and on-board expandable storage has been given a bump up from 8GB to 16GB. If you’re still hungry for space, the phone will handle additional storage up to 32GB via its microSD slot.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi to launch something on 16th July. Might not be a phone.
tags: Mi TV,Mi TV2S,MiTV2S,PK,Slimmest TV,teaser,Xiaomi,Xiaomi 16th July,Xiaomi launch,Xiaomi Mi TV,Xiaomi TV
contents: Xiaomi has the knack for teasing new products with very little details. For this month, they are marking 16th July as a launch for something special. If you’ve be following Xiaomi, you should know that they are venturing beyond smart phones and they are trying to expand into the smart home segment.  So far they have released 4 teaser images and it shows something metalic and slender. With a power plug being displayed in the teaser, this is looking like another new appliance. Could it be a new ultra-thin  ? or maybe a whole new product like their  ? Some are speculating it could be a new phone, likely the new Mi 5 flagship smart phone. While it is almost a year since the   was announced, it seems to be too soon for another flagship right after the release of its   and the  .  The Redmi Note phablet is due for a replacement but judging from the teaser image, we don’t think this would be a new smart phone. We have a feeling this could be a new TV that could take on the Sony’s  , which is currently the world’s thinnest. What do you think? Leave your comments below.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Alleged press renders of the Motorola Moto G (2015) emerge
tags: Android,Moto G,moto g 2015,motorola moto G 2015,motorola moto G 3rd gen,rumour mill,smart phone,smartphone
contents: Not too long ago we got treated to leaked product photos of the upcoming  , and now it seems we have leaked renders of the phone itself from all angles. While the images look close to the  , just be aware that it isn’t confirmed to be official yet. This particular smartphone has already been leaked multiple times, with each leak detailing the phone more and more. The images we see here are in line with what has been shown off so far, down to the rear buttons. The case does appear to have textured and nontextured versions so, these could be backplate variants much like what the previous gen Moto G had as well. In terms of specs the device is expected to have a 64-bit Snapdragon 410 processor mated to 1GB RAM, 8GB storage and LTE support. It’s great that the processor is getting an update but weirdly the phone isn’t getting any extra RAM or storage. The budget smartphone will also be home to a 5 inch 1280 x 720 display as well as a 13 megapixel rear snapper and 5 megapixel front facing camera. Apart from being among the first to run on the very latest flavour of Android, the Moto G specs look underwhelming against today’s cheap and cheerful offering from China. The R  for example is having similar specs but it gets double the amount of RAM and storage for less than RM500.  The phone is expected to be released sometime in September if they are following their Fall release schedule, but plenty of this could still change between then and now.

author: soyacincau
title: Maxis reduces price for its SurfMore data top up
tags: Maxis,Maxis Data Plan,Maxis postpaid,Maxis SurfMore,Maxis SurfMore 50,Maxis SurfMore 75,Maxis SurfMore Data Top Up,Postpaid,postpaid plan
contents: Data doesn’t really come cheap on Maxis. After they discontinued its   postpaid plan, topping up extra data could cost as high as RM35 for 1GB.  With the competition embarking on a price war, customers are getting spoilt for choice with a variety of postpaid plans offering as much as   for under RM40. Paying RM25 for 500MB or RM35 for 1GB just doesn’t make any sense these days and Maxis has finally revised its quota top up pricing to more sensible levels. If you need more data for your SurfMore 50/75 plan, Maxis is now charging just RM15 per 1GB extra. This is the same rate as before but they still omit its previous 5GB for RM50 top up option for heavy usage subscribers. Nevertheless, it is still significantly cheaper than what they have been charging recently.  As part of their Raya promotion, new and existing SurfMore 50 customers will be getting   for 6 months starting from July until December 2015. This gives you a total of 4GB for just RM50/month. Not as cheap as the rest, but it is better than nothing.  Meanwhile, its current MaxisOne Plan that offers unlimited calls and SMS is still   RM30 for 1GB. For heavy usage, they are offering 3GB at RM58 or 6GB at RM116, which comes up to RM19.33/GB.

author: soyacincau
title: OPPO kicks off R7 Plus pre-order with RM0 deposit and extra perks
tags: Android,Dual Sim,Oppo Malaysia,Oppo R7,oppo R7 plus,OPPO R7 Plus Malaysia,OPPO R7 Plus Pre-order,OPPO R7 Pre-order,OPPO R7 Price,smart phone
contents: The   is their latest phablet offering that was   in Malaysia for RM1,998. To secure a unit for yourself, OPPO is starting its pre-orders tomorrow, 11th July until 10th of August 2015. In their past pre-orders, usually you would need to place a deposit but now they are offering RM0 down payment if you pre-order online. In addition, they are also giving away VOOC Car Charger worth RM148 and a 50% discount voucher for your future servicing needs.  The RM0 pre-order deposit is only applicable if you  . You can also pre-order at OPPO’s   but you would need to place a RM100 deposit in order to secure a unit.  Regardless of where you pre-order, you’ll receive a 50% OPPO Care Service Discount Voucher. According to them, this service voucher works as an insurance for your device and they will reveal more info at a later time. The VOOC Car Charger will be given to the first 1,000 customers that pre-order for both online and offline channels. Apart from OPPO’s own website, they have also appointed   and   as their exclusive online pre-order channel. The OPPO R7 Plus will be available in early August. To recap on the specs, the R7 Plus is a 6″ device with a Full HD screen and it runs on a 1.5GHz Octa-Core Snapdragon 615 processor. It gets 3GB of RAM and 32GB of storage which is expandable with microSD. It supports 4G LTE with dual-SIM slots and for imaging it gets a 13MP main camera and a front facing 8MP shooter. The battery is huge with a 4,100mAh capacity battery and it also comes with a fingerprint scanner mounted at the back.  Out of the box, the R7 Plus runs on their newly improved ColorOS 2.1 that’s based on Android 5.1 Lollipop. For the Malaysian market, the R7 Plus with its unibody metal design is available only in gold colour. For further reading, you can check out our  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The LG G4 Beat is a mid-range phone in a premium package
tags: Android,G4 Beat,LG,LG G4 Beat,LG smartphone,mobile device,smartphone
contents: Not too long back we reported about   for yet another   offshoot. Now it looks like the LG G4 Beat or the   is now official and is pretty much a lot like its big brother, but only on the outside. The new device is going to be powered by a 64-bit octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 mated to 1.5GB RAM as well as 8GB internal memory expandable via microSD. The smartphone is a little smaller as well, with a 5.2 inch Full HD display. Camera capabilities are a bit lower too, with a 8 megapixel rear snapper with laser auto focus and a 5 megapixel front snapper. The American (no, not the US specifically) and Latin regions however will be getting a version with a 13 megapixel rear camera. The G4 Beat/ G4s will support LTE, HSPA+ and will sport a 2,300mAh battery. Aside from that, it will have the typical G4 styling with ceramic design back cover but we don’t know if LG will make the other back cover options available as of yet. It doesn’t look like we will be getting this variant anytime soon though, as LG is going to start sales of the phone this month starting in France, Germany and Brazil, followed by Canada, Russia, Turkey, India, South Africa and Singapore at a later date. No word yet on the price either but since they are keeping it mid-ranged, we expect it to be much, much cheaper than its flagship counterpart.

author: Sponsored
title: Need more internet and you want it fast? This is your last chance to sign up for FIRST Basic 38 plan
tags: Celcom,Celcom First,Celcom First 38,Celcom FIrst Basic,Celcom FIrst Basic 38,Celcom Postpaid,First by Celcom,FIrst Postpaid,First Postpaid by Celcom,postpaid plan
contents: The promo for what seems to be the   in town is coming to a close. No contracts and no commitments, you can feed your need for internet with 3GB for just RM38/month and this is on Celcom’s extensive nationwide 4G LTE coverage.  But better act fast, the promo will last only till the 16th of July! Filled to the brim with the workings of what every good data plan should be made of, the FIRST Basic 38 plan comes with an extra healthy helping of data. By default, it comes with 2GB of mobile internet plus 2GB of Celcom First WiFi. However if you sign up by 16 July 2015, Celcom is offering extra 1GB, which gives you a total of 3GB of Mobile Internet and 3GB of FIRST WiFi to enjoy.  Best of all, this extra internet allocation isn’t limited for just 6 months or 12 months. You can enjoy 3GB for life with no strings attached.  Having trouble finishing 3GB within a month? No worries. You get to carry forward leftover data from your plan to the next month, up to a maximum of 3GB. So say no to wastage and you could enjoy more data in the following month. If you do exceed your allocated data, you still can continue to surf with no extra charge but speeds would be throttled. If you make occasional calls and SMS, the FIRST Basic 38 plan comes inclusive with 50 SMS and 50 minutes of calls to all networks each month. Any additional use will be charged at 15sen/minute and 15 sen per SMS.  Got a sudden need more for quota, topping up extra data for your FIRST Basic 38 is affordable and easy. You can MAX UP from as little as RM3 for 100MB or RM10 for 500MB. For much bigger appetites, 1GB costs RM15 while power users can get 5GB for just RM50, which comes out to just RM10/GB. This can be done via SMS or by dialing *118#.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Huawei’s 13,000mAh monster powerbank goes on sale, will set you back RM 128
tags: Honor,Honor 13000mAh Powerbank,Honor 13000mah powerbank malaysia,Honor Power Bank,Huawei Honor,Powerbank
contents: If you felt your 10,000mAh powerbank wasn’t huge enough, Huawei finally put their  to market, and it promises to charge more devices and do it faster. In terms of appearance, it looks a lot like what you would get if you combined an   with that of a  , generally sharing design elements from both devices. The powerbank has two USB charging ports with a 5V 2A output to charge faster and looks as big (and is probably much heavier) than your standard smartphone. At least, it is cheaper than their current   that’s being sold at RM148 locally. It doesn’t however, hold much to Xiaomi’s much cheaper   which retails at only RM 79 and still pushes the same output with a similar dual USB output configuration. The powerbank is now available for purchase and you can snag one for yourself at  for RM 128.

author: soyacincau
title: OPPO is serious about combating counterfeit products. Here’s what you need to know
tags: Cloned OPPO Smart Phone,Counterfeit Phones,Fake OPPO,Fake OPPO Find 7,Fake Oppo Phones,Fakes,Genuine Product,Lowyat Fight,Oppo,Oppo Find 7,OPPO Low Yat Plaza,Oppo Malaysia,Oppo N3,smart phone
contents:
Recently a   at Low Yat Plaza had occurred which was reported to have started as a shoplifting incident and then escalated into a bigger mess. As usual, there are several accounts of what really happened including one that claims to be a cheating case between a buyer and seller. Kuala Lumpur’s CID chief has   that the incident was pure thuggery and it isn’t racially driven as some quarters might have posted on Facebook.  On the allegation of selling fake phones, OPPO Malaysia has immediately issued a statement that they are taking a hard stance on counterfeit products. OPPO is having a challenge of tackling   in our local market and they urged consumers to purchase only from their authorised outlets. They maintained that their official outlets, dealers, distributors and partners are carefully selected to provide the highest quality of service and most importantly to sell genuine OPPO products.  Ever since they started operations in Malaysia, OPPO has highlighted a number of fake products which can be seen even at Pasar Malam. A few months back, they shared a couple of photos and video of a fake  . To protect consumers better, they had   an   to verify if the serial number of the device is a genuine unit. As mentioned before, they   who have been duped with clone units to make a formal report to the authorities for further action. In a separate incident last year, one of our readers had been sold a   which was shoddy in build quality and it uses inferior specs. If you haven’t seen it yet, you can check out his detailed   between a genuine and fake Redmi Note.  
The first step is to try to settle with the person that sold you the product. You’ll need to produce a receipt that includes the matching serial number of the device. Inform that that you’ve been sold an imitation unit and demand for a replacement or a full refund. 
If the seller refuses to entertain your requests, the next best step would be to report to the Ministry of Domestic Trade. You can drop them   which they will respond within 3 working days. Do attach the full details including your receipt, device model and the shop that you’ve purchased from.

author: soyacincau
title: Stop spreading rumours about 1MDB or else…
tags: 1MDB,1MDB Investigation,1MDB Rumours,1MDB Warning,MCMC,Rumour mongering,slander
contents: The 1MDB (1Malaysia Development Bhd) issue has being in limelight lately and things got heaten up with the recent report published by the  . With the on going   and  , the social space has been buzzing like crazy with hot juicy stories surrounding the issue. Before you share such news on your Facebook or WhatsApp group, the MCMC (Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission) would like to remind you to stop spreading unverified info or else you’ll find yourself in some serious trouble. According to its published reminder, it is an offence to spread unverified stories or manipulated photographs under the Communication and Multimedia Act 1998. If found guilty, one could be fined up to RM50,000 or/and thrown behind bars for a year. Like traditional media, social media users can be held accountable as well. It is always recommended to check on facts or stick to reliable sources before hitting that share or post button. Of course everybody knows that defamation is an offense but for MCMC to come out with such notice shows how critical the situation must have been right now.

author: Sponsored
title: Want to get the iPhone 6? This is probably the easiest way to make the switch
tags: iPhone,iPhone 6,iPhone 6 Malaysia,iPhone 6 Maxis,iPhone 6 Plus,iPhone 6 Plus Malaysia,iPhone Maxis Trade up,iPhone Trade in,iPhone Trade-up,Maxis,Maxis iPhone Trade Up,Maxis Trade-up
categories: iOS,iPhone,Maxis,Mobile Devices,Mobile OS,Players on the Field
contents:
Always wanted to own the latest   but its   is holding you back? Here’s an easier way switch from your current device with the Maxis iPhone Trade-Up Program. From now until 31st July, you can trade up from any smart phone and enjoy extra savings when you sign up with Maxis. According to them, they will accept any device even though it’s not functioning anymore, as long as there are no signs of bloated battery, and if it’s an iPhone, it has to be unlocked. All models will be accepted from the old non-touch enabled feature phones to the new mainstream models. If you lost the box and original charger, no worries as Maxis requires just the phone for this programme. Just make sure it is in good condition with a stylus included (if it originally comes with one).  So much does your old phone cost? Let’s find out. We got a bunch of old phones and we visited our local phone shops to get an estimate of its trade-in values. Our collection includes a Galaxy S4 (with a cracked screen), Galaxy S5, Galaxy Note 3, HTC One M7, Nokia N8, Nokia E5, Nokia X3 feature phone and a BlackBerry Torch that’s missing its battery. Then we went to the Maxis Centre at KLCC to find out if they accept them all and how much each of them are worth. When we asked around the phone shops at shopping malls, most of them wouldn’t pay more than RM100 for old feature phones or outdated smart phones. You might get a similar or better deal for newer models as some of them are willing to accept the Note 3 for RM600 and the Galaxy S5 for RM700. Obviously you can probably get a higher price if you can get a direct buyer. For anything else, Maxis trade-up evaluation is on-par if not better than the normal dealers.  Some of you may have a beaten up device that’s still functional like our Galaxy S4. Even if the display is cracked or heavily scratched, Maxis is still accepting it for a minimum value of RM200, or RM300 if you’re a new subscriber (inclusive of new/port-in RM100 promo). Mind you that the extra RM100 for new subscribers will come as a monthly rebate of RM50 for 2 months, which is reflected in your bill.  If the device is non-functional, Maxis is still accepting it but with a minimum value of RM200. Take note however phones with bloated batteries will not be accepted for safety purposes and if you’re trading in an iPhone, it needs to be unlocked beforehand.   
 After handing over your old device, you’ll need to pick your desired iPhone model and a postpaid plan with 24 months contract. For a worry free experience, you can opt for its limitless talk and SMS bundled Maxis OnePlan (2GB internet inclusive) with 1GB of extra internet at RM158/month. For those wishing to commit less, there’s the iValue postpaid plans that start from just RM100/month. During sign up, the trade-in amount will be used to offset the price of the new device. So if we trade-up the Galaxy S5 with Maxis as a new subscriber, we can get RM900 off (RM800 + RM100) from its bundled pricing. This means we could get the iPhone 6 16GB effectively for Free on iValue 3, or RM639 (before GST) on their MaxisOne Plan. Meanwhile if you’re using an iPhone 5 (valued at RM600), you could potentially pick up the iPhone 6 from as low as RM109 (before GST) on iValue 3 contract with Maxis as a new subscriber.   With its RM200 minimum trade-up guarantee and an extra RM100 off for new subscribers, it’s also a good opportunity to dispose that old dusty feature phone of yours. For existing Maxis subscribers with good payment records, they will waive the advance payment that’s usually required upfront when you sign on a contract.  The   program aims to be your one stop centre to make the iPhone 6 switch without the hassle of disposing your current phone the old fashion way. The whole process is seamless and you can walk in with your old phone and out with a brand new iPhone 6 in one single visit. With the extra savings, it is more worthwhile than to buy the iPhone 6 outright which costs at least RM2,702 with GST. To get started, just visit any Maxis Centre or Maxis Exclusive Partner nationwide with your current phone.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Microsoft to streamline phone releases to six a year
tags: microsoft,microsoft phone,mobile device,smartphone,Windows,windows phone 10
contents: Looks like things are changing fast for Microsoft, as they’ve declared that they are going to be focusing on a new phone release strategy in relation to the cutting of   in its mobile division. The company will now be producing only three types of devices, flagships, business and value phones, according to Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella. If this is true, its likely that we will only be seeing six new Lumia models per year, with two new ones per each of the aforementioned categories. This year Microsoft had already launched six smartphones, the Lumia 435,  , L  and the  Dual, but the new strategy is likely to only launch next year so we are probably going to see more launches to come. Also,   is just around the corner, set for a September launch so they’re likely to push out some new phones along with it at the very least. This phone is rumoured to be the Lumia 940 but there’s no concrete evidence for now. But the question remains, does this mean Microsoft is moving away from hardware to focus more on software as it traditionally has? [ ][ ]

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Sony’s “Live Streaming” app will allow gamers to stream to YouTube and Twitch from their mobiles
tags: mobile app,Sony,Sony Mobile,sony streaming app,sony xperia,twitch,youtube
contents: Good news for mobile gamers on Android, Sony has announced an app that now allows you to stream your games live to Twitch and YouTube. As part of a partnership with Twitch, Sony has enabled their newer, Snapdragon 810 powered devices, namely the  , Xperia Z4v or Xperia Z4 tablet to stream directly to both said platforms. The app brings integrated in-device broadcasting to said phones, and with 35 million installations of the Twitch viewing app so far, this will only add to the viewership. The streaming app is very similar to the  we’ve already seen on the   in terms of the interface and to an extent, its functions. However, you will still need a compatible Sony device to run this so its sadly not an app everyone will get to use. While the app isn’t yet available in our country, should you have an APK downloader (and the necessary phone to run it)  you can grab the Live Screen Streaming app   if you want to give it a go, or maybe even try out the   app instead.

author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus 2 packs a larger 3,300mAh battery but manages to be smaller in size than the first One
tags: Android,OnePlus,oneplus 2,OnePlus 2 Battery,OnePlus 2 Fingerprint scanner,OnePlus 2 Launch,oneplus two,oneplus two launch,smart phone
contents: Ahead of its   launch that’s going be held in  , the OnePlus team just had an interesting AMAA (Ask me Almost Anything) session on  . A couple of interesting things have been mentioned while there was a let down specifically on their fingerprint feature. When asked about its screen size, OnePlus had responded with a picture above where a OnePlus One unit is stacked over its upcoming OnePlus 2. Without going to specifics, either OnePlus has managed to trim its bezels or they could be opting for a slightly smaller screen size that would pack higher pixel density. What’s clear is that the 2 will be smaller, making it easier to hold than its current model that’s loosely based on the  . In terms of battery, the OnePlus 2 will pack 10% more with a 3,300mAh capacity unit. This is almost a 10% increase from its current 3,100mAh unit on the OnePlus One. The camera is said to be improved with a couple of new things that will set it apart from others. For those who are still wondering, the OnePlus One will still continue to sell alongside the OnePlus 2 once it goes on sale.  With regards to its fingerprint feature, OnePlus had   that it will carry the most advanced fingerprint scanner in the market. With Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 810 processor on board, many would anticipate OnePlus to utilise its new Sense ID, which recognises your fingerprint in 3D instead of the usual optical scanner. Unfortunately OnePlus has confirmed that it will be using a physical fingerprint sensor, and not Qualcomm’s Sense ID. The launch is happening on 27th July (28th July 10AM Malaysia) and this is the first time a smart phone is being launched worldwide in Virtual Reality. If you don’t have the VR Box, don’t fret as OnePlus will be releasing their launch app which caters for both VR and non-VR users. Just to recap what we know so far, the OnePlus 2 will be powered by a Snapdragon 810 processor that’s clocked at a lower 1.8GHz speed and it will be mated to 4GB of LPDDR4 RAM. It also gets a reversible USB Type C port and   to be between US$322-US$450 (about RM1,230-RM1,700).

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung Gear VR Innovator Edition for the S6 has finally arrived at RM799
tags: Oculus,Oculus Store,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Gear VR,Samsung Gear VR Innovator Edition,Samsung Gear VR Innovator Edition malaysia,Samsung Gear VR Malaysia,Samsung Gear VR Malaysia Launch
contents: If you own   or  , you can now immerse yourself in virtual reality with the newly arrived  . Powered by Oculus, the Gear VR that’s designed for the S6 is priced at RM799 and it will be available at Samsung Experience Stores located in KL, Selangor, Penang and Johor.  With a Galaxy S6/S6 edge plugged in, the Gear VR offers a new gaming experience with a variety of content offered from the Oclus Store. Apart from games, you can view 360 degree photos, videos and special experiences including performances by Cirque du Soleil. The Gear VR comes with an accelerator, gyro meter and proximity sensor built in and it connects to your S6/S6 edge via its microUSB port. If you’re wearing glasses, there’s an adjustable focus dial at the top but it only caters up to a certain degree.  Compared to the first generation Gear VR that was designed for the Note 4, this new version is 15% smaller which makes it more comfortable to wear. For a prolonged usage, there’s a micro USB port at the bottom which allows you to power and charge both Gear VR and your S6 continuously. To prevent fogging on the lens, there’s even an integrated cooling fan on the unit.  The Gear VR only comes in white and it is adjustable with its elastic strap. On the right side, there’s a touchpad with a little stub in the middle to mark its centre point. To navigate around, you can touch on the pad and you can make a selection by tapping on the centre. There’s a dedicated back button at the top to return to home at anytime. By default, the sound comes from the external loud speakers of the S6 but you can hook up a pair of headphones for a better experience. You can use the Gear VR on its own but we reckon it is best enjoyed with a wireless game pad. Want to experience the Gear VR yourself? You can check it out at the main entrance of Pavilion KL from today, 10th July until 12th July, between 12PM to 9PM. You can also stand a chance to win free movie tickets by taking a shot at their Gear VR challenges. Samsung will also bring the Gear VR experience to Sunway Pyramid at the Blue Zone on 25th-26th July.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Samsung Galaxy A8 now has a price and launch date
tags: galaxy a8,Samsung,samsung galaxy a8,samsung galaxy A8 launch,Samsung Galaxy A8 Price,samsung smartphone
contents: We already have quite a few details about the upcoming  , from its specs down to its almost bezel-less design. Now the ultra-thin phone is potentially launching sometime next week and apparently already has pricing to boot. The original details for the launch and price were spotted on  but the details on the page seems to have since disappeared. Regardless, the Galaxy A8 is set to make its official entry into the Chinese market on the 17th July, with a €439 (about RM 1840) price tag. As for the specs, the phone has an octa-core Snapdragon 615 processor mated to 2GB RAM under the hood, alongside 16GB expandable storage up to 128GB via micro SD card. It will also have a 5.7 inch Super AMOLED display at 1080p, powered by a 3,050mAh battery. The camera combo here would be a 16 megapixel rear camera and a 5 megapixel front snapper, which is squeezed into the phone’s tiny 5.94mm frame by using a thinner ISOCELL sensor. The rear camera will have an aperture of f/1.9 and real-time HDR like the  . You will also find a fingerprint sensor embedded in its home button like the Galaxy S6 as well. In terms of looks, it does share a lot in common with the S6, and will be available in similar black, gold and white colour variants. We don’t know yet if we will be getting a local launch for this product but if we do, you’ll be hearing from us soon enough.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Apple iOS 9 public beta is now open
tags: apple,iOS,iOS 9,iOS 9 features,iOS9 beta,iPad,iPhone,iPhone 6,iPhone 6 Plus,ipod touch,Top iOS 9 features
contents: Want to help   test out their beta version of  ? all you need is to present your Apple ID to join the Apple Beta Software program to get a taste of what’s to come. This release is a lot more polished than the developers version that was made available last month, with iOS 9 beta 3 being sent to the devs just yesterday. The latest version of the OS has quite a number of differences compared to the previous one, with vast improvements on Siri, split-screen multitasking and other less-obvious performance upgrades. If you are keen on trying it out for yourself you can get into the program , just be aware that it is still in development so you will obviously come across some bugs. So, do your backups before attempting it just to be safe. To find out more about what iOS 9 has in store, you can check out our compilation post  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: iflix now supports Chromecast, will let you broadcast your fave shows
tags: Chromecast,Chromecast Malaysia,iflix,iflix malaysia,mobile app,mobile device,smartphone
contents: users rejoice! you can now use your favourite broadcasting dongle with to catch your favourite shows on the streaming service. All you need to do is plug it into your TV and your phone essentially transforms into a mobile media device. iflix is basically what people have been calling the “Asian Netflix”, with the service launching locally about two months ago. The service is similar to that of  and   and resides in the same market niche. The service starts from RM 10 a month for unlimited access but you can get a subscription for just RM 8 a month after that with the yearly subscription, which will only set you back RM 96. If you want to give it a go before you commit, you can sign up for a 14 day unlimited access trial that opens up a library of over 10,000 hours of Local, Asian and Western content from the likes of BBC, Fox and Warner to name a few. Users can get access to iflix on up to five devices; which includes smartphones, tablets, smart TVs and notebooks. You can even share an iflix subscription on two different devices at once for each sub. Not sure what Chromecast is capable of? check out  will change the way you use your phone. [

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy A8 coming to Malaysia at RM1,888?
tags: Android,galaxy a8,rumour mill,Samsung,samsung galaxy a8,samsung galaxy A8 malaysia,samsung galaxy A8 sirim,SIRIM
contents: We recently reported that  ‘s thinnest smartphone, the   was well on its way, with the potential pricing and launch date getting   Now thanks to our tipster  , we know that it might be priced at RM 1,888 and might be coming sooner than we think since it was spotted in SIRIM’s database. The device is reported to be launching in China July 17th. Considering the current model, the   is priced at RM 1,499, this is a rather big leap upwards in terms of pricing but the Galaxy A8 does have slightly better specs than its predecessor on top of being slightly larger. It’s also a lot thinner, coming in at 5.9mm as opposed to the Galaxy A7’s 6.3mm thickness. But the device will be featuring the looks and some of the features of its more premium brother the  . To recap the specs, the device will have an octa-core Snapdragon 615 processor mated to 2GB RAM as well as 16GB of expandable storage. For the camera you will be getting a 16 megapixel ISOCELL main shooter with a 5 megapixel selfie snapper up front. The device will be sporting a 5.7 inch Super AMOLED display at 1080p as well as a fingerprint scanner, 3,050 mAh battery and is set to run Android 5.1 Lollipop with TouchWiz on top. Also the devices we believe to be the Samsung Galaxy J7 (SM-J700F/DS) and the Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 10 inch (SM-T815Y) have also passed SIRIM certification, so does that mean we might be seeing any of these three devices in the Malaysian market soon?

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Samsung Galaxy Note 5 render appears in a new leaked video
tags: Android,galaxy note 5,onleaks,rumour mill,samsung galaxy note 5,samsung galaxy note 5 render,smartphone
contents: With the   rumoured to be launching in mere months, a leaked 3D render of the upcoming phablet has surfaced thanks to prominent tipster  . The styling looks very similar to that of the  but with a slot for the S-Pen and what is likely to be a non-removable battery. This is evidenced by slot on the side which is likely to be either a SIM or a microSD expansion slot but its too soon to tell. Video after the break. The battery capacity for the device is said to be 4,100mAh which the Note 5 should be able to accommodate without any issue, with the phone said to be about 10.2mm thick inclusive of the camera hump. The rumoured overall dimensions of the device are said to be 153.4 x 77.3 x 10.2mm; but doesn’t seem to have enough room to fir the 5.89 inch screen with 2mm bezels on either side. Also, the Note 5 looks like it will be coming with a standard microUSB instead of the rumoured USB Type-C port. To recap, the Samsung Galaxy Note 5 is rumoured to either have a Exynos 7430 processor or the Exynos 7422 under the hood that is Samsung’s first all-in-one solution with an integrated CPU, GPU, RAM, storage and modem in a single chip. It is also likely to have 3GB RAM, a 1440 x 2560 Super AMOLED display and a 13 megapixel and 8 megapixel camera combo. You can check out the video for yourself below but as with all rumours, take it with a pinch of salt.

author: soyacincau
title: Microsoft Lumia 640 XL with 4G LTE and Nokia 105 Dual SIM feature phone now available in Malaysia
tags: microsoft,Microsoft Devices,Microsoft Lumia 640 XL,Microsoft Lumia 640 XL Malaysia,Microsoft Lumia 640XL,Microsoft Lumia 640XL 4G,Microsoft Lumia 640XL 4G Malaysia,Microsoft Lumia 640XL Malaysia,Nokia 105,Nokia 105 Dual SIM,Nokia 105 Dual SIM Malaysia,Nokia 105 Malaysia,windows phone
contents: The Microsoft   was   locally a few months ago but it came with a dual-SIM variant that supports up to 3G only. If faster connectivity is a priority, Microsoft Malaysia has announced the arrival of its Lumia 640 XL LTE version with a retail price of RM999. That’s RM70 more than the dual-SIM 3G version. The Lumia 640 XL LTE is Microsoft’s mid-range Windows Phone 8 device. It gets a 5.7″ screen that pushes HD 720p resolution and it is protected with Gorilla Glass 3. Powering the device is a 1.2GHz Quad-Core Snapdragon 400 processor with 1GB RAM and it also comes with 8GB of storage that supports microSD card expansion up to 128GB.  For imaging, it gets a 13MP main camera that shoots 1080p videos at 30fps while the front gets a wide angle 5MP camera. Being a phablet, it gets a 3,000mAh removable battery. It currently runs on Windows Phone 8.1 but it will be upgradable to Windows 10 once it is available.  For those needing just the bare necessities of communication, the Nokia 105 feature phone with Dual-SIM is also available in Malaysia for just RM89. Being an affordable device, it still gets a couple of creature comfort features such as FM radio and a built-in LED torch light.  The Nokia 105 Dual-SIM gets a 1.4″ colour display at 128×128 pixels resolution and it has enough memory to store 2,000 contacts. With its basic features and a 800mAh capacity battery, it is rated to last up to 25 days on standby and 15 hours of talk time on 2G network.

author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus 2 challenges the Mi Note Pro with 4GB RAM
tags: 4GB RAM,OnePlus,oneplus 2,OnePlus 2 Launch,OnePlus 2 Malaysia,OnePlus 2 Price,OnePlus Malaysia,oneplus two,OnePlus Two Price
contents: The upcoming   flagship will be revealed in 3 weeks time and they have dropped another hint as we get closer to its announcement day. Expected to be a new flagship killer for 2015, the OnePlus 2 is now confirmed to be carrying a 4GB of LPDDR4 RAM which puts it on par with the likes of Xiaomi’s  .   To recap what OnePlus have revealed so far, the new model will be running on Qualcomm’s   processor but it will be   at 1.8GHz instead of 2.0GHz for better thermal efficiency. This is expected to help to optimise stability and hopefully it would result longer battery life in the long run. In addition, the OnePlus 2 will be sporting a   reversible charging port which is a new standard that has been adopted on the new MacBook and Nokia N1 tablet. For greater security, OnePlus is including what they claim to be the most   and it is likely to be Qualcomm’s new Sense ID which would work even with contaminated fingertips.  In terms of price, the OnePlus will be priced higher than its current OnePlus One. All we know is it will be   US$322 to US$450 which is around RM1,227 to RM1,716 with our current exchange rates. With the improved specs and features, the OnePlus 2 is still priced lower than Xiaomi’s Mi Note Pro (64GB) which currently carries a price tag of 2,999 CNY (about RM1,843). The OnePlus 2 will be   on 27th July (28th July 10AM Malaysian Time) and you can view it yourself in VR.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: OPPO launches the OPPO R7 lite and R7 Plus in Malaysia
tags: colorOS 2.1,Oppo Malaysia,Oppo R7,oppo r7 lite,oppo r7 lite launch,OPPO R7 Lite Malaysia,OPPO R7 Lite Specs,OPPO R7 Malaysia Launch,oppo R7 plus,oppo R7 plus launch,OPPR R7 Plus Malaysia
contents: The OPPO R7 Plus and R7 lite have finally reached our shores, bringing the brands latest flagship devices to the Malaysian public. Surprisingly, despite being launched earlier in May, the   has yet to land locally despite already passing certification. Instead it is preceded by two of its variants instead. The   has a metal unibody design and powered by an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 processor mated to 3GB RAM under the hood. There’s 32GB of on-board storage which can be expanded with microSD up to 128GB. This is a dual-SIM 4G LTE device, and the microSD slot also doubles up as a 2nd sim slot. The unit will be powered by an enormous 4,100mAh battery which supports VOOC Flash Charging. The R7 Plus will also be running ColorOS 2.1 based on Android 5.1 out of the box. For taking pictures, it gets a 13MP Sony IMX278 camera that’s capable of shooting Ultra HD pictures up to 52MP resolution. For natural illumination, it is supported with dual-tone LED flash. Selfie shots are taken with its 8MP front shooter which comes with auto beautification features. Additionally, the R7 Plus will feature an extra fingerprint scanner at the back that allows you to unlock the phone at a touch. You can view the R7 Plus product page over  . The OPPO R7 lite on the other hand features the same design and 2.5D glass as as the R7 and R7 Plus and will generally have the same specs as its bigger brother albeit with a few differences. The R7 lite will have the same processor and camera combo as the R7 Plus as well as ColourOS 2.1 based on Android 5.1. The unit will have slightly less memory and storage, at 2GB RAM and 16GB internal storage that’s expandable to 128GB via a microSD card. It will also be a dual SIM LTE device like its sibling but will instead play host to a MicroSIM and NanoSIM combo instead of having both slots supporting only NanoSIM. The display will be a 5.0 inch HD AMOLED screen. Battery wise it also is of a lower capacity of 2,320mAh with Fast Charge but given its much slimmer frame of 6.3mm thin, that was probably all they could fit in. The OPPO R7 Plus will retail for RM 1,998 while the R7 lite will be selling for RM 1,298. The R7 Plus will be available in Malaysia starting July 11th for pre-order, with the sales to come early August. Meanwhile the R7 Lite will be made available at a later date. For further reading, you can check out our OPPO R7 Plus and R7 Lite  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The GoPro Hero 4 Session is the tiniest GoPro yet
tags: camera,cool stuff,GoPro,GoPro Hero 4,gopro hero 4 session,GoPro Hero4 Session,hero 4 session,Waterproof
contents: With a tiny body and single button shooting, this is probably the smallest and simplest   the company has ever produced to date. Coming in at $399 (about RM 1521) this tiny cube-shaped shooter measures just 1.5 inches long, is waterproof up to 10 meters and is capable of shooting 1440p video at 30fps. GoPro has done a lot in slimming down their cameras with the Session being the most unobtrusive model they have. It lacks some of the hardware that its bigger brother the  has, but apparently doesn’t slack in terms of capability. In a sense, the device is in the same vein as the  and the  which also run on the same single button style of operation. The two are also a lot more affordable than the Session, with them being priced at RM 669 (from  )and RM 429 respectively. While the Session does come with a strap, the HTC RE is probably easier to hold on to as it has a more ergonomic shape, albeit one shaped like a plastic tube. However, if you want to change any of the settings on the camera you have to use included Wi-Fi remote (which is sold seperately) or go through the GoPro’s mobile app. It does have an absolutely tiny screen at the top of it but this is mainly to show you your battery level and active settings. You will still have to rely on an external device to view your videos and images. The Session also has two mics, one at the front and one at the rear that switch dynamically to reduce wind noise. For storage, the Session can handle any microSD card with a class 10 or UHS-1 rating up to a capacity of 64GB. How much you will be able to cram into it though, depends a lot on your recording resolution. There are some drawbacks to its compact size, one being it is incapable of recording in 4K, takes stills in 8 megapixels only and cannot record video above 100fps. But these seem to be relatively small trade-offs for what you’re already getting in this compact form factor. Regardless, like all GoPro devices the Session will have access to a small mountain of mounting options and accessories to choose from, which makes it even more versatile. The GoPro Hero 4 Session is set to hit the market sometime next week, though we don’t know if it will be getting a Malaysian launch just yet. In the mean time, you can check out its product page  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung apparently has a new flip phone, and it has a Snapdragon 808
tags: android 5.1.1,clamshell,rumour mill,Samsung,samsung flip phone,samsung SM-G9198,SM-G9198,smartphone,snapdragon 808
contents: is still producing flip phones as it were, with the successor to the Samsung G9098 hitting China’s TENAA very recently. But this is no clam shell to scoff at, it has a 1.8GHz hexa-core Snapdragon 808 under the hood, 2GB RAM and 16GB expandable memory up to 128GB. The Samsung SM-G9198, as it is called will be home to two 3.91 inch AMOLED screens with a resolution of 1280 x 768 and will be relatively heavy, weighing in at 191 grams.  The SM-G9198 measures in at 119.7x 66.6 x 16.7 mm when closed so expect it to be pretty thick . The device will be booting Android 5.1.1 Lollipop out of the box and will have a 16 megapixel main snapper with a 5 megapixel front shooter. The flip phone is also going to have a heart rate sensor and 4G LTE connectivity so you essentially have here a phone that is practically a flagship in a clamshell form. There is no word on a launch date but we aren’t likely to see this phone outside of China, but its sort of nice to see that high end flip phones haven’t gone extinct entirely.

author: soyacincau
title: OPPO R7 Plus and R7 Lite First Impressions
tags: Android,Dual Sim,Hands-on,Oppo Malaysia,Oppo R7,oppo r7 lite,OPPO R7 Lite Hands-on,OPPO R7 Lite Malaysia,oppo R7 plus,OPPO R7 Plus Malaysia,OPPO R7 Series
contents: OPPO has   its  , its latest offering for the Malaysia market. Announced  , OPPO Malaysia is bringing 2 models, the   phablet and a more compact R7 Lite. For the Malaysian market, we won’t be getting the original R7 but instead we are getting the   that offers lower specs and it carries a much lower price tag.  As other manufacturers have been pushing specs for their new flagship models, OPPO on the other hand decides to focus on premium design with slimness as their main highlight. Powering the devices is a mid-range Snapdragon 615 Octa-Core processor that’s also found on the  ,   and  . The R7 series offers a unibody metal frame which is apparently inspired by the design of a violin. It is thin to hold but the R7 isn’t as thin as their once world record holder, the R5 which boast a ridiculously thin 4.85mm side profile.  The R7 Plus is a huge device with a 6″ Full HD AMOLED display but it manages to boast a high screen to body ratio with the use of on-screen buttons for the front. Overall it feels quite a well polished device with the use of 2.5D glass which makes the edge smoother to touch and it manages to keep its bulk in check with a 7.75mm thickness. With a 4,100mAh capacity battery, it feels heavier at 203 grams, but at least it’s lighter than the former 5.9″ OPPO N1 (213 grams). From a design perspective, it does   of the   which coincidentally also comes with a 6″ display, a rear mounted fingerprint scanner and a 4,100mAh capacity battery. In terms of specs, the Mate 7 may have a better processor but it loses out in the camera and fast charging department.  Under the hood, the R7 Plus gets a Snapdragon 615 processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM with 32GB of on-board storage. You can expand up to 128GB extra via microSD card which would utilise its secondary SIM tray slot. Connectivity wise, the R7 Plus supports 4G LTE on both SIM slots as well as WiFi 802.11ac and Bluetooth 4.0.  In the camera department, the main shooter uses Sony’s 13MP IMX278 camera sensor that’s similarly found on the Huawei P8. It boasts a quicker 0.1 second focus time with its Phase Detection AF and the sensor is a 4-colour RGBW unit. It is assisted with a dual-tone LED flash and there’s a laser auto focus light for guidance. Over at the front, there’s an 8MP camera with Beautify 3.0 selfie feature.   Out of the box, the R7 Plus is running on their latest iteration of ColorOS 2.1 which is based on Android 5.1 Lollipop. Finally OPPO has a smart phone that runs on a newer operating system as the past few models have been stuck with KitKat or an older version. According to OPPO, the new ColorOS has been improved for faster boot times, stability and smoothness. In our short playtime, it does feel quick and that’s to be expected with a fresh new device with 3GB RAM. Like its previous flagship offering, you can double tap to wake or launch apps from sleep by drawing gestures on the screen.  Also supported is VOOC Flash Charging which boast faster charging in a shorter time. During its media launch, we are told that the R7 Plus is still capable of doing 75% charge in just 30 minutes, and a 5 minutes charge is enough to sustain 2 hours of talk time which is quite remarkable. Priced at RM1,998, the R7 Plus is quite a high price to pay for a Snapdragon 615 powered device but it tries to make up for it by having a larger screen, bigger battery capacity and having a more premium build quality. The R7 Plus will be open for pre-orders on 11th July with official availability targeted for early August. : We’ve been informed that the “OPPO R7 Lite” shown here is actually the original R7 that comes with a Full HD display and has 3GB of RAM. However the exterior design and dimensions are identical with the OPPO R7 Lite.  The next device is the R7 Lite which is priced at RM1,298. When we asked why is OPPO offering the R7 Lite instead of the full fledged R7 in Malaysia, we are told that this is to cater for a price sensitive segment since the R7 Lite is priced at RM700 lower than its top of the line R7 Plus. On the exterior, this is essentially the same R7 with a 5″ display but it is downgraded in terms of RAM with just 2GB (instead of 3GB) while the screen resolution pushes a standard HD 720p resolution instead of Full HD.  The build quality is similar with its R7 Plus with a metal unibody design as well as a smoothen-out 2.5D glass for the front. The R7 Lite feels more refined with more curves and polished frame, as opposed to its similar spec-ed R1x that has more sharp edges. On the front it gets 3 capacitive buttons which are not illuminated, while the back gets a clean metal back with its camera and LED flash being positioned at the top left corner. In terms of thickness, the R7 Lite is 6.3mm thin, which is the same as the Galaxy A7, Samsung’s thinnest smart phone at the moment.  The speaker like its bigger R7 Plus sibling is positioned at the back of the device, which we felt could better place on the bottom of the device. For taking pictures, it gets a 13MP main camera while the front get a high resolution 8MP shooter. Being a “Lite” device, another omission is the lack of VOOC Flash Charge but it still claims to have a Fast Charger without mentioning its actual charge rate.  Under the hood, it gets 2GB RAM, 16GB of storage and it also supports dual-SIM with 4G LTE. If you need to expand more storage, the 2nd slim slot also doubles up as a microSD expansion. During the launch, the R7 Lite is still running on KitKat but we’re told that it will be running on the latest ColorOS 2.1 with Android 5.1 by the time it goes on sale. It’s a nice device but it is quite hard to recommend this over higher spec smart phones within the same price range like the highest spec ASUS ZenFone 2, OnePlus One or Honor 6.

author: soyacincau
title: Want a flagship HTC without paying top dollar? The dual-SIM HTC One ME is here.
tags: Android,DirectD,Dual Sim,htc one me,HTC One ME Malaysia,HTC One ME Price,smart phone
contents: HTC”s current top of the line smart phone is the   which offers a 5.2″ Quad HD display and a 2.2GHz Octa-Core MediaTek MT6795 processor for RM2,599. If you’re looking for something cheaper without much compromise, the   might be your cup of tea. Announced for the  , the One ME is now available in Malaysia via DirectD and this is a grey import unit which comes with 2 years in-house warranty. You get pretty much the same goods as the One M9+ but at RM700 less. This is similar story as the   and its cheaper   sibling. To recap on the One ME, it gets the same 5.2″ Quad HD display, 2.2GHz Octa-Core MediaTek processor with 3GB RAM, 32GB of storage and it is also expandable with microSD up to 128GB (possibly up to 2TB). On the exterior, it is identical but it is slightly thicker at 9.75mm and lighter at 155 grams. This is due to its polycarbonate back but it still uses a metal frame around the sides for a subtle touch of premium.  Over at the front, you still get its stereo BoomSound speakers, a fingerprint sensor and a 4MP Ultrapixel front camera. Meanwhile at the back, it gets a 20MP main camera with dual-LED flash like its One M9, which is a single unit without the extra Duo Camera set up. Powering the device is still the same 2,840mAh capacity battery which is also non-removable. The One ME is a dual-SIM device using Nano-SIM and it also supports 4G LTE including our local Band 3/7.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: This hands-free Tinder concept app uses your heart to swipe your crush
tags: apple,Apple Watch,concept app,hands free tinder,mobile app,t3 hands free tinder,t3 tinder,tinder
contents: What happens when you take the   app and stuff it on a device with a heartbeat sensor? you essentially get a hands free Tinder experience that runs by your heart instead of your head. Most of the time, when we pop up Tinder we are using our brains (and eyes, mostly) to pick a potential date, but this app concept from T3 uses your   ‘s pulse sensor to deduce whether or not to swipe left or right. Video after the break. How this works is the app shows you pictures and profiles as usual but uses the Apple Watch SDK to make use of the pulse sensor to detect even minor heart rate elevations. In a nutshell, the app decides whether to swipe left or right based on how “excited” your heart gets when presented with a potential candidate. Granted working just based on your basal reactions to pictures of pretty people doesn’t entirely sound like it might work, but its a pretty novel concept on its own. The app is still in the concept phase for now, but you can check out the video below to get a peek at how it could work. So do you think this would make a good app for the Apple Watch?

author: Sirap Bandung
title: U Mobile offers the Huawei P8 from RM546
tags: Huawei P8,p8,talkband b2 sport,U Mobile,u mobile huawei p8,u mobile ultimate device plan,ultimate device plan
contents: If you’ve been wanting to get your hands on the  , now U Mobile is offering the smartphone on contact starting from RM 546, not too long after  has started offering the device as well. To recap on the specs, the Huawei P8 has a 5.2″ Full HD display and it runs on their in-house 64-bit Kirin 930 Octa-Core processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. There’s 16GB of storage, with dual-SIM 4G LTE and it supports microSD expansion via its 2nd SIM card slot. For the camera, it has the world’s first 13MP shooter with 4-colour RGBW sensor and it is further assisted with Optical Image Stabiliser that claims to tolerate shakes 2X better than other competing flagships. Meanwhile the front boast a 8MP front facing camera with a host of beautification features. The Huawei P8 retails for RM 1,799 off the shelf. Its however a little weird that U Mobile is still using the Ascend naming convention despite Huawei having dropped it starting with the P8. The base Ultimate Device Plan 65 comes with 3GB of mobile data and 60 minutes of voice calls to all network. For internet, there’s no extra charge for excess usage but speeds will be throttled. If you need something bigger, the Ultimate Device 95 plan offers 5GB of data and 90 minutes of calls for RM95/month. For heavy usage users, the Ultimate Device Plan 135 comes with 6GB of data, 130 minutes of calls and 65 SMS to all network. The excess usage rates are similar across all three plans with voice calls being charged at 5 sen per 30 seconds (10 sen/minute). Meanwhile SMS are charged at 3 sen each within U Mobile and 8 sen to other networks. If you sign up now, you can also snag yourself a free TalkBand B2 Sport as well as a powerbank and casing to go along with it. The plan basically comes in three flavours, with pricing as follows: During sign up, you’ll need to fork out between RM360-RM960 depending on plan as an advance payment. This will be rebated back to your bills on a monthly basis. However this can be waived if you purchase the device via credit card and if you opt-in for their monthly auto debit payment. On top of that, they are also offering  a 0% Easy Payment Plan if you’re a credit credit card holder of CIMB, Maybank, HSBC, RHB, Ambank, UOB, Standard Chartered and Citibank. For more information, you can visit the page  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Apple is changing the price of their apps, could be more expensive or cheaper depending on your country
tags: app price increase,App Store,apple,apple app store,apple app store increase
contents: is set to change the pricing for their apps and how drastic the change will depend a lot on what country you’re in. The company notified developers of this earlier this week, with the changes due to hit sometime today. The countries already set to have a price increase are Mexico, South Africa, South Korea and Turkey, with South Korea’s price hike due to a 10% value-added (VAT) tax which is now included in the price of apps. Developers in that country would have to handle the tax on their own while Apple will collect and pay the tax for developers based outside of the country. As for the rest, it has to do with exchange rates. Users in those countries who have auto-renewable subscriptions will have to resubscribe to follow the new pricings, but they will be notified by Apple and given the option to re-enable or opt out. Mexican users on the other hand will not have interruptions to their services but will be given the same options. On the other hand, Apple is making two new low-price tiers available for India, Indonesia, Mexico, Russia, South Africa and Turkey called Alternate Tier A and Alternate Tier B, which has already been active in the Chinese market. But it seems a bit weird that Mexico, South Africa and Turkey are getting a price increase but are also subject to the two new low-price tiers, so what exactly is Apple going to be doing for these three countries? As for us, we don’t know yet if we will be affected by the fluctuations (our currency is taking a divebomb after all) so will we see higher or lower prices for the Malaysia market? What do you think?

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Better looking Instagram photos inbound as it goes 1080p
tags: camera apps,Instagram,instagram 1080p,Instagram App,mobile apps
contents: Instagram is finally getting with the times and is in the process of allowing users to display higher res images on the popular platform. Initially, images uploaded to Instagram were only being displayed at 640 x 640 resolution, which is markedly small by today’s standards. But starting last week it seems that images being uploaded are being saved in 1080p resolution, probably in the process of getting the platform ready for the switch. Instagram themselves originally denied that they are saving images at any higher than 640 x 640, but the program is undoubtedly saving and displaying images at a much higher resolution than before. They’ve now confirmed that they will gradually be rolling out the feature for iOS and Android, but the web version won’t be getting any love just yet. For now the only way to spot it at the moment is by delving into the image’s source code on Instagram web, where the first link with the .jpg suffix will tell you the image’s size via a browser like Chrome or Firefox. Checking the image out on mobile (as in, your phone’s Instagram folder) still displays the original resolution which it was snapped in, which in turn is reliant on your phone’s camera. We don’t quite know why they are limiting the new image size for the desktop version but this is already great news for Instagrammers as they won’t have their images as compressed as they used to be. Image credit

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Apple Watch’s first swimming app is not made for a watch built for a dip
tags: apple,Apple Watch,mobile app,mobile device,SmartWatch,swimming app,watch,wearable
contents: The Apple Watch’s first ever swimming app has surfaced, but cannot be listed on the App Store because the Watch is not designed to handle an afternoon swim. With an IP certification of IP X7, the watch can basically handle being submerged for up to 30 minutes in up to a metre deep of water with no issue but even then Apple doesn’t recommend wearing it to the pool. Developer Ted Bradley is the guy behind the app, having written a similar one for the Pebble and porting it over to the Apple Watch. Granted he had issues porting it over due to differences between the interfaces and the complexity of the OS. Like on the Pebble apps stay open till the user closes it while on the Watch the screen shuts off to save on power, causing the app to stop measuring real time data. However there are APIs in place that allow the Watch to recall data stored while the screen is off, so once the screen is back on you get the rest of the information, albeit with a bit of lag. The info can also be imported to HealthKit to measure the number of laps completed and distance covered, making use of the heart rate sensor as well. As well as the app works, Apple does not endorse apps that encourage users to use an Apple device in ways that could possibly damage it, hence why you will never find it on the App Store. Bradley and his team does hope that the next gen Apple Watch has better waterproofing so apps like his can really get the most out of the Watch.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Is your iPhone’s GPS acting up after iOS 8.4 update? Here are some solutions
tags: apple,Apple iPhone,bug fix,GPS,iOS,iOS 8.4,ios 8.4 gps bug,iPhone
contents: Having issues with your GPS after your iPhone is updated to  ? You’re not alone. The update generally made it a struggle for iOS 8.4 users to use turn-by-turn navigation and other functions of navigation software like Apple Maps, Google Maps and Waze. But do not fret, we have some solutions to help you tackle the problem. There are three ways you can attempt to fix the GPS issue, either by resetting your network settings, turning location services on or off and even backup and restore fresh using iTunes. To reset your network settings, head on over to the Settings app and then head over to General > Reset > Reset Network Settings. This will reset all your network settings and wipe your WiFi password but it will help fix the problem. Another alternative is turning the location services of and off. It’s slightly trickier than the above solution but its well worth it. First head on over to your Location Services in your settings in this order Settings > Privacy  > Location Services, and turn the switch off. Next restart your iPhone and turn the switch back on and the problem should be rectified. The last one is the hardest to do and should be used as a last resort should all else fail. Make sure you have backed up everything using iTunes or iCloud before you do this, and restore fresh to iOS 8.4 using iTunes. It’s a long process but there is a chance it might fix the GPS issue. You can grab the   here. The last alternative however, if you couldn’t fix it using any of the methods above is to wait for Apple to release a fix themselves, though it does mean you won’t be able to get around too much if you’re the sort that gets lost a lot. Good luck!

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Android Wear devices can now play YouTube Videos, but why?
tags: Android,Android Wear,android wear video player,Google Play,SmartWatch,Video,wearable,youtube
contents: Smart watches are awesome, frankly they are. But for all they can do, most of them cannot play video for obvious reasons. Now you can watch YouTube videos on your  device, if you couldn’t figure out any other way to drain its battery faster. The app, named Video for Android Wear & YouTube, will allow you to watch videos on your Android Wear compatible devices and search for videos via an extremely claustrophobic interface. But hey, you can now watch stuff on your watch. Technically it doesn’t even work if your smartwatch lacks speakers but you can still cast to any Chromecast-capable device or pair it up to anything with Android speakers or headphones. While its really cool to be able to watch videos on your smartwatch, do yourself a favour and pair it to your smartphone instead. It does have a bigger screen after all. You can download Video for Android Wear  and its free.

author: soyacincau
title: Maxis doubles up SurfMore 50 quota to 4GB for 6 months
tags: Maxis,Maxis postpaid,Maxis SurfMore 50,Postpaid,SurfMore 50
contents: Consumers are getting spoiled for choice when it comes to affordable data plans. We’ve seen  ,   and most recently   engaged in a price war where you can get a postpaid plan with 3GB of data for less than RM40/month. Meanwhile over at Maxis, the most affordable option is their SurfMore 50 plan which comes with 2GB of data at RM50/month. To sweeten the deal, they are now doubling its data quota from 2GB to 4GB for 6 months. This is applicable for new subscribers that signed up from 25th June until 31st July 2015, and they are extending this to their current subscribers as well. If you’re currently on SurfMore 50, you should have received an SMS about this offer and they will allocate the extra data within 7 days. While this is a good move, Maxis should really consider making its data plans more affordable. After the   of its MaxisOne plan, they have discontinued its   plan (5GB for RM75) and topping up extra data is rather costly at RM35/GB on SurfMore or RM30/GB on MaxisOne Plan.  Then of course, there’s a concern of network quality which Maxis claims to have the   in the countries. While telcos can start throwing prices for their postpaid plans, the real challenge is whether they can maintain their network quality and bandwidth. Recently they have invested over RM1 billion to upgrade their network and from the looks of it, we don’t expect them to play the cheap data game anytime soon.

author: soyacincau
title: New BlackBerry certified in Malaysia. Is this the new “Dallas”?
tags: blackberry,BlackBerry 10,BlackBerry Dallas,BlackBerry Dallas Malaysia,blackberry malaysia,blackberry oslo,BlackBerry Passport,BlackBerry SQW100-4,BlackBerry SQW100-4 Malaysia,SIRIM,smart phone
contents: Before BlackBerry releases their  , a new   device is in the works with the codename  . Now it appears that Malaysia could be one of the first market to get it as a new model with the model number SQW100-4 was spotted in SIRIM.  The BlackBerry Passport carries the model number SQW100-1 and this new model looks like a new refresh of its high-end business device. The new model has yet to be announced and word has it that it could be the new   which comes with a silver colour finish. The new BlackBerry “Dallas” was recently leaked with very similar form factor as the current Passport but it gets some subtle exterior difference. Underneath, it gets the same 2.2GHz Snapdragon 801 processor with 3GB of RAM, 3,450mAh capacity battery and the similar set of 3-row QWERTY keys. The back also gets the same 13MP OIS camera and likely the front maintains the same 4.5″ 1440×1440 pixels resolution display. Out of the box, it should be running on a newer BlackBerry OS 10.3.2 with its own host of business solutions like Blackberry Blend and BlackBerry Assistant. For those who feel that the Passport is too wide, your current alternatives would be the   and  .

author: soyacincau
title: Got money to burn? You can pre-order a Galaxy S6 edge Iron Man edition in Malaysia
