tags: DirectD,Iron Man,Marvel,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Iron Man,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Iron Man Edition Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Iron Man Edition Price,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Iron Man Limited Edition,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 Iron Man,The Avengers,The Avengers Edition
contents: Samsung is trying to show the world that they could make a premium device. The   and   finally gets a newer metal and glass design which is a departure from its old plasticky build. If spending RM3,599 for the   of the Galaxy S6 edge isn’t enough, the limited edition   colours can now be bought in Malaysia. You’ve probably seen the iPhone 6 Plus being sold at over RM7,000 by scalpers. Get ready, as the asking price for the S6 edge Iron Man edition will surprise you. The Galaxy S6 edge Iron Man edition is sold only in selected markets such as China and South Korea. As usual, the folks at DirectD can let you own one of these rare units but only if you’re willing to pay the price. In South Korea with 1,000 units to go around, the Iron Man themed device is priced at 1.19 million Won which is slightly more than RM4,000. If you’re dying to buy one, DirectD can make it happen for RM10,999, with GST included of course. You get the Galaxy S6 edge in a nice exclusive box and it comes with a wireless charger with Iron Man’s core reactor design on top. As for the device, the Galaxy S6 edge gets a stunning red colour body surrounded by a gold colour frame. Everything else in the phone is the same, and it also comes with 64GB of non-expandable storage on-board. For some, RM10,999 could be a bargain considering a unit was   for about RM340,000 in China and that’s because of a double digit serial number 66. After all, this is a country with a growing wealthy population which a guy can afford to buy not one, but  . If you’re interested and money is no object to you, head over to   to pre-order yours. Sorry, JARVIS isn’t included.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: LG G Pro 3 leaked specs released, will have pupil recognition
tags: @leaksfly,Android 5.1,leak,LG,lg g3 pro,LG smartphone,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: We just caught wind that the LG G Pro 3 is on its way thanks to twitter tipster  , and its going to have some tasty specs on top of pupil recognition. is basically the successor to the   which is pictured above. There haven’t been any conclusive leaked images of the phones yet but its likely to be pretty premium. Under the hood, the phone will have a Snapdragon 820 chipset mated to 4GB RAM as well as 32GB expandable memory. The display is set to be a huge 6 inch 1440 x 2560 resolution screen with a 490 ppi pixel density. The rear of the camera will be home to a 20.7 megapixel snapper and what’s likely to be a 8 megapixel selfie snapper up front. Its also rumoured to have Android 5.1 preinstalled as well. The leak also details support for pupil recognition and a fingerprint scanner. This wouldn’t be   to sport similar tech, but it’s not likely to be the last. The LG G Pro 3 is estimated to hit the market sometime before the end of this year and is likely to be priced around the $790 mark (about RM 2992) but any of this could be subject to change when the real launch comes around so like any rumour, take it with a pinch of salt.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Mid-range LG G4 S details leaked, only looks similar to the LG G4
tags: Android,LG,LG G4,lg g4c,LG G4S,LG smartphone,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: Looks like LG is seriously on a roll, releasing mid-range phones one after the other. The latest device to leak is the LG G4S, which is rumoured to be better than the   complete with a better processor and a larger, crisper screen. In terms of styling it is going to share the same design aesthetic as its flagship sibling the  ,  but this is mostly where the similarities end. The device is rumoured to have an octa-core processor clocking 1.5GHz (which is likely to be a Snapdragon 615) an 8 megapixel camera with laser autofocus. The display will be a 5.2 inch 1080p screen that is similar to what the   has. Nothing else has been revealed so far, especially about the remaining specs as well as a price and launch date so all we can do is sit tight and wait for LG to let the cat out of the bag.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Redmi 2 in Malaysia gets permanent price cut to RM399
tags: Raya Promo,Redmi 2,redmi 2 price reduction,redmi smartphone,smartphone,xiaomi promo,Xiaomi Redmi 2,xiaomi redmi 2 price reduction
contents: Mi Malaysia has just announced that the Redmi 2 is having its price cut from RM 449 to RM 399. Launched earlier this year in March, the phone is now going to be RM 50 cheaper compared to its initial launch price, making their cheapest smartphone even cheaper. To recap on the specs, the Redmi 2 is Xiaomi’s first device to sport a 64-bit processor and 4G dual-SIM. Under the hood it has the aforementioned 64-bit quad core Snapdragon 410 processor mated to 1GB RAM and 8GB storage expandable up to 32GB. The display on the other hand is 4.7 inch 1280 x 720p HD screen at 312 ppi. It also has 4G Dual SIM support, a 8 megapixel rear and 2 megapixel front camera combo as well as a 2,200mAh battery with Quick Charge 1.0.

author: soyacincau
title: Mi Band with Heart Rate Sensor spotted. Can it take on Fitbit?
tags: Heart Rate monitoring,heart rate sensor,Mi Band 1S,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Mi Band,Xiaomi Mi Band 1S
contents: The Xiaomi   has been a tremendous success and it is currently the #2 smart wearable device with  . It is no surprise that they could sell 2.8 million units especially when it has a low RM59 price tag and an impressive month-long battery life. Now a newer version is in the works and Xiaomi appears to be upping its game with the inclusion of a heart rate sensor. An unconfirmed source claims that the new Mi Band was spotted in Taiwan’s NCC certification body as the Mi Band 1S. From the purported leaked photo, it shows a similar design but it gets an extra sensor underneath. In terms of wearable devices,   is still number 1 with over 3.9 million units sold, taking about 34% market share. In comparison with other wearables, Fitbit is solely focused on fitness and they currently have   in Malaysia. Its Charge HR (RM510) and Surge (RM968) wearables offer continuous heart rate monitoring and they last 7 days on a single charge. This is quite remarkable considering other smart watches only offer heart rate reading on demand or at specific time intervals.  Obviously the new Mi Band 1S with a heart rate sensor would take a hit in battery life. But who knows if they can tweak to to last more than 7 days and if they priced this correctly, Xiaomi might have a chance to overtake Fitbit by end of this year. The main difference of course is the platform and fitness community which Fitbit has established firmly. Xiaomi isn’t on par yet but if it is cheap, there’s nothing much to complain if it just works.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The real voice behind Siri gives us a glimpse into the world of voice overs
tags: apple,original siri voice,Siri,siri voice,susan benett,Video,voice acting,vox
contents: Have you ever wondered what is like for someone to lend their voice to a program that people hear every day? Our technology still hasn’t really gotten to a level where you can perfectly simulate someone’s voice so people like Susan Bennett, the lady behind the voice of Siri, gives life to advertisements and that personal assistant we know and love. This slightly satirical video by   gives us a glimpse on what its like to be a voice actor and how they can use their voice to influence you on a day to day basis. Video after the break.

author: soyacincau
title: AirAsia now lets you tweet from 30,000ft in the air
tags: airasia,AirAsia in-flight WiFi,AirAsia Rokki Chats,AirAsia Tweet On-board,AirAsia WiFi,Airlines,Free User Trial,In Flight WiFi,Line,Rokki Chats,Twitter,WiFi
contents: In addition to AirAsia’s on-board  , you can now use Twitter in the air. Powered by Rokki, the in-flight WiFi service was initially introduced just for  . This lets you access popular IM apps such as WeChat, WhatsApp, LINE and Kakaotalk, while Viber will be supported soon. Now they have added Twitter into its list and you can subscribe to it at RM9/flight. Do take note that there’s a quota of just 3MB and speeds will be throttled after that. Not all AirAsia flights are supported and it is currently available at about 4,000 flights each month which AirAsia is still working on expanding its availability. According to  , GST will be imposed for domestic travel within Malaysia and it will be exempted for international flights. Would you spend RM9 on a flight for basic internet access just for messaging?

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi sold 34.7 million phones in first half of 2015
tags: Mi Malaysia,Xiaomi,XIaomi H1 2015 Sales,Xiaomi Malaysia,Xiaomi Sales,Xiaomi Smart Phone sales
contents: Xiaomi is still continuing to grow at a rapid pace and they have sold 34.7 million smart phones in the first 6 months of 2015. This marks a 33% increase from the same period last year where they have sold  .  Last year alone, Xiaomi is reported to have sold 65 million units, with most of them coming from their affordable Redmi series. For 2015, they have an ambitious goal to ship   which is possible with its presence in big markets such as China and India.  One of their recent sales milestone was their   which saw 2.12 million smart phones being sold in just 12 hours. 70% of Xiaomi’s smart phone sales came directly from their Mi.com online store, which signifies the importance of selling directly to customers.

author: soyacincau
title: VIDEO: Apple Watch Hands-on Review
tags: apple,Apple Smart Watch,Apple Watch,Apple Watch Features,Apple Watch Malaysia,Apple Watch Malaysia Review,Apple Watch Review,apple watch sport,Apple Watch Sport Review,Smart Watch,WatchOS
contents: The   is now on sale in Singapore with its starting price of S$519 (about RM1,447) for the 38mm Apple Watch Sport model. If you don’t want to buy one with huge markups from grey importers, you can get one   at the lion city. So far there’s no news of it being available in Malaysia anytime soon despite being   a couple of months back.   Is the Apple Watch a worthy investment? And does it offer useful features that’s better than other smart watches in the market? This is Apple’s newest product line which claims to be their most personal offering yet. It has heaps of customisation which can drive the price up to  . Find out more in our Apple Watch video review after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Logitech Bluetooth Multi-Device Keyboard K480 has finally arrived in Malaysia
tags: 3in1 Bluetooth Keyboard,Bluetooth,Logitech,logitech k480,Logitech K480 Keyboard Malaysia,logitech keyboard,Logitech Malaysia,logitech multi-device keyboard k480,mobile accessory,Multi Device Keyboard
contents: If you are the sort that likes to multitask with lots of devices at once but would rather not have the hassle of connecting and disconnecting your keyboard, then you’re in luck. Logitech’s award winning multi-tasker keyboard is finally available for purchase locally. This is the  Bluetooth Multi-Device Keyboard K480, a keyboard designed specifically for typing across any three devices at any one point of time regardless of the platform. Compatible with your PC, tablet or smartphone, the almost-full-sized universal keyboard can switch between devices without needing to be disconnected. Just flick the Easy-Switch dial to swap the keyboard between devices and you can jump from typing a tweet on your smartphone to writing your report on your PC. People who like working on the go will particularly find this useful, on top of benefiting from a larger keyboard when working on mobile. The keyboard also features a built in stand to hold your smartphone or tablet at the right angle for best viewing while you work, and can accomodate even larger sized tablets easily. The K480 will come in two colour options, black with yellow accents or white with silver. The device is compatible with any Windows, Mac, Chrome OS computer as well as any Android or iOS tablet or smartphone and will be retailing at authorised retailers for RM 179 inclusive of GST. For more info, you can head over to Logitech’s Multi-Device Keyboard K480  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Is Samsung embedding spy chips in your phone? Probably not.
contents: We’ve all heard it at least once, the government just loves to spy on people by putting additional chips in your phone to monitor your every move. Every little thing out of place could be home to that very chip that they’re tracking all your calls with, waiting for the right bit of juicy information to use as an excuse to whisk you off, never to be seen again. Smartphones are pretty complicated as they are, and if you open yours you are likely to find a lot of things you don’t understand within. In particular, Samsung batteries have attracted attention recently for “hiding” spy chips within, leading people to actually peel them open to remove the little coil inside.    The truth is that’s just an NFC (Near Field Communication) antenna. People outside the tech bubble probably don’t even know what NFC is, and videos circulating about people removing the receiver has sparked a fair bit of paranoia. As the claim goes, the chip is supposedly communicating wirelessly with other sources and is leaking your data and photos without your knowledge. While the wireless communication bit is true (that’s what NFC is designed to do) but trust us, the government probably doesn’t want to see what you’ve been doing on Facebook all day. Plus you’ll need another device to physically touch the NFC panel in order for information to be exchanged.    The myth was likely originally perpetuated by  ; who has been repeatedly   by many people, including a   that Samsung was spying on him with the said mysterious chip. Most Samsung smart phones from the Galaxy S III has an NFC antenna embedded with the battery. This would then allows you to beam files with another NFC enabled device directly from the back of the smart phone. If you’re not convinced yet, this Samsung battery spying myth has been  . At any rate, it is extremely ill advised to attempt opening up anything on your phone, especially  . Please don’t try this for yourself and leave your tinfoil hats at home.

author: soyacincau
title: Just how strong is the Honor 7? Watch this explosive test
tags: explosion,Honor 7,Honor 7 Destruction,Honor 7 Durability Test,Honor 7 explosive test,Honor 7 video,Huawei Honor 7
contents: The new   gets a more upmarket build compared to its predecessor but is it tough enough to withstand your day to day abuses? To find out in the most extreme manner, they’ve placed an Honor 7 on top of some explosives and tried to blow it up to smithereens.  With the high impact and temperatures hitting as high as 1200 degrees Celsius, the chances of any mobile devices surviving is extremely thin. But you’ll be surprised with the result of this test. As always, don’t try this at home.  Watch the video after the break.

author: soyacincau
title: Honor 7 is now official. Goes upmarket with a fingerprint scanner and greater voice controls
tags: Honor,Honor 7,Honor 7 official,Honor 7 Specs,Honor Malaysia,huawei,Huawei Honor,Huawei Honor 7,Huawei Honor 7 Launch
contents: Huawei has finally announced its new  , which will replace its current   smart phone. The Honor 6 is one of our favourite 5″ flagship devices which is now going for RM899. The Honor brand is supposedly Huawei’s answer to the growing demand of high spec smart phones with a more affordable price tag.  With the new Honor 7, it looks like the aggressive sub-brand is taking a more premium step. Like its predecessor, the Honor 7 appears to be better than the current   flagship and it even shares some similarities with its larger   phablet. For starters, the Honor 7 gets an aluminium alloy shell for both front and back which not only gives it better durability but it also helps to improve thermal efficiency. The front gets a slightly larger 5.2″ Full HD display, which is similar to its current Huawei P8. Powering the device is their top of the line Kirin 935 64-bit Octa-Core processor which utilises 4x A53 Cores @ 2.2GHz + 4x A53 Cores @ 1.5GHz. This is mated to 3GB of LPDDR3 RAM and depending on variant, you get either 16GB or 64GB of on-board storage. The Honor 7 is also a dual-SIM 4G LTE device and the secondary SIM slot also accepts microSD expansion up to 128GB.  Camera is quite a big deal for the Honor 7. The back gets a 20MP f/2.0   Exmor RS sensor which comes with fast Phase Detection Auto Focus. Meanwhile the front gets a 8MP f/2.4 selfie camera with 1.4micron pixel size, a 26mm wide angle lens and a soft flash for better illumination. Like most Chinese smart phones, it gets their latest version of their auto beautification feature. Powering the Honor 7 is a similar capacity 3,100mAh battery as the predecessor but now it supports quick charge that does 50% in just 30 minutes. Also included at the back is a new generation one touch fingerprint scanner which claims to unlock in just 0.5 seconds.   Another major highlight is the Honor 7’s voice controls which you can get it to launch apps or play music without waking your device physically, similar to the  . On the left side, there’s a dedicated button which calls up “ZhiLing”, supposedly Honor’s answer to the likes of Siri and Google Now. For now, it looks like this is applicable for the Chinese market and we’re not too sure if this will be rolled out for our region. Overall, the Honor 7 is 8.5mm thick and weighs 157 grams, which is heavier and thicker than the current Honor 6 at 7.5mm and 130 grams. According to  , the Honor 7 with 16GB storage starts from 1,999 CNY (about RM1,217) and it goes all the way up to 2,499 CNY (about RM1,521) for the 64GB version. Out of the box, it runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop with EMUI 3.1.  For more info, visit Honor 7’s  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Purported Galaxy Note 5 case render appears. Could this be Samsung’s next big thing?
tags: Android,galaxy note 5,leak,rumour mill,Samsung,samsung galaxy note 5,samsung galaxy note 5 render,smartphone
contents: Samsung is expected to launch the   flagship sometime this September, but some renders for the device have already shown up on the web. This is currently the sharpest image we’ve got of the upcoming smartphone, complete with what looks like a ruggedised an outer casing. The renders however still don’t reveal all that much besides the S-Pen compartment and the speakers being located at the bottom of the phone instead of the rear like what they did with the   and . The camera also appears to be protruding at the back which is quite common among Samsung’s more current devices. If they are following the same design philosophy as they have with the S6 and S6 edge the Note 5 would likely have a glass back as well. To recap, the Samsung Galaxy Note 5 is rumoured to either have a Exynos 7430 processor or the Exynos 7422 under the hood that is Samsung’s first all-in-one solution with an integrated CPU, GPU, RAM, storage and modem in a single chip. It is also likely to have 3GB RAM, a 1440 x 2560 Super AMOLED display and a 13 megapixel and 8 megapixel camera combo. It also also rumoured to have a 3,220 mAh battery and would possibly be running Android Lollipop out of the box. There’s still a fair bit of time to go between the launch so there’s still a chance that any of this might change so we suggest taking this with a pinch of salt. But there’s surely more to come as IFA2015 draws closer.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Newly leaked images of the Motorola Moto G (2015) have surfaced
tags: Moto G,moto g 2015,motorola moto G 2015,motorola moto G 3rd gen,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: Thanks to an anonymous source online, we now have a full, clear image of what the  looks like not too long since it was sometime last week. Sporting what looks like the same textured back as what we saw in the previous leaks, the device is expected to have a Snapdragon 410 processor mated to 1GB RAM, 8GB storage and LTE support. The budget smartphone will also be home to a 5 inch 1280 x 720 display as well as a 13 megapixel rear snapper and 5 megapixel front facing camera. Weirdly enough it really doesn’t seem to be too different internally from the   with the exception of the camera and the processor. There hasn’t yet been official word of when it will hit the market but if they follow last years release schedule, it might come around sometime this September.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: More clues of Samsung’s larger Galaxy S6 edge appears
tags: Android,rumour mill,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,samsung. project zero 2,smartphone
contents: Not too long ago we reported about one of   upcoming smartphones, codenamed  , and we have some new details about the device. Its quite similar to the   in a sense but with some differences in terms of screen size and processor under the hood. The phone is expected to have either a 5.4 inch or 5.7 inch Super AMOLED curved display with edges on both sides. It is also rumoured to have a hexa-core Snapdragon 808 processor, 32GB internal storage as well as a 16 megapixel rear camera capable of 4K video recording and Optical Image Stabilization. The front camera will be a more standard 5 megapixel snapper. In terms of physical dimensions, the device will be coming in at 151mm tall and about 73mm wide; which puts it a 9mm taller and 3mm wider than the Galaxy S6 edge. This is definitely pointing towards a larger display than 5.1 inches and a larger screen will in turn need a larger battery to power it so it does make sense. Project Zero 2 is said to be home to a 3,000 mAh battery as well. Its currently up in the air in terms of what the smartphone will be named, but it has been labeled as the Galaxy S6 Plus or Galaxy S6 edge Plus. The device is expected to be launched in the coming weeks so we are expecting quite a big reveal from Samsung.

author: soyacincau
title: Meizu announce its MX5 flagship. Featuring a larger 5.5″ display and unibody metal design
tags: Android,Dual Sim,FlymeOS,FlymeOS 4.5,Meizu,meizu MX5,Meizu MX5 Launch,Meizu MX5 Malaysia,smart phone
contents: It looks like a busy day in China as Meizu has announced its latest flagship, the  . Replacing the previous Meizu MX4 that came with an odd 5.36″ 1920×1152 pixel resolution IPS display, the Meizu MX5 gets a larger 5.5″ AMOLED screen that does a more conventional Full HD resolution of 1920×1080. The front looks similar with its   as it gets a home button that doubles up as a one-touch fingerprint scanner. The MX5 now comes with a metal unibody design which is more sturdy compared to the current MX4 that has a removable plastic back cover. Despite having more metal, the MX5 is only slightly heavier at 149g (MX4: 147g) and it manages to trim its thickness down to just 7.6mm (MX4: 8.9mm). Under the hood, it gets a MediaTek Helio X10 2.2GHz Octa-Core processor that’s mated to 3GB of LPDDR3 RAM, similar to the HTC One M9+. With the absence of a removable back cover, the sides feature a flush tray slot that holds two SIM cards with both supporting 4G LTE. Like its predecessor, there’s no microSD expansion slot available. Keeping its lights on is a 3,150mAh capacity battery and it supports fast charging as well. Meizu claims that the MX5 can be juiced up to 25% in 10 minutes and up to 60% in 40 minutes. The main camera appears to be unchanged from its predecessor with a 20.7MP f/2.2 main camera with twin LED lights but this time it is improved with a 6 element lens and a new laser auto focus element that’s similar to the LG G3. This allows the MX5 to focus quicker at a claimed 0.2 seconds. For better selfies, the front gets a 5MP f/2.0 camera that’s enhanced with smart selfie features. Out of the box, it runs on Flyme 4.5 which is a heavily skinned UI based on Android which is radically different from other devices. The Meizu MX5 comes in 3 storage capacities with the base 16GB model priced at 1,799 CNY (about RM1,093). Meanwhile the 32GB and 64GB models are priced at 1,999 CNY (about RM1,215) and 2,399 CNY (about RM1,458) respectively. For more info, you can check out Meizu’s  .

author: soyacincau
title: Digi joins the free internet and calls bandwagon with its new Smart Prepaid
tags: DiGi,DiGi Prepaid,Digi smart prepaid,Free Basic Internet,prepaid,prepaid mobile internet,Smart Prepaid,Unlimited Messaging
contents:
While the telcos are still sorting out its   with their reloads, consumers can expect more value thanks to heated competition that’s happening recently. After Celcom introduced its Xpax  , Digi has responded with its new Smart Prepaid with its starter pack priced at RM10. Like most new prepaid offerings, Smart prepaid gives you free basic internet that allows you to use Facebook Lite, Twitter and web browsing at a throttled 64kbps. You also get unlimited social messaging on WeChat, WhatsApp, Line and Kakaotalk which includes sending photos and videos, but this excludes voice calls over the internet. The always-on internet trend was started by   and while it’s slow, it acts as a safety net so that you won’t lose your credit to expensive pay per use charges. 
 If you prefer talking and texting, you can enjoy unlimited calls and SMS to 3 of your favourite Buddyz on Digi’s network which can be configured by dialling *128*1*8#. The RM10 starter pack comes with RM7 preloaded credit with 7 days validity. As a bonus, Digi is giving RM9 extra credit which will be reimbursed across 3 months after you’ve activated the SIM. Take note that the RM3 extra credit for the first 3 months has a validity of just 15 days.  In terms of rates, voice calls are charged at 30 sen/minute while SMS are charged at 8 sen each. Do note that the Free Lite Internet usage has a FUP (Fair Use Policy) of 1GB. If you need some serious data, you can top up add-ons from as little as RM1/day for 20MB of high speed quota or RM48/month for 3GB. For more info, visit Digi’s  .

author: soyacincau
title: Galaxy A8 revealed in full hands-on. Thinnest Samsung smart phone at under 6mm.
tags: Android,galaxy a8,mobile phone,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy A,samsung galaxy a8,Samsung Galaxy A8 Hands-on,Samsung Galaxy A8 Specs
contents: It looks like the guys at Samsung isn’t reducing the number of smart phone models anytime soon. The   series will be getting a new model soon in the form of the  . While the new number represents a bigger screen, the new Galaxy A8 also gets a fresher design inspired by its current   flagship. Normally you would expect some leakster or informant to drop more photos before its official announcement but this time the Galaxy A8 gets a full hands-on video by TENNA. That’s right, the official certification body for China has given the Galaxy A8 a full reveal in a hands-on video.  From what we can see, the Galaxy A8 shares a lot of similarities in design as the S6 especially at the front and its metal frames around the sides. The back however gets a similar matte surface like its other A series siblings. As expected, the display is a larger 5.7″ Super AMOLED unit that pushes a full HD resolution of 1920×1080 and underneath it gets an Octa-Core Snapdragon 615 processor with 2GB RAM and 16GB of storage, similar to its Galaxy A7 brother. In terms of camera, it gets a 16MP shooter at the rear which is a bump from the standard 13MP camera on the current A5 and A7, while the front maintains a similar 5MP selfie cam. With a bigger screen, the Galaxy A8 gets a 3,050mAh capacity battery, which is appropriate for a device at this size. Dimension wise, the Galaxy A8 boast a rather thin 5.94mm side profile, making this the thinnest smart phone Samsung has produced since the Galaxy A7 (6.3mm). Looks like we’ve seen enough and we just need to wait for Samsung to announce its official availability.

author: soyacincau
title: Honor Band Zero – A minimalistic smart watch with a round monochrome display
tags: Honor Band Zero,Honor Smart Watch,Honor Zero,Huawei Honor Band Zero,Huawei Honor Smart Watch,Smart Watch
contents: Alongside its new   smart phone, Huawei has also announced a new smart watch that’s called the Honor Band Zero. In terms of design, it gets a simple round look with a brushed metal frame attached to several strap options. Don’t expect anything fancy out of it though. There are no buttons and the round display is a monochrome unit, unlike the high resolution display that’s used on their premium  .  It gets IP68 rated water resistance which allows you to submerge it under 10 metres of water. Functionality wise, it is pretty much the same as the TalkBand series with basic notification, pedometer and sleep tracking. On a single charge, the Honor Band Zero could last up to 4 days.   The Honor Band Zero will be available in 3 colour options – white, black and beige and it is expected to be released in August. So far there’s no price details yet and we reckon it shouldn’t be around the same or less than the   which is currently priced from RM558.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Images of the purported iPhone 6S metal casing leaked, looks the same as its predecessor
tags: apple,apple iphone 6s,iPhone 6,iPhone 6S,iphone 6s chassis,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: Very recently we reported that the  has already entered its production phase, and now we have leaked images of its metal chassis courtesy of 9to5Mac. In terms of general looks, the upcoming  device already looks like it is going to be identical to the iPhone 6. According to the source, the new phone is likely going to have the same thickness and overall form factor as the previous gen, down to the colour options. However there will likely be a myriad of hardware tweaks to better the device as well as more colour options to let it match with the  . Also, it appears that the iPhone 6S won’t in fact have a dual-lens camera system as the chassis doesn’t show the appropriate openings for it. As such the flash and camera layout will likely be the same s the iPhone 6. The layout of the speaker and the ports will also be unchanged. Apple really isn’t going for anything new with the looks of the iPhone 6S. Apple’s next flagship is expected to launch in September this year and we still don’t really have much details about the new phone besides the fact it will have Force Touch and that it might come in 4.7 or 5.5 inch variants.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The next iPhone to feature Force Touch displays and is apparently already in production
tags: apple,Apple iPhone,apple iphone launch,force touch,iPhone,next gen iphone launch,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: According to Bloomberg, the next gen  is already in the works, with the company expected to unveil the phones sometime this September. The upcoming iPhones are rumoured to feature Force Touch-capable displays, which are currently present on the and the   The tech basically allows users to access functions based on the pressure they apply on the screen or trackpad. The phones are also said to have the same design as the iPhone 6, which is unsurprising given that Apple doesn’t seem interested in changing their design any time soon. Apple however did mention that the phone will have better and tougher aluminium for its chassis compared to the iPhone 6, which is likely to mitigate the Bendgate issue. The devices are expected to come in the same 4.7 inch and 5.5 inch variants as the current iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus, with manufacturing to ramp into full gear starting next month.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Honor 7 leaks ahead of launch with new photos and video
tags: Android,Android Lollipop,Honor,Honor 7,honor 7 launch,honor 7 leak,huawei,smartphone
contents: : Honor 7 is  . Similar to the Huawei P8 but it gets a 20MP camera, fingerprint scanner and special voice controls.   New leaked images of the have hit the internet just ahead of the device’s launch  . The new images tease a premium metal body as well as the previously teased  . Aside from the oft mentioned fingerprint scanner, the device is rumoured to be specced with the company’s own homebrewed 64-bit octa-core Kirin 935 chipset as well as 4GB RAM and a 5.2 inch 1080p display. The device is expected to have either 16 GB or 64 GB expandable memory on top of a larger 3,100mAh battery. As for the camera, you will be getting a 20 megapixel rear camera with a 8 megapixel front shooter for better selfies. Running the show will be Android 5.1 Lollipop skinned with the EMUI 3.1 user interface We don’t know what the official pricing will be like yet, but with the launch so close, we’ll probably have it soon enough. Also, check out the hands on video below as well as additional images of the Honor 7.

author: soyacincau
title: U Mobile upgrades its Broadband Plans with extra 2GB of data
tags: Broadband,U Mobile,U Mobile Broadband,U Mobile Broadband Plan,U Mobile MB128,U Mobile MB68,U Mobile MB88,Wireless Broadband
contents: Apart from its  , U Mobile is packing more value to its wireless broadband plans by adding an extra 2GB of all-day data quota. Its current MB68 of RM68/month now offers an accumulative 12GB of data instead of the usual 10GB (5GB all-day + 5GB off peak) per month. If you need a modem or a MiFi Hotspot (3G 21Mbps model), U Mobile is offering them for free without contract.  The extra data offer is also applicable on its higher MB88 (RM88/month) and MB128 (RM128/month) broadband plans and the extra 2GB offer is permanent if you sign up by 31st of August. As per current promotion, their wireless broadband plans offer   via Era FM, Hitz, MyFM and KKBox, as well as free YouTube and Tonton streaming during off-peak (2AM to 10AM) hours. For faster connectivity, U Mobile offers 4G LTE enabled USB sticks and MiFi as well. Strangely the 42Mbps 3G HSPA+ modem stick costs more and we recommend you get the 4G LTE version to maximise your connection potential.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Uber has landed in Penang and is offering a week worth of free rides
tags: Android,iOS,mobile apps,Uber,Uber Free Code,Uber Malaysia,Uber Penang,uber penang launch,uber penang promo,Uber Penang Promo Code,windows phone
contents:
is now officially launched in  , allowing Penangites to enjoy affordable and reliable rides at the touch of a button. Basically now that the app covers the city, both potential drivers and users alike will get to experience the benefits of being able to grab safe and comfortable rides on the fly and for the drivers, maybe earn a bit of extra cash. On top of that Uber is running a “Free Uber Week” that is running from now till next week (29th June to 5th July) all you need to do is use the promocode “UBERFREEWEEKPG” to activate the promotion. For the uninitiated, Uber is a mobile platform that allows you to connect to the nearest driver when you need a lift. During registration, you would need to key in a debit or credit card since Uber is a cashless system. So after each ride, you can just hop off and the trip will be automatically charged to your card. So no more fumbling over small change and Uber will also email you an official receipt with complete breakdown of your trip. The base fare starts at RM 2, with additional charges of RM 0.35 a minute plus RM 0.70 a kilometer. Here are what the fares could look like depending on where you need to go: Sample fares: 
▪ Chulia Street to Gurney Drive: RM 8 – RM 11 
▪ Pengkalan Weld to Island Glades: RM 10 – RM 14 
▪ Tanjung Bungah to Minden Heights: RM 25 – RM 33 There’s only one Uber category for Penang right now and to find out more, you can visit their  .

author: soyacincau
title: U Mobile upgrades postpaid plans with more data. 3GB for RM28/month
tags: mobile internet,Postpaid Data plan,postpaid plan,U Mobile,U Mobile 3GB Plan,U Mobile P50,U Mobile P70,U Mobile Postpaid,U Mobile RM28 3GB Plan,U Mobile U28
contents: After   and   started the heated price war for affordable data-centric postpaid plans, U Mobile has responded by upgrading its postpaid offerings with more data. If you want more internet for cheap, their U28 Postpaid plan offers 3GB of data for only RM28/month. That’s not all, you also get 50 minutes of calls to all networks and 300 SMS (100 SMS within U Mobile, 200 SMS to all network). This is basically the upgrade of their   offering but they have increased its data from 1GB to a more generous serving of 3GB per month. Apart from U28, those with bigger data appetites will be happy to know that U Mobile has also increased its quota for its  . The P50 plan which costs RM50/month now gets 5GB instead of just 3GB, while the P70 plan (RM70/month) gets upgraded to 7GB from its current 4.5GB offering. The free call offering of 50 minutes (P50) and 70 minutes (P70) a month is still retained and they are offering 30 minutes of free calls within U Mobile but provided you’ve   to all networks. If you’re using any of these plans, U Mobile will upgrade them automatically and like its competitors, there’s no contract. For new subscribers, this additional internet quota is valid to those who sign up before 31st August. According to their  , the extra internet will be given permanently provided that you don’t switch plans.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: This strap adds 30 more hours to your Apple Watch
tags: apple,Apple Watch,apple watch accessories,reservestrap,SmartWatch,watch,wearable
contents: The   is known for needing a daily nighttime juicing as the battery can only last a maximum of 18 hours at a go. There are already third party accessories that are coming out for the Watch but very few actually claim to be able to bump up your battery life, and the Reserve Strap is looking like the most legit one so far. The Reserve Strap essentially is a battery in the form of a well, strap that extends the life of the   to about 30 hours. That roughly equates to 167% more battery life which in turn means you have to spend a lot less time stuck to a plugpoint to keep everything up and running. All you need to do is press the button on the strap to start charging the Watch when you feel the Watch could use a pick me up or you could leave it on to keep juicing to keep it at 100% battery till the Strap starts to wind down. This means you can get roughly 48 hours of use before you need to recharge them both. The Strap is designed to fit most wrist sizes and is water resistant, with compatibility with both 38mm and 42mm Apple Watch sizes. It will be available for purchase in three colours, white, grey and black, as pictured below. However none of this comes cheap as the   (about RM 945) which is pretty killer for a strap, but at the moment its a bit hard to say just how effective the strap might be without real world testing. The first shipment of the Reserve Strap is set to head out into the world on November 3rd 2015.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The ZenPower is now available and is slightly smaller than expected
tags: Asus,ASUS PowerBank,ASUS ZenPower,ASUS ZenPower 9600,ASUS ZenPower Malaysia,asus zenpower powerbank,ASUS ZenPower Price,DirectD,Power Bank,zenpower
contents: : ASUS Malaysia offers the ZenPower 9600mAh Power Bank at RM59 on their  . Looks like DirectD is now stocking the credit card sized   mAh battery packs for RM59 inclusive of GST. We originally spotted   during the  launch a few months back, with the device sporting a larger 10000 mAh capacity but has since been made official to be a bit smaller than originally anticipated, as we won’t be getting that version locally. Moreover, the official pricing for the device was announced by  , which is actually slightly more expensive than what DirectD is currently offering. The ZenPower has the advantage of being lighter than most power banks (at only 215g) and it pushes a higher 2.4Amp which charges faster than the typical 2.1Amp output shared by other battery packs. Three colours of Zenpower are currently available, namely silver, blue and gold, and you can  . No word if we will be getting the black and pink colour variants but DirectD will likely bring them in eventually. Thanks for the tip

author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus 2 will have the most advanced fingerprint scanner
tags: Biometric,fingerprint scanner,OnePlus,oneplus 2,OnePlus 2 Fingerprint scanner,oneplus two,Qualcomm,Qualcomm Sense ID
contents: The sequel of the 2014 flagship killer, the   will be   in less than 30 days. The latest flagship will be running on the top of the line  , comes with   and it will   than its previous model. Now they have dropped more hints and the OnePlus 2 claims to feature the world’s most advanced fingerprint scanner. According to OnePlus, they could have added a fingerprint scanner on their current One flagship but they believed that biometric security has to be done right. Most implementations they mentioned were just tacked on as a selling point instead of being useful to the user. For the upcoming 2, they will be using one of the latest and the most advanced fingerprint scanner, which they say is faster than Apple’s TouchID. They added that one quick tap leads you directly to your home screen and you can program up to a maximum of 5 fingers.  Several Android flagships like the Galaxy S6, HTC One M9/M9+ and Huawei Ascend Mate 7 have adopted single touch unlocking for its finger print sensors. Can OnePlus do any better? Qualcomm has introduced  , which is a 3D fingerprint technology that works more accurately and reliably even with contaminated finger tips. At time of announcement, Qualcomm says that Sense ID will be introduced on the latest Snapdragon 810 and 425 processors, so there’s a possibility of this being implemented on the OnePlus 2. All shall be revealed when the OnePlus 2 is launched virtually this coming 27th July.  Check out Qualcomm’s   promo video below:

author: soyacincau
title: Maxis Fibre Internet now delivers 100Mbps to your home
tags: 100Mbps,100Mbps Broadband,Broadband,Fibre Broadband,FTTH,Maxis,Maxis 100Mbps Broadband,Maxis fibre,Maxis Fibre Home,Maxis Fibre Internet
contents: If you got the need for speed, Maxis has introduced its fastest 100Mbps fibre broadband plan for residential use. Before this, home users are limited to   offering at RM179 which has limited service area. TM on the other hand does offer   but it is only for commercial users at the moment. With 100Mbps, you can stream ultra high resolution videos in 4K UHD and Maxis claims that it comes with unlimited data usage. If you’re a MaxisOne plan customer, you can get additional discount up to RM68/month. The 100Mbps plan is offered at RM398/month (exclusive 6% GST) and it is tied with 24 months contract. If you’re a MaxisOne plan customer, it can be yours for just RM330/month. The plan also gets RM30/month of free call credit to mobile numbers, fixed lines and IDD numbers. In terms of availability, it is subject to your location which you can check from their website. In case you didn’t know, Maxis Fibre runs on TM’s existing HSBB infrastructure.  There are other cheaper plans such as 30Mbps, 20Mbps and 10Mbps which are offered at RM248/month, RM198/month and RM148/month respectively. MaxisOne subscribers do get a discount but at RM20/off each month.  Like most services, there’s usually a FUP (Fair Usage Policy) in place to manage their network utilisation. Under their FAQ, it states that their 10Mbps fibre plan has a 100GB quota but currently they are offering unlimited quota download until further notice. This is a similar stance as TM, where its monthly Unifi download quota are  . On top of that, if you’re not happy with Maxis’ Fibre Internet, they are also offering  . This allows you to disconnect with no obligations and additional charges. For more information, head over to   page.

author: soyacincau
title: Qualcomm’s new Snapdragon 820 catches up to Samsung’s Exynos 7420 processor in benchmarks
tags: Exynos,Exynos 7420,processor,Qualcomm,Qualcomm Snapdragon 820,Samsung Exynos,Snapdragon 820
contents: The   and   have the   on benchmarks you can get right now. With its Exynos 7420 Octa-Core 64-bit processor that’s based on a 14nm process, it whoops Qualcomm which is struggling to douse the flames of its Snapdragon 810 overheating issues. Now its upcoming Snapdragon 820 is set to fix all that and its early benchmark results reveals some optimistic numbers. According to a South Korean source, a Snapdragon 820 device was spotted temporarily on GeekBench database which has been taken down. They added that the processor carrying the model number MSM8996 had scored 1732 in single-core and 4970 in muli-core tests. That’s quite a leap from its current Snapdragon 810 processor which scores 1227 in single-core and 4424 in multi-core Geekbench tests. What’s fascinating is that it beats the Galaxy S6’s Exynos 7420 processor in single-core by 246 points but it falls behind by 300 points in multi-core test. Since this a preliminary benchmark, we reckon the Snapdragon 820 would perform better when it is released commercially. Things are looking optimistic but we would need to wait until early 2016. By then, Samsung would have a newer Exynos processor for its next Galaxy S device.

author: soyacincau
title: Vivo’s slender X5Pro has arrived in Malaysia
tags: Android 5.0,funtouch 2.0,iris scanner,mobile devices,smartphone,Vivo,vivo x5pro,vivo x5pro launch,vivo X5Pro Malaysia,Vivo X5Pro Malaysia Launch,x5pro
contents: In a grand event, Vivo Malaysia has launched its latest device, the  . Announced  , the X5Pro looks like Vivo’s answer to OPPO’s ultra-slim R series and both of them have very similar specs underneath. The X5Pro carries a retail price tag of RM1,599.  Design wise, it gets an iPhone-inspired unibody design with 2.5D Gorilla Glass 3 on both front and back, which is held together with a rounded stainless steel and aluminium frame. For an upmarket look, the X5Pro gets a Nano-crystal coating that gives a shimmering effect.  At the front, it gets a 5.2″ Super AMOLED display that pushes a Full HD resolution of 1920×1080 pixels. The display also comes with Smart Wake 2.0 which allows you to quick launch applications by drawing preset patterns on the screen while it is off. Powering the device is a 1.5GHz Octa-Core Snapdragon 615 processor that’s mated to 2GB of RAM and there’s 16GB of on-board storage which can be expandable. Like most Chinese smart phones, this is a dual-SIM 4G LTE device and if you need to add-on a microSD card, it will take up the 2nd SIM slot.  For taking pictures, it gets a 13MP f/2.0 camera that boast Phase-detection Autofocus. This is similar to the Galaxy S5’s   camera and we reckon it is the same unit that’s on the  .  Selfie duties are handled by its 8MP f/2.4 front camera that’s enhanced with Smart Beauty features built-in with the camera app. When taking selfies, it is able to recognise different genders and apply right the right make up levels accordingly. In China, the X5Pro comes with an   but it won’t be available for our local market. In addition, Vivo is also banging on superior audio with its Cirrus Logic DAC AK4375 audio chip which claims to offers Hi-Fi quality sound. Overall the X5Pro is 6.4mm thin and it comes with a 2,450mAh capacity battery. Out of the box, it runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop with its own custom FunTouch OS 2.1 skin on top. When compared to the  , the X5Pro offers a slightly larger screen, larger battery capacity but it sacrifices on having just 2GB RAM (instead of 3GB). With regards to Vivo’s presence in Malaysia, they currently have over 2,000 point of sales outlets and 10 service centres nationwide. For more info, you can check out Vivo’s X5Pro  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Keep in the spirit of Ramadan with Google’s My Ramadan Companion
tags: google,google my ramadan,google my ramadan companion,mobile app,my ramadan companion,Ramadan
contents: The month of Ramadan is upon us and keeping in with the festive spirit,   has launched   to help keep the season close to your heart wherever you may be. Accessible via smartphone or via the web, the technology allows Muslims living away from their loved ones connect with one another and share locality relevant information like the sunset time, traffic and navigation and even some tasty recipes to break the fast with. Depending on your location, Google Now will display a range of relavant cards with the latest Ramadan news and info along with popular YouTube videos and  that are related to the fasting month. You can even design greeting cards to share with your family, find nearby Halal restaurants and countdown to Iftar time. So if you are looking to get into the holiday mood (or maybe get a better grip on your Sahur timing) you’ll find practically everything you need right here.

author: soyacincau
title: Apple Watch to go on sale in Thailand next. Malaysians would still need to wait
tags: apple,Apple Smart Watch,Apple Watch,Apple Watch Malaysia,Apple Watch Malaysia Sale,Apple Watch Netherlands,Apple Watch Sweden,Apple Watch Thailand,Smart Watch
contents: Just a few days back, the   has gone on sale in more countries including  . Initially sold exclusively online, Apple has recently made its watch available   and there are still people   for this electronic time piece.  Now the third wave of countries have been revealed with  ,   and   to receive the Apple Watch on 17th July. This brings the total of available countries to 19 which includes both our northern and southern Peninsular neighbours. For us folks in Malaysia it looks like it will take a while despite being   a couple of months ago. If you want to get an Apple Watch, you can join what could be the easiest give away on our  . Just like our page and this   to stand a chance to win.  Want to know more about the Apple Watch? Do check out our  .

author: soyacincau
title: Got a Beats Pill XL Speaker? Apple wants it back for RM1,175
tags: apple,Beats,beats by dr dre,Beats Pill XL,Beats Pill XL Malaysia,Beats Pill XL Recall,Product Recall,Recall,speakers
contents: Apple has just announced that a Wireless Speaker from beats can be a potential danger and they want you to stop using it immediately. The affected device is the Beats Pill XL wireless speaker and Apple wants you to return it back for RM1,175, as part of its recall campaign that’s applicable in Malaysia. According to the official  , they have initiated the recall exercise after finding that the Pill XL’s built-in battery is prone to overheating, which can be a serious fire risk. The Beats Pill XL is the bigger boombox-like version of its standard Beats Pill. It gets a handle at the back and it comes in 5 colours – Black, White, Pink, Metallic Sky and Titanium. Meanwhile, the unaffected smaller Beats Pill speaker is still   at RM790.  To return your Beats Pill XL, just fill up this   and Apple will contact you for further arrangements. The refund of RM1,175 will be transfered electronically within 3-4 weeks.  Thanks   for the tip!

author: soyacincau
title: OPPO Malaysia is launching its R7 series on 07/07
tags: Dual Sim,Oppo,Oppo R7,oppo r7 launch malaysia,OPPO R7 Lite Malaysia,OPPO R7 Malaysia,oppo R7 plus,OPPO R7 Plus Malaysia,OPPO R7 Plus Malaysia Launch,r7,r7 plus,rumour mill,smart phone
contents: OPPO Malaysia has officially sent out invites for its   smart phone launch, which is happening on an auspicious double 7 date. Following the release of its former super-thin  , the new R7 series offers better specs with larger storage and battery capacity.  It was   with 2 models – the 5″ OPPO R7 and a larger 6″ OPPO R7 Plus. Both are having Full HD resolution displays and they run on a mid-tier Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa-Core processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. Going into specifics, the R7 gets 16GB of storage and it is expandable with microSD using its 2nd slot of its dual-SIM tray. It gets an 8MP front camera with beautification features while the back has a 13MP shooter with Samsung’s ISOCELL CMOS which boast faster focus with its Phase Detection AF feature. In terms of battery, the R7 has a non-removable 2,320mAh capacity unit and it weighs 147g with a thickness of 6.3mm. For those wanting a phablet without the bulk, the R7 Plus offers a larger 6.0″ display and it gets double the storage at 32GB. While the front camera gets the same 8MP shooter, the back uses a Sony 13MP   4-colour RGBW sensor, which is also found on the  . It also gets dual-tone LED flash light and underneath it has a fingerprint scanner as well. Battery life on the OPPO R7 Plus shouldn’t be much of an issue with a mammoth sized 4,100mAh capacity battery.  Based on earlier speculation, OPPO might be releasing an   in Malaysia which hasn’t been announced globally. Could we be getting 3 models in Malaysia? From their recent SIRIM listing, it looks like we are getting just two and we’ll find out for sure next month. You can read more about the R7 series in our  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: HTC’s next hero smartphone could launch in Q4, codenamed the HTC Aero
tags: HTC,htc aero,htc aero rumour,htc flagship,rumour mill
contents: Not too long back HTC announced that they will be launching a   in an attempt to turn the company around as the   didn’t perform as well as expected. Now there are rumours that the so called hero phone that’s targeted to launch later this year will be called as the HTC Aero. Twitter leaker @evleaks is the one who chimed in with the smartphone’s coming launch. The new phone is expected to have a totally different direction compared to their upcoming 2016 flagships, which means the Aero will be filling in the void between the HTC One M9 and its successor. No indication of the specs yet but it should be rocking top end internals including a Quad HD display and maybe a Qualcomm Snapdragon 820 or MediaTek Helio X20 chipset under the hood. Q4 is still a long way to go and we probably get to see more leaks in the coming months.

author: soyacincau
title: Affordable JOI 7 Lite Tablet and JOI Phone 5 launched with Intel Atom x3 inside
tags: JOI,JOI 7 Lite,JOI 7 Lite Tablet,JOI Malaysia,JOI Phone 5,JOI Smart Phone,JOI Tablet
contents: Intel and SNS Network today has announced the arrival of its affordable JOI 7 Lite and JOI Phone 5. Both are powered by Intel’s Atom x3 processors which promises performance and excellent battery life at a lower price range.  The JOI 7 Lite tablet is priced at RM299 while the JOI Phone 5 is offered at RM399 and they will be available at major AEON department stores, participating reseller stores as well as online channels including  ,   and  .  The JOI Phone 5 is a 5″ smart phone with a decent HD 720p IPS display and it runs on Intel’s Atom x3-C3130 (SoFIA 3G) processor. It gets 1GB of RAM and 8GB of storage which is expandable up to 32GB extra using microSD. It also gets a 8MP main + 2MP front cameras, as well as your typical WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS and 3G connectivity with dual-SIM standby. It runs on Android 4.4 KitKat and powering the device is a 2,100mAh capacity battery. The JOI 7 Lite shares similar underpinnings as the JOI Phone 5 but it gets a larger 7″ IPS display which pushes a 1024×600 resolution. It also gets the same Intel Atom x3 powerhouse with 1GB of RAM and 8GB of storage with microSD support. However its camera settles for a rather basic 2MP shooter for the back and a front facing VGA camera.  The JOI 7 Lite tablet also supports phone calls and SMS, and it also comes with dual-SIM slots with 3G like its JOI Phone 5. Keeping the lights on is a 2,600mAh capacity battery. In terms of build, both devices feel quite plasticky but you really can’t complain for what it packs with such a low price tag.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The OnePlus 2 to launch on July 27 and you can experience it yourself
tags: mobile device,OnePlus,oneplus 2,OnePlus 2 Launch,oneplus two,oneplus two launch,oneplus two VR,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: The much awaited  finally has a launch date and its supposedly going to be the first ever phone launched in VR. Set to be launched on 27th July this year at 7PM Pacific Time (that’s about 10 AM Malaysian time the next day), the company has designed its own VR cardboard headset to let you “be there in person” with the OnePlus team and fans as the device is revealed. The OnePlus Cardboard headset looks quite similar to that of the Google Cardboard and will accommodate devices up to six inches in size, with the brand stating that it would be easy to put together. The headset is also claimed to be made more compact and durable than bog standard cardboard headsets, inclusive of an oil repelling film to keep it from soaking up human facial oil. They haven’t let on any new details yet but OnePlus says that you will be able to check out the phone in a whole new way and maybe even spot some extra hidden goodies during the “show”. As for the device itself, the OnePlus Two has been confirmed to be having   and an  . No new details have been leaked out yet but its a good month till the actual launch so OnePlus is likely to drop more hints as the date comes closer.

author: Amin Ashaari
title: China’s Richest Man bought two Apple Watch Editions and you won’t be able to guess who they’re for
tags: apple,Apple Watch,apple watch edition,Apple Watch Malaysia
contents: Priced beyond the grasp of mere mortals, the   is the most expensive smart watch you can get right now. But the astronomical RM40,000 price tag per watch is not stopping the richest man in China — Wang Jianlin — to buy not one, but two. But then again, with a name like “Wang” its pretty easy to see why he is the  . Anyway, back to the story. If buying two RM40,000 smart watches is not outrageous enough for you, then this will make you go WTF. The pricey digital timepieces are worn by a dog! But this is no ordinary dog. Wang Sicong, the son of Wang Jianlin, posted on his dog’s Wiebo account (yes, the dog has a Weibo account) pictures of the family Husky flaunting two gold Apple Watch Edition, one each on its front paws, with the caption: “I have new watches! I’m supposed to have four watches since I have four long legs. But that seems too tuhao so I kept it down to two, which totally fits my status. Do you have one?” No. BTW if you don’t already know what is the meaning of “tuhao”, read  . Side note: If you want to get your hands on an Apple Watch (not the Edition version), head on over to our   and try your luck in the SoyaCincau.com  . It’s super simple and you could be the lucky winner.

author: Amin Ashaari
title: 200GB in a memory card the size of your fingernail. It’s possible and you can get it now
tags: 200GB microSD,200GB sandisk,memory card,microSD,SanDisk,SanDisk Malaysia,SanDisk Ultra microSDXC,SanDisk Ultra microSDXC Malaysia
contents: SanDisk   the littlest big thing earlier this year by fitting a whopping 200GB storage capacity in a memory card the size of the fingernail on your pinkie. The  Ultra microSDXC UHS-I Premium Edition card is the highest capacity card currently available in the market. With a capacity of 200GB, the card can hold up to 20 hours of Full HD video or 1200 photos and is capable of 90MB/s transfer speeds. SanDisk has won multiple awards thanks to this card, and it’s apparently also water proof, shock proof, temperature, magnet and X-ray proof, if you happen to need to swap out your card while in an undersea volcano somewhere. It also comes backed with a 10 year warranty from SanDisk. And if you want one, you get it now from Amazon for a very reasonable price of US$239.44 excluding postage and handling, that’s about RM900 at today’s exchange rate. There’s one slight problem though, I don’t know of any smartphone or tablet in the market at the moment that supports this monster of a microSD card. In any case, if you must have one, check out the posting on amazon  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Deus Ex Aria is a device that adds gesture control to your smartwatch
tags: aria,cool stuff,deus ex aria,Kickstarter,sensors,SmartWatch,wearable
contents: What would life be like if you could control your smartwatch without even needing to touch it? maybe you could answer calls with a flick of a finger or tap it to open an app? The Deus Ex Aria is a Kickstarter project that actually makes this possible by transforming your smartwatch into something a little more hands free, pun intended. The Aria comes in two forms, a clip for Android Wear watches and a special strap for the Pebble Time, but is compatible with all Android Wear watches, including the ones you see below. In its clip form, its very small and unobtrusive as to not add too much extra bulk to your smartwatch. Basically, the Aria uses sensors to recognise gestures, specifically that of your fingers to navigate and otherwise control your device. Primarily the Aria lets you access your smartwatch without having to touch it, but it can also be used to control your smartphone as well. Answer your calls, swap through your music collection and even check or read your email. The device can even be hooked up to your GoPro via your smartphone to remotely send commands to the camera. This opens up a whole new world in how you can interact with your smartphone and wiggly fingers is just the tip of the iceberg.  The gestures are customiseable too, so you can tweak it to your personal preferences. The company is also releasing an SDK for any developers who are interested in producing apps for the device. They are hoping that the Aria can be used for other more complex actions like interacting with notebooks and perhaps even flying drones in the future. The Kickstarter project has under a month to go, so you can   if you’re interested in supporting the Aria. Check out the videos below to get a peek at what the Aria really can do.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Gmail now lets you undo your sent mail with Undo Send
tags: apps,Gmail,gmail undo send,google,google gmail undo send,undo send
contents: At long last after spending six years in development, Gmail’s Undo Send feature is finally available to the masses. The vast majority of us have already felt the horror of accidentally sending a mail with typos, the wrong person’s name or even when its unfinished and the new feature is set to change that. The function allows you to “unsend” an email for up to 30 seconds where it holds the mail for you after you hit the send button; so you have time to react incase you change your mind. The Undo Send feature is currently available only for desktop but we will be getting it for mobile in the near future. To activate it yourself, head on to your Gmail settings under the General tab and enable it. You can then pick between 5 to 30 seconds of delay time for Gmail to hold on to your mail. Its a very handy feature to have, we just wish it had come out sooner.

author: soyacincau
title: You can sign up for Digi’s RM36 3GB postpaid plan online
tags: DiGi Postpaid,Digi RM36 postpaid plan,Digi RM66 Postpaid Plan,DiGi Smart Plan,Digi Smart Plan 50,Digi Smart Plan 78,Digi smart plan promo,mobile internet,Postpaid,promo
contents: Just recently Digi had quietly   for its lower commitment Smart Plans, where you can get 3GB of data, 100 minutes of calls and 100 SMS each month for only RM36. Initially offered for a limited time at on-ground stores, Digi has published the offer on their website and you can now subscribe to the plan hassle free from their online store. To recap, the new   is basically an extra rebate on its current   plans and they have thrown in additional 1GB for free. If the RM36 postpaid plan is not enough, you can consider its RM66/month offer with 4GB of data along with 200 minutes of calls and 200 SMS. This is seen as a counter-plan for Celcom’s   offering. However do note that this is only applicable for the first 12 months, which consists of RM14/month discount for SmartPlan 50 and RM12/month off for SmartPlan 78. So far there’s no mention whether the extra 1GB offer would be extended after the 12 month promo period.  This promotion is only valid if you sign up from now until 15th July and it comes with no contracts. According to the T&C, it is applicable to new Digi subscribers including port-ins (MNP) and current users who are on Smart Plan 50 and Smart Plan 78.

author: soyacincau
title: WhatsApp Calling now available on Windows Phone
tags: Voice Call,Whatsapp,WhatsApp Calls,WhatsApp iPhone,WhatsApp Voice Call,whatsapp windows phone,windows phone,Windows Phone WhatsApp Call
contents: Windows Phone users are finally getting their voice call feature on WhatsApp. This comes after it was introduced for both   and   users. Just make sure you’re using the latest version 2.12.60 which introduces both calling over mobile data and the ability to send audio clips. Take note that this is only applicable for Windows 8.1 and above. If you haven’t got it yet, you can get WhatsApp for Windows Phone  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Band Play is LG’s newest smartphone and it packs a 1-watt speaker
tags: Android 5.1,band play,LG,LG band play,LG Band Play smartphone,LG smartphone,Music
contents: has just announced a new, music centric mobile phone and its an Android machine called the LG Band Play. The mid-range smartphone is marketed towards music lovers mainly due to having a 1-watt speaker out back that apparently delivers a lot more kick than your average smartphone speaker. The device was just unveiled in South Korea and under the hood it features a 64-bit Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor mated to 2GB RAM and 16GB expendable memory. The camera combo you get here is a pretty standard one, with a 13 megapixel rear camera with laser auto focus as well as a 5 megapixel wide angle camera for the selfies with gesture shot support. It will also have a 5-inch display at 720 x 1280 resolution, 2,300mAh removable battery and run Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box. As a bonus, buyers will also get a pair of LG QuadBeat 3 earphones with the unit. Of course it cannot hold a candle to its ultra premium cousin the  , but it has decent enough specs to keep the average person happy. The LG Band Play will be retailing for 394,800 KRW (that’s about RM 1336) and will come in two flavours, black and white. So far there isn’t any word whether or not we might be getting the smartphone locally or if it will be a Korea exclusive.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: LG G4 spotted in SIRIM’s database
tags: Android,LG,LG G4,LG G4 Malaysia,LG G4 SIRIM,LG Malaysia,LG smartphone,SIRIM,smart phone
contents: The  has finally been spotted in SIRIM’s database, possibly heralding the device’s official arrival in the Malaysian market. Before this, the only way for people to get the device was through gray importers and other unofficial channels, which means consumers could be paying more for smartphones that don’t carry official warranties. That said, could it be possible that LG is gearing up for a local launch? To recap on the specs, the LG G4 gets a similar sized 5.5″ Quad HD display (2560×1440) as the previous model but it is enhanced with better brightness and contrast ratio with its Advanced In-Cell Touch technology. Under the hood, instead of a top of the line Snapdragon 810, it runs on a Hexa Core Snapdragon 808 processor with 3GB of RAM. On-board there’s 32GB of on-board storage and you can also expand the storage with a microSD card. For taking pictures, the LG G4 claims to give the most manual controls with its 16MP f/1.8 rear caemra with Optical Image Stabilisation. For taking selfies, it features a higher resolution 8MP f/2.0 front camera. Keeping the lights on is a 3,000mAh capacity battery that supports fast charging, wireless charging (optional Quick Circle Case required) and it is removable too. Looking at all the flagships, this is probably the only new top-end device that offers both microSD and a removable battery. Out of the box it runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop with their proprietary UX 4.0 interface. You can read up more about the LG G4 in our   or watch our   of the device. However since no official announcement of the phone availability has yet to be made, its best to sit tight till LG Malaysia drops the bomb themselves.

author: soyacincau
title: Maxis wants you to keep calm and drive safe with Waze Safe Mode
tags: Children Navigation,Children Voice Pack,driving,Maxis,Maxis Safe Mode,Waze,Waze Malaysia,Waze Safe Mode,Waze Safe Mode Voice Pack,Waze Voice Pack
contents: Driving can be stressful and apparently 9 out of 10 parents drive safer if their kids are in the car. However most of the time, the kids can’t accompany them on their daily commute and Maxis has teamed up with Waze with a little add-on for safer driving. They have introduced a new Safe Mode voice pack, which essentially use voices of Malaysian children to give directions and traffic alerts.  The Maxis Safe Mode voice pack is now available on Waze and you can turn it on via Settings > Sounds > Navigation Guidance and then select “English (US) – Safe Mode Kids”. So in addition to your typical navigation assistance, you have kids reminding you to focus on the road instead of your handphone and to buckle up before starting your trip. If you haven’t download Waze yet, it is a social GPS navigation with live traffic data and user generated alerts. It is available for  ,   and  . For more info, visit Maxis’s   page.

author: soyacincau
title: The Xperia Z3+ is so hot that it shuts down its camera app fairly quickly
tags: Qualcomm,Qualcomm Snapdragon 810,Qualcomm Snapdragon 810 Overheat,Snapdragon 810,Sony,Sony Xperia Z3,Sony Xperia Z3 Plus,Sony Xperia Z3 Plus OVerheat
contents: The   runs on Qualcomm’s top of the line   which has been notoriously known for its overheating issues. Despite having the newer V2.1 version which claims to have better thermal performance, there were number of users   that the Xperia Z3+ still does overheat. Just how bad is this issue? Watch the video after the break to find out. Running the camera apps can be taxing for the processor especially when trying to record 4K videos. However the Xperia Z3+ just struggles to run its AR Mask app beyond 30 seconds. After a couple of temperature warnings, it closes the camera app immediately. Sony Mobile is aware of the issue and a fix is said to be on the way. It looks like Qualcomm’s overheating woes with its flagship processor are far from over. Just recently, OnePlus had announced that its   will be using the same Snapdragon 810 processor, but it will be running at   just to stay cool. Looks like Sony would need to put its Xperia Z3+ processor on a leash for a cooler experience.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Microsoft Office for Android is finally here
tags: Android,microsoft excel,Microsoft Office,microsoft powerpoint,microsoft word,Office,office android
contents: If you love to work on the go you’re in luck, Microsoft has just announced that the general availability for Word, Excel and Powerpoint for Android smartphones. With the preview announced about a month ago or so, the apps have already been available on tablet and other similar devices for quite some time now, catering to those who don’t want to be tied down to a desktop PC to get work done. For those who are familiar with the Office suite, you will find the same touch-optimised interface as the tablet versions, but shrunk down to accommodate for smaller screen sizes. Controls are placed at the bottom of the screen as well, so they are in easy reach with just your thumbs alone. So you essentially can toss together a presentation, write a report or even get some charts together while on your morning commute. You will also get OneDrive, Dropbox, Google Drive, Box and SharePoint intergration so you can save your files and edit them on the cloud; freeing up space on your actual device.

author: Sponsored
title: International Data Roaming in Australia is affordable and easy with U Mobile
contents: It’s pretty well known that we Malaysians love our social media. We’re among the top nations that love taking selfies and #foodporn pictures everywhere we go. So it’s no surprise that mobile internet is a must have for us, more so when we’re overseas.  Just a while back, we headed over to Sydney, Australia just so we could be one of the first   and purchase the  . And while we were there, our entire 4 days connectivity was reliant on a U Mobile Prepaid SIM.  If you’re wondering why U Mobile, it’s because we wanted to test out just how well the roaming plan worked for us while spending our time down under. Considering that they were offering up to 50MB free of international roaming a day (at selected countries), we really had to try it out. That’s not all though, you also have the option of enjoying unlimited data roaming for both U Mobile pre-paid and post-paid at only RM30/day. Yep, you read that right. Not 50MB, not 500MB but unlimited internet on roaming. So before our trip started, gotten ourselves U Mobile’s   on prepaid for the iPhone, that’s loaded with RM280 worth of credit. While this prepaid plan wasn’t entirely necessary for our overseas trip, we wanted to leverage on U Mobile’s unlimited data offer within Malaysia until 31st July.

author: soyacincau
title: The Apple Watch: It isn’t the game changer we’re looking for
contents: Like it or not, Apple is often seen as the benchmark in every product line. The iPhone revolutionised how touch screen smart phones work while the iPad turned out to be the   consumer product in history.   The truth is Apple never created anything new. They were not the first to create a smart phone, a tablet or even a music player. But somehow they managed to take an existing product and turned it into something new, prompting you to ask yourself “why didn’t anyone think of that?”  As wearables are seen as the next hot category, Apple has finally jumped onto the bandwagon with the Apple Watch. Its competitors especially from the Pebble and Android Wear camp had an early start and this should give Apple some insights on what to do, and what not to do. Can Apple emulate the same success with the Smart Watch? Or is it all just for looks? Find out in our review. First up, let’s go through the entire range of the Apple Watch. Unlike any smart watch or Apple products released so far, the watch has the most customisation you can buy right from the store.  There are 3 main models, the entry-level Apple Watch Sport, the mid-tier Apple Watch and the cream of the crop Apple Watch Edition. To fit different wrist sizes, it is available in 38mm and 42mm editions, where the dimensions represent the height of the watch.  The Apple Watch Sport gets an aluminium case in either silver or space grey. It feels similar to the iPhone 6 and the front is toughen with strengthen Ion-X class. Being a base model, it comes only with a choice of multi-colour rubber bands. The strap mechanism is the same as the rest of its models which allows you buy the more premium bands separately.  Moving up a notch is the Apple Watch which gets a stainless steel case with a shiny chrome finish or space black. For those who consider money as no object, the Apple Watch edition can be yours in either 18 carat yellow or rose gold bodies. The front glass for the Apple Watch and Apple Watch Edition is more durable with the use of Sapphire Glass, while the back uses ceramic for better scuff resistance compared to the standard Sport version.  Unlike the Sport, the higher Apple Watch and Watch Editions get a wider choice of bands which includes leather and metal. As you go up a notch, you can feel the weight difference on your wrist. For example the 42mm Apple Watch Sport with the rubber sport band weighs just 30 grams and it gets heavier at 50 grams with the stainless steel body Apple Watch. Meanwhile the rose gold Apple Watch Edition weighs 67 grams while the yellow gold option is heavier at 69 grams, and this is with the base rubber sport band. That’s more than double the weight of its entry-level aluminium version.   Regardless of which Watch you pick, you get the same internals inside except for its screen and battery. The 38mm and 42mm versions have a slightly different screen size with a resolution of 272×340 and 312×390 pixels respectively. Despite the variation on paper, both OLED displays shouldn’t differ much in clarity as they push the same pixel density of 326ppi (pixels per inch).

author: soyacincau
title: Sony Xperia Z3+ is now available in Malaysia
tags: Android Dual SIM,DirectD,smart phone,Sony,Sony Xperia Z3,Sony Xperia Z3 Malaysia,Sony Xperia Z3 Plus,Sony Xperia Z3 Plus Dual,Sony Xperia Z3 Plus Malaysia Price,Sony Xperia Z3+ Dual,Sony Xperia Z4,Sony Xperia Z4 Malaysia
contents: If you’re looking for the best of Sony, it looks like the   won’t be launched in Malaysia anytime soon. However the folks at DirectD are now offering imported units which comes in either single SIM or Dual-SIM variants.  The Xperia Z3+ is offered at RM2,599, which is the same price as the   and   flagships that are being sold officially in Malaysia. For the Xperia Z3+ Dual-SIM version, it is offered slightly higher at RM2,699. Since this isn’t an official Sony Malaysia set, DirectD is giving its own 2 year warranty. To recap, the Xperia Z3+ is the   of the Japan exclusive  . While the appearance looks the same as the current Xperia Z3, the Xperia Z3+ is actually thinner at 6.9mm (Z3: 7.3mm) and lighter at 144g (Z3: 152g). Another welcomed change is a cap-less microUSB port design, which makes it easier to charge without the need of removing flap covers. Like its previous models, it still maintains the highest waterproofing for a smart phone at IP68 rating. This allows it to be submerged under 1.5m of fresh water up to 30 minutes. The front still gets a 5.2″ Full HD (1920×1080) display and under the hood, it gets Qualcomm’s top of the line 2.0GHz octa-core Snapdragon 810 64-bit processor with 3GB of RAM. For storage there’s 32GB on-board which can be expanded using microSD card. As comparison, the current Z3 runs on a 2.5GHz Snapdragon 801 processor and it gets just 16GB of storage.   For imaging, its main camera remains unchanged with a 20.7MP Exmor RS sensor with a 25mm f/2.0 lens. However the front camera has been upgraded with a 5MP shooter. In the battery department, the battery has shrunk from 3,100mAh on the Z3 to just 2,930mAh with the latest model, but Sony still claims to be able to provide up to 2 days of battery life per charge. With its quick charge feature, they reckon you can get a full day of use with just 45 minutes of charging. For more info, you can check out DirectD’s Sony Xperia Z3+  .

author: soyacincau
title: Is someone selling you a genuine OPPO Smart Phone? Here’s how to check
tags: Check OPPO Original Smart Phone,Cloned OPPO Smart Phone,counterfeit,Fake OPPO,Fake OPPO Find 7,Fake Oppo Phones,Fakes,Genuine Product,Oppo,Oppo Find 7,OPPO IMEI,OPPO IMEI Checker,Oppo Malaysia,Oppo N3,smart phone
contents: As reported earlier, there’s a growing number of   smart phones in the Malaysian market. OPPO is   of the situation and they had even released a guide on   N3 smart phone.  The sale of fake products would obviously harm their brand as unsuspecting victims would experience sub-par quality compared the real deal. To step up its campaign against cheap fakes, OPPO Malaysia has introduced an online IMEI checking tool for users to verify their smart phone purchase. An IMEI is a unique number which is assigned to each mobile device, or you can think of it as an universal serial number. To access it, you can either dial *#06# or you can get it from the label that’s printed on the box or underneath its removable back cover. Once you’ve obtained the IMEI number, just key it in over   and it will verify if it is an official set along with its model number and full specification.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Next gen Apple Watch to get Facetime and WiFi connectivity
