title: OPPO Malaysia introduces O-Club with extra ownership perks
tags: O-Club Malaysia,Oppo,OPPO Concept Stores,Oppo Malaysia,OPPO Membership Rewards,OPPO O-Club,OPPO O-Club Membership,OPPO Service Centre
contents: OPPO Malaysia is giving its loyal customers something extra in conjunction with its 10th Anniversary milestone. Next week, they will be kicking off its O-Club membership program on 15th June where O-fans get additional complementary service, discounts and extra benefits to make your OPPO smart phone ownership more worthwhile. There are 2 O-Club membership levels with the base membership costing RM1 per year. As an O-Club member, you can purchase a screen protector for only RM1. OPPO is also providing free app downloads, firmware and cleaning services as well. If your OPPO smart phone is out of juice, O-Club members can get a quick VOOC recharge at their nearest OPPO Concept Stores. There’s also a point redemption system where you get to earn 1 point for every RM1 spent.   The VIP level of the O-Club membership is activated for a lifetime with a purchase of a new OPPO smart phone or if you’ve accumulated 100 points on the basic membership level. It gets the same perks as the base O-Club membership but you’ll also get the benefit of a free complimentary courtesy phone when you send your device in for repairs. This is of course with the exception of having a cracked screen or if your phone is damaged by water. On top of that, you’ll also get 10% off on any OPPO or iLike accessories sold at their OPPO Concept Stores. During rainy days when you’re out and about, they also offer free umbrella (on loan up to 30 days) at the Concept Stores as well.

author: soyacincau
title: 9 new things to look forward to with iOS 9
tags: apple,iOS,iOS 9,iOS 9 features,iPad,iPhone,iPhone 6,iPhone 6 Plus,ipod touch,Top iOS 9 features,WWDC 2015,WWDC15
contents:
Apple had unveiled its new iOS 9 at WWDC15, marking the 9th generation of its mobile platform. While on the surface it doesn’t look radically different since iOS 7, the new version brings a couple of major refinements for the iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch which are big on productivity and intelligence. In a nutshell, iOS 9 is supposed to work harder for you, to give you what you want based on your past and current behaviour. For those using the iPad for work, iOS 9 offers better multi-tasking features which has been present on other tablets in the market. It is safe to say that Apple has gotten some inspiration from its rivals.  Head after the break for our list of 9 things to look forward to in the upcoming iOS upgrade that’s due end of this year.  
On the far left of the home screen lives the new Spotlight Search, which is where the original Search panel was placed before it was changed in iOS 7. Based on your frequent usage, it will understand your habits and will suggest contacts and apps accordingly. So if you often load a certain app or contact a person at a specific time and place, Spotlight will pick this up and will recommend them in future. This is somewhat similar to Nokia’s  .    They have introduced new Proactive Assistant, which is something that rivals Google Now. The popular voice assistant now takes into consideration the context of your request, such as time and location. So it can do things like reminding you of your next appointment along with the traffic info for your destination. If a call comes in from an unknown number, its proactive capabilities will try to match the caller from your past emails which includes the contact info so that you’ll know whose calling. Its search capabilities goes deeper now into the app level and you could even ask Siri to find specific photos, such as time or place where it was taken from your camera roll. On iOS 9, Siri is claimed to be up to 40% faster and is 40% more accurate than before.  
Notes is a great way for taking things down and it gets a whole lot better on iOS 9. It gets revamped with extra features like creating a checkable list and you can even sketch using your fingers and add items from Safari, Maps and other supported apps. This looks like Apple’s answer to Samsung’s S Note app that comes as standard with the Galaxy Note series. With iCloud, you can sync your notes across your iPhone, iPad and Mac.  
Apple Maps now includes public transport directions which covers buses, trains, subways and ferries but it will first roll out at selected cities. While exploring new locations, Maps will also show you what’s interesting nearby, from food, cafes, shopping to popular activities.  For better multi-tasking, iPad users now get Multi-Window. You can choose to slide over an app from the sides, which is very useful if you constantly respond to messages or social feed. For a more permanent set up, you can display 2 apps simultaneously in either 50-50 or 30-70 split.  The iPad also gets Floating Picture in picture video playback, where you can continue to watch your video in a pop-up window while you’re running other apps. This isn’t entirely new and Samsung has introduced this a couple of Galaxy models back. 
The keyboard now also doubles up as trackpad which is toggled by dragging two fingers. This makes it effortless to move the cursor around or to select text. There’s also direct copy, cut and paste shortcuts on the keyboard, making word processing a whole lot easier. The new keyboard and multi-window feature currently works only with the iPad Air 2, which is their most powerful iOS device right now. This is probably good news to those who bought an iOS device with the least storage capacity. For those who tried upgrade to iOS 8, most users would need about 5GB of free space to upgrade, which is a challenge with those using a 16GB device. For the new iOS 9, they had made updating more efficient by streaming the updates directly as opposed to downloading the entire package, that would require more space to unpack. As a result, iOS 9 would require just 1.3GB of available space to upgrade. 
A new feature which can be a life saver, iOS 9 now incorporates Low Power Mode. This helps to extend the final few bars of battery life by throttling its performance, reducing background sync and disabling unnecessary animations. They have done some extra tweaks including disable on-screen notification if the phone is facing downwards. With all the fine tweaks, Apple reckons that you can get an extra 3 hours of battery life and 1 hour of usage after upgrading to iOS 9. 
For those paranoid about security, you’ll be happy to know that Apple has beefed up its authentication process to deter unwanted access. The passcode is now longer with 6 digits and you can also enable two way authentication where you’re are required to key an extra password that was sent to another Apple product or phone.  
iOS 9 will be rolled out officially this fall, which starts somewhere in September. In terms of compatibility, it will be available for iPhones from iPhone 4S and above, and iPads starting from the iPad 2 and first gen iPad mini. In addition, it is also coming to the 5th generation iPod Touch. To sum up the top features on iOS 9, you can watch the video below:

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Huawei Watch release for China delayed due to issues with Android Wear
tags: Android Wear,Huawei Watch,huawei watch delayed,SmartWatch,wearable
contents: It looks like   isn’t going to be getting its China release just yet, as the company has stated that they are going to delay the timepiece’s release due to issues with the Android Wear OS. The device was originally introduced during  and preorders have been ongoing since late last month. Possibly due to Google’s limited availability in China, Huawei has to replace Google Services with its own for the watch to function in their home ground. Other markets like Europe, United Kingdom, US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand should still be receiving their timepieces earlier.  To recap, the Huawei Watch is equipped with a 1.4 inch AMOLED screen with a 400 x 400 resolution at 286ppi. Under the hood is a Snapdragon 400 chipset alongside 512MB RAM and the watch will operate with Bluetooth 4.1. The Watch will also come with the usual fitness features inclusive of a heart rate monitor, step counter and additional sensors to keep track of your steps and calorie count, all in a stainless steel frame. The release has been pushed to September or October for China, with Huawei adding that they are not just fixing the issues with Android Wear but are also optimizing it for the Chinese market. If you haven’t seen it yet, check out our hands-on with the Huawei Watch.

author: soyacincau
title: HTC tweets photo of its limited edition phone, Shot on iPhone 6
tags: FAIL,Gold Phone,HTC,HTC One M9,HTC One M9 24 Carat Gold,HTC One M9 Gold Edition,iPhone 6,Shot on iPhone 6,tweet fail
contents: HTC has announced its new blinged-up   for the UEFA Champions League season that comes in 24 Carat Gold. To spread the word quickly, twitter is probably one of the best way to do it but there’s a little boo-boo that could spoil it all.  When HTC   the new device, one of its photos showed a reflection of a competing device.  If you looked closely, it is none other than the  . Shortly after that, they had removed the tweet and reposted a new one as shown below. HTC should supply some of their smart phones to the agency that’s handling their official social accounts.  We’ve seen countless of tweet fails and it’s all because of a minor detail that’s often overlooked. Some of the epic moments included LG mocking the iPhone 6 bendgate with a tweet that was  . A similar thing happened for   and   as well when their promotional tweets was shown to be originated from the iPhone.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy Tab E spotted in print, has a better screen than the Galaxy Tab A
tags: galaxy tab E,rumour mill,Samsung,samsung galaxy tab E,Samsung Tablet
contents: Looks like Samsung is still adding new tablets to their repertoire and this time a Samsung Galaxy Tab E has been spotted in print in June’s issue of Taiwan Mobile bearing the model number SM-T560. It seems to be quite similar to the   but with some differences in terms of specs. The listing shows the device would have a 9.6 inch screen with a 15:9 aspect ratio putting it at 1280 x 768 resolution, which is much more than what the Galaxy Tab A has. The Tab E also has  1.3GHz processor which is rumoured to be a quad-core CPU alongside Android 5.0 Lollipop out of the box. The camera you are getting here is a 5 megapixel snapper out back and though there isn’t any mention of a front camera it is likely to be a 2 megapixel selfie snapper. The tablet here is listed as a Wi-Fi version so its likely that there will be one that can run on mobile data as well and knowing Samsung there might be more than one size variant if they are following the same formula as the Tab A. : The 690 TWD (RM83) price listed in the brochure is for the case accessory. So far there’s no official pricing for the Galaxy Tab E.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi introduces its new Yi Smart CCTV camera with night vision
tags: CCTV,Smart Camera,Smart CCTV,Xiaomi,xiaomi camera,Xiaomi CCTV,Yi CCTV,Yi Smart Camera,Yi Smart CCTV Night Version
contents: Before Xiaomi released its  , their Xiaoyi sub-brand actually makes CCTV cameras. Available officially only in China, the Yi Smart Camera now gets a new Night Vision model that allows better surveillance in the dark. Best of all, it still retains the same price as the previous model at 149 CNY (about RM90) per piece.  The Yi Smart Camera was   year as Xiaomi ventures into the smart home space. It’s a tiny round shape little camera that’s powered by microUSB and it connects via WiFi. The front lens is made of glass and it boasts a wide angle of 111 degrees. It will record videos at HD 720p resolution in 20 fps, which is saved onto the local microSD card. There’s no cloud storage required, thus minimising your broadband usage at home. To take a peek of what’s going on, you can use Xiaomi’s Smart Home app available for both iOS and Android to view the camera in real time as well past recordings which are taken when motion is detected. It even comes with a built-in mic and speaker, so you do get 2 way audio using the app.  With the new Night Vision model, the Yi Smart Camera gets additional 8 units of 940nm Infrared LEDs surrounding the lens. This helps to boost visibility in the dark up to 5 metres. The 940nm type IR lights are said to be less intrusive without any visible light pollution, while maintaining its picture quality in both dark and well lit situations.  The current non-night vision model is now priced at 128CNY (about RM78). If you’re interested, a couple of sellers on   are selling the standard Yi Smart Camera between RM109 to RM149.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Gionee E8/S8 gets shown off in a new hands on video
tags: Android,Gionee,gionee elife e8,gionee elife e8 tenaa,gionee elife s8,rumour mill,smartphone,tenaa
contents: China’s TENAA has just released a video of the  , not long after it got certification to be used by the regulatory agency. The specs for the 6 inch device include a 1440 x 2560 AMOLED display, octa-core MediaTek MT6795 2GHz CPU mated to 3GB RAM and 32GB internal storage. The Elife E8/S8 will also have a 23.7 megapixel primary camera that can capture images up to a maddening simulated 100 megapixels resolution with an 8 megapixel selfie snapper up front. A 3250mAh battery keeps the lights on, and Android 5.0 is pre-installed with the Amigo 3.0 UI running on top. The phone reputedly is extremely thin and the video does show just how skinny it really is. Check out the video after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 8.0 hits the FCC, gets more leaked photos
tags: Android,galaxy tab S2,rumour mill,samsung galaxy tab s2 8.0,samsung galaxy tab s2 launch
contents: Not too long ago the Samsung Galaxy Tab S2   a visit and now the tablet has made its way over to the FCC and along with it some new leaked images have emerged. Rumoured to be the world’s thinnest tablet, the device will come in two sizes and will be replacing the Samsung Galaxy Tab S. In terms of specs the Galaxy Tab S2 8.0 will have an octa-core processor clocking 1.9GHz Exynos 7420 SoC, 3GB RAM as well as an 8 inch AMOLED display with 1536 x 2048 resolution. The tablet will also have LTE support as well as expandable storage at 32GB of up to 128GB, The camera will be an 8 megapixel rear and 2 megapixel front combo. The Tab S2 8.0 will be running Android 5.0 out of the box. No word yet on the battery unfortunately, but it doesn’t look like they will be able to squeeze in much with how thin the tablet looks. So far there is no word on how much Samsung plans to charge for the tablets, but the devices are rumoured to be debuting   and since both TENAA and the FCC have already certified the device it can’t be too long now.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: HTC to release new “Hero” smart phone in October
tags: HTC,mobile devices,rumour mill,windows phone
contents: Seems HTC is in a bit of trouble as of late, with share price dropping so badly that the company’s CEO had to make an official apology to shareholders. However in a attempt to control the damage HTC will be producing a new “hero product” that could be out as early as this October. The   didn’t perform as well as expected, with the brand blaming the sales performance on low demand for high-end Android phones. There isn’t much known yet about the new mystery phone but it will be something totally different from what HTC has planned for its 2016 flagship device. Its safe to say that it will be a smartphone and given that HTC will be a Windows 10 partner it is likely to be a Windows phone. Rumours are currently pointing at a possible  variant with Windows 10 slapped on but it doesn’t sound much like a flagship. But what could it be? maybe a new Butterfly 3 for international markets or a high performing but affordable priced Desire to rack in the numbers perhaps? HTC is also planning on realigning their goals and priorities with an increase in research and development investments by 4% for a  total of US$419.33 million while the marketing budget has been slashed down by 19.26%. The brand will also be focusing on some new market niches too, like the Vive virtual reality headset that it is developing with Valve. Hard to say where HTC’s new direction will take it for now but if it works out we could be seeing quite some change.

author: soyacincau
title: BlackBerry’s new model is another variant of the Passport
tags: blackberry,BlackBerry 10,BlackBerry Dallas,blackberry oslo,BlackBerry Passport,smart phone
contents: After introducing the  , BlackBerry has yet to release a new high end device. The recently announced   and   smart phones are still running on a rather dated dual-core Snapdragon processors but they run on their latest BlackBerry 10.3.1 OS on top. For those who need more power, here comes a new high-spec BlackBerry which looks like another variant (possibly cheaper) of the Passport.   With the code name BlackBerry Oslo/Dallas, the upcoming device gets a similar Passport form factor which has a wider width. Instead of a serious business look, it gets a silver colour body that uses both metal and plastic. Just like the Passport, it gets a QWERTY keyboard with 3 rows that also doubles up as a trackpad. Spec wise, it gets a similar 2.2GHz MSM8974 processor from the Snapdragon 801 range, that’s mated to 3GB RAM and is powered by a 3,450mAh capacity battery. At the back, it also gets a 13MP main camera with optical image stabilisation. The device is said to be running on BlackBerry OS 10.3.2.2.150 and it could be launched specifically for the EMEA and APAC markets. For those who find the BlackBerry Passport too wide to handle, this new device doesn’t seem to differ much in terms of handling. For a more traditional BlackBerry size and form factor, the   would probably be the better option. If only they gave it better internals.

author: soyacincau
title: Struggle to get 4K content? Now here’s a YouTube video in 8K
tags: 8K,8K Video,Ghost Towns,Ghost Towns 8K Video,RED Epic Dragon 6K,SUHD,youtube,YouTube 8K Video
contents: As   are becoming mainstream, the biggest hurdle is getting the right content to maximise the screen’s potential. If you’re wealthy enough to own an epic  , here’s a YouTube video that you might appreciate.  Here’s a video called Ghost Towns which plays up to a maximum of 8K 4320p resolution. It was shot using a   camera which was stitched on using Adobe After Effects with some up-scaling involved. So if you’re wondering how high can YouTube go, it looks like they are ready to take on the insane high resolutions that not many would be able to watch. Also not forgetting the struggle of streaming it in its full quality if you don’t have reliable and faster broadband speeds. Check out the video after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Samsung Galaxy E7 is now available for RM1,099
tags: Android,galaxy e7,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy E7,samsung galaxy e7 price,smartphone
contents: Liked the  but aren’t willing to fork out for it? the more affordable  s finally available for purchase. The device is a hair lower in terms of specs than the Samsung Galaxy A7 but has more bang for buck. Speaking of specs, the phone sports a 5.5 inch super AMOLED screen at 1280 x 720 resolution, 1.2GHz quad-core Snapdragon 410 processor mated to 2GB RAM with 16GB expandable storage up to 128GB. The device will also have a 13 megapixel rear camera as well as a 5 megapixel front snapper for selfies. It will have dual-SIM support as well as a slightly larger battery than the Galaxy A7 however, with a slight bump up from 2,600mAh to 2,950mAh for more longevity. But if you’re looking for 4G connectivity, you’re out of luck as it seems that according to the spec sheet the device does not support it.

author: soyacincau
title: Sony Mobile to launch Xperia C4, M4 Aqua and a new flagship on 11th June
tags: Android,smart phone,Sony,sony xperia c4,Sony Xperia C4 Malaysia,sony xperia M4 aqua,Sony Xperia M4 Aqua Malaysia,Sony Xperia Z4 tablet,Sony Xperia Z4 Tablet Malaysia
contents:
Sony Mobile is making some noise this week as they will be announcing 3 new devices for the Malaysian market. The first 2 devices are the  , a selfie cetric device and the  , which is a new mid-range waterproof device. The third model is said to be a long awaited Xperia flagship device and we know many would anticipate the  , which is the international variant of its Snapdragon 810 powered   smart phone. However based on the   and a quick check at SIRIM, the new flagship device is likely to be its  The Xperia Z4 Tablet is their flagship full sized tablet offering with a Quad HD 10.1″ IPS display that pushes 2560×1600 pixels resolution and it is powered by Qualcomm’s 2.0GHz Octa-Core Snapdragon 810 processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. Compared to its former Xperia Z2 Tablet, they have managed slim it down to just 6.1mm, which is the same thickness as the iPad Air 2. It weights from just 389g for the Wifi version. There’s 32GB of storage, a microSD expansion slot, 8.1MP main camera without flash and front facing 5.1MP unit. Keeping the lights on is a 6,000mAh capacity battery which Sony claims is capable of 17 hours of video playback.   
The Xperia M4 Aqua is their improved mid-range waterproof smart phone that comes with a larger 5.0″ HD 720p display, 64-bit Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa-Core processor, 2GB RAM and 16GB of storage. It supports 4G LTE connectivity and 13MP main + 5MP front cameras. Like the Xperia Z4 Tablet and Xperia Z3+, the microUSB port is exposed but it still waterproof with IP68 rating. Keeping the lights on is a 2,400mAh capacity battery which Sony claims to last up to 2 days on average use.  
For selfie lovers, the   is a smart phone that’s designed for narcissists in mind. It gets a larger 5.5″ Full HD 1080p display and it runs on a 1.7GHz 64-bit MediaTek MTK6752 processor mated to 2GB RAM and 16GB of expandable storage. For imaging it gets  13MP main camera while selfies are handled by a 5MP shooter that comes with an additional soft flash light at the front. It also supports 4G LTE and the battery is slightly bigger too at 2,600mAh.

author: soyacincau
title: Apple Music takes on Spotify with its own subscription based service
tags: apple itunes,Apple Music,Apple Music Subscription,Apple Songs,iOS 8.4,iTunes,Spotify,Steve Job,WWDC 2015,WWDC15
contents: iTunes had changed the way people purchase and consume digital music. With the rise of new music services such as Spotify, Apple is now introducing Apple Music, which offers an “all you can listen” ad-free music experience including offline for a fixed monthly subscription.  Interestingly Steve Jobs didn’t believe in the subscription model and this is a big shift from its current approach of selling songs ala carte by track or album. Back in 2003, the Apple co-founder once said that subscription music services were going to fail and people won’t buy music as a subscription. “When they want music, they bought 45s, LPs, cassettes, 8-tracks, CDs and then they are going to buy downloads”, he said in an  . The Apple Music service costs US$9.99 a month per user, and there’s a family pack bundle of US$14.99 that covers up to 6 users in a household. As a promo, the first 3 months subscription is free. As comparison, its direct competitor Spotify’s premium ad-free service costs US$9.99 in the US and RM14.90 with 1 month free trial in Malaysia.  On top of that Apple has revamped its streaming radio offering with the big names of music curating these stations. One of such stations is BeatsOne, a 24 hour streaming station that’s handled by DJs like Zane Lowe, Ebro Darden and Julia Adenuga.  To complete the music service, there’s also Connect, a social platform that connects artists to their loyal fans. In short, it is like a micro blog where fans can subscribe to, to get the latest updates, and even get first hand access to the latest albums.   Apple Music will be available starting 30th June across 100 countries and it will be rolled out with its upcoming iOS 8.4 update for the iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch. Not leaving anyone else behind, it will also be available for Windows and Android users this Fall, which is in Q3 this year. As Apple Music comes pre-installed in every new device running iOS 8.4 and above, Apple hopes that more users would jump on board its subscription service especially with its free 3 month subscription offer. If you’re a Spotify premium user, would you jump over to Apple Music?

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Android M does wonders to Nexus 5’s battery standby time
tags: Android,Android Lollipop,Android M,Nexus 5,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: We all know how much of a battery guzzler Android Lollipop can be, and this is set to chance with Android M with a few extra tricks up its sleeves to keep your battery lasting longer. To showcase how much power savings the new features bring in a real life setting, a  was loaded with a copy of the Android M Developer Preview and measured against the same model with Android 5.1.1 in it. Of the new features that will be coming with Android M is   and App Standby which helps save on power in two different ways. Doze for instance is activated when your device is inactive for a certain period of time and causes your phone to go into a “deeper sleep” and halt processes that would normally continue running when on standby. Once you pick up your phone Doze gets disabled and it resumes as usual, doubling standby time. App Standby on the other hand prohibits inactive apps from getting network support and open jobs are suspended once your device is unplugged from the charger. When your phone is plugged in again, the apps will reconnect. This would work best if Android M gave users the ability to enable or disable the feature for particular apps. So how did the devices do? The result? after 8 hours in standby the Nexus 5 with Android 5.1.1 consumed just 4% of battery as opposed to the Nexus 5 with Android M which only consumed 1.5% battery. After 24 hours the Nexus with Lollipop had eaten through 12% of its battery while the Android M device had only consumed 4.5% of power during the same duration. After an additional 24 hours the Android 5.1.1 device had chewed its way through 24% battery while the Android M Nexus 5 had taken just 9%. In total the Lollipop device was projected to last for about 200 hours on standby while the latter was projected to last more than double of that at 533 hours on standby. LG and Huawei have also been rumoured to be in the process of producing the   smartphones that possibly might come with Android M pre-loaded. Suffice to say Android M is already looking good from the power consumption department and we can’t wait to get a hold of the full release when its officially released in Q3.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Sony launches Waterproof Smart B-Trainer headset in Malaysia
tags: Fitness,fitness tracker,Running earphone,Smart B-Trainer Malaysia,Smart Running Earphone,Sony,sony smart b-trainer,sony smart b-trainer Malaysia launch,Sony Walkman,walkman smart b-trainer,Waterproof Earphone
contents: Sony has just launched a new Walkman headset which is a first for the brand to be both fitness tracker and audio companion combined. Named the Smart B-Trainer, the gadget is the latest member of Sony’s wearable weatherproof Walkman players that wholly encompass wireless freedom. If you love running, this could be the gadget that can get you going without the need of carrying a smart phone. As far as looks are concerned the device looks about the same as its predecessor the   albeit being a wee bit larger and is available in more colour options in Black, Pink, Blue, White, and Yellow. What makes it different is that it has fitness related sensors under the hood so you can eschew fitness bands altogether. The Smart B-Trainer has a waterproof rating of IPX5/IPX8 to keep out dust and water while you hit the trail or even go for a swim if the mood strikes you. The device will also have a gyroscope, GPS, Accelerometer, Electronic Compass as well as a Heart Rate Sensor that will collect data and feed it to the Smart B-Trainer for Running app so you can keep track of your workout. The Smart B-Trainer also has a nifty feature that talks to you during your workout to tell you your speed, distance and other information so you always know what you’re doing. To top it off, the device actually can pick and play songs for you based on your heart rate (and what you have in your playlist) using Sony’s 12 Tone Music Analysis tech to guide your running pace for keeping your heart rate in your optimum BPM. With the on-board 16GB of storage, the B-Trainer could store up to 3,900 songs. When paired to your smart phone, it also doubles up as a Bluetooth headset. On a full charge, it can last up to 14 hours for pure music playback with GPS disabled or 5 hours in Training Menu with GPS on. It takes 1.5 hour to recharge via USB.  The gadget will be retailing at RM 999 starting from 15th June. If you’re interested, you can pre-order yours from   with deliveries starting on 17th June. Sony is also throwing a welcome kit consisting of a T-shirt, towel, wristband and headband worth RM99. For more info, you can head over to Sony Malaysia’s  .

author: soyacincau
title: Unboxed: LG G4
tags: Android,LG G4,LG G4 Malaysia,LG G4 Unboxing,smart phone
contents: The   may not be coming to Malaysia officially but the folks at LG has just sent us a unit for review. It went on sale in Singapore last month and it’s heading for the US this week. This is the only new flagship that packs a microSD expansion slot and a removable battery. If you’re wondering how is LG packing their latest flagship smart phone, check out our unboxing after the break. To recap on the specs, the LG G4 gets a 5.5″ IPS display that pushes a Quad HD 2560×1440 resolution and it runs on a new 64-bit Hexa-Core Snapdragon 808 processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. On-board it gets 32GB of storage which can be expanded with microSD. The camera is one of its key highlights, offering a 16MP main shooter with Optical Image stabiliser, faster f/1.8 lens, laser auto focus and an array of manual settings. For taking selfies, it gets a larger 8MP front camera that even has a soft flash light. It runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box and it is juiced up with a 3,000mAh capacity battery which is user replaceable.  In the box that we got, the LG G4 comes with a standard micro USB 2.0 cable and a USB charging adapter which surprisingly pushes just 1.8 Amps. Qualcomm currently   the LG G4 as a QuickCharge 2.0 supported device but you probably would need to buy a compatible charger separately. Since this is a review unit, it comes without instruction manuals or a pair of headphones.  The LG G4 isn’t officially sold in Malaysia but there are some   that are selling it for as low as RM2,499 at the moment. Without further ado, watch our unboxing video below:

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung believes its 6 is better than the other 6
tags: Galaxy S6 versus iPhone 6 ads,iPhone 6,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 TVC
contents: It is that time again as Samsung has released a series of ads that compares its   against the  . Entitled 6 > 6, Samsung tries to prove a point that its Galaxy S6 is superior despite having the same model number. So far they have released 2 videos highlighting its wireless charger, wide angle selfie and the Galaxy S6 edge’s extra display tricks which you can watch after the break. If you want to see a direct spec by spec comparison, you can check out our  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Xiaomi is launching something on June 10th and it looks like another smart home appliance
tags: rumour mill,smart appliance,Xiaomi,xiaomi event june 10th,xiaomi teaser
contents: : Xiaomi has posted more teasers and it could be a media player device.   has a big event coming next week and they’ve released some teasers that are hinting at more than just one thing up their sleeves. The brand is known to product home appliances ranging from televisions to   and security. Previously they had introduced a   last year which was teased in a similar manner, with a vague teaser with just a date and the image of a fan. This time, the teaser is showing off multiple old-timey machines that could be hinting towards some brand new smart devices that could be incorporating some aspects of these. It’s possible that the new device could be a water purifier as one of the teasers hints towards such and Xiaomi does have quite a big water purification business in China so it’s quite possible.  There are also rumours that Xiaomi might be working on a water and dust resistant smartphone but at the moment this isn’t too likely. However the brand hasn’t made any substantial claims about what the event really is about so we will have to wait till June 10th to find out.

author: soyacincau
title: Fitbit, The World’s No. 1 Wearable Brand is coming to Malaysia
tags: FitBit,FitBit Enters Malaysia,FitBit Fitness Tracking,FitBit malaysia,FitBit Market Share,fitness tracking,Smart Wearable,wearable
contents: Smart Wearables is a hot segment for tech which is heavily driven by fitness bands. Fitbit, which is one of the biggest names in the fitness tracking business is finally entering the Malaysian market. According to the   for wearables, Fitbit is currently ranked #1 for Q1 2015. They currently command over 34% market share with 3.9 million units sold in the first 3 months of this year. Following closely in 2nd place is none other than  , with its affordable   having sold over 2.8 million units with 24.6% market share. Depending on how active you are, Fitbit offers a wide array of wearables that are suited from the casual day to day activity tracking to its top of the line Fitbit Surge Watch that comes with a continuous heart rate tracking. With its presence in Malaysia, consumers will be able to buy official units backed by official warranty for better peace of mind. If you’re looking for a fitness tracker, which would you pick?

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Xpax Magic SIM gives you free internet and calls at RM5
tags: Celcom,celcom magic sim,Celcom Prepaid,MagicSIM,telco,Xpax,xpax magic sim,Xpax MagicSIM
contents: Xpax’s latest limited edition prepaid offering is finally here, after teasing the Magic SIM prepaid over the last week. Available starting tomorrow, the Magic SIM that’s priced at RM5 per pack is touted to give more free internet than anyone else in the market. This goes consistently with their aim of making the internet more accessible to all. The Magic SIM costs just RM 5 and comes with free basic internet that includes 64kbps unlimited basic internet. The SIM will have RM 3 preloaded airtime with 5 day validity before requiring a new reload. The basic internet covers unlimited messaging for WhatsApp, WeChat and LINE throughout the validity period. For high speed internet for YouTube, Facebook and Instagram, there are giving it for free up to 200MB. On top of that you also get either free 20 minute calls or 20 SMS within the Celcom network.  For reloads, it cost just RM1 a day with denomination of RM5, RM10 and RM30 offering 50MB, 100MB and 300MB High speed internet respectively. The reload amount is still retained, so essentially you get to enjoy freebies while accumulating the full reload credit. If you wish to extend your free internet without topping up, you can do so at RM1/day. Since this is quota based, it is more practical than the current Free 10 minutes high speed internet (3 times a day) which requires activation.  For heavy duty users that need more calls and SMS, Xpax also offers Magic Box bundles with daily, weekly and monthly packages. Monthly packages start at RM25/month for 1GB data + 150 minutes of calls to RM58/month for 4GB data + 150 minutes of calls. Furthermore, there’s no wastage as you can carry forward unused data to the following month. Existing Xpax users can switch over by sending a SMS “MIG MAGIC” to 28882. A RM5 migration charge will apply. For more info, head over to Xpax’s   page.

author: soyacincau
title: Apple Watch comes to more countries including Singapore. To be available in-store as well
tags: apple,Apple Smart Watch,Apple Watch,apple watch edition,Apple Watch In Store Sales,Apple Watch Malaysia,Apple Watch Sales,Apple Watch Singapore,apple watch sport,Smart Watch,wearable
contents: The   which went on sale in a handful of countries will be making its way to more markets on 26th June. The Apple Watch will be sold in our neighbour Singapore, Italy, Mexico, South Korea, Spain, Switzerland and Taiwan, bringing up to a total of 16 countries for its official availability.  Initially sold exclusively online, Apple is finally opening up its sales to on-ground Apple Retail stores and resellers. According to the source, the in-store sales would begin around 18th June with selected models available. The Apple Watch is priced from US$349 (about RM1,300) for the smaller 38mm Apple Watch Sport and it can go all the way up to RM67,000 mark for its top end Apple Watch Edition in 18 Carat Gold. So far there’s no official indication that Apple would be selling their first generation wearable in Malaysia. A few months back, it was   in our local SIRIM database but judging how Apple puts Malaysia on low priority in their iPhone sales, you probably might need to wait a little longer.  If you haven’t seen it yet, you can check out our   below. To get to know this wearable better, you can read our   of the entire range including their most expensive variant.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Now there’s a 512GB microSD card and it costs more than a flagship phone
tags: 512GB microSD,memory card,microdia xtra elite 512GB,microSD,storage
contents: Not too long back SanDisk unleashed a   200GB microSD card designed to tackle our ever increasing need for storage space. Then came along the Microdia Xtra Elite microSD card that packs more than double of that, bearing the largest amount of microSD storage to date at  whopping 512GB in its teeny frame. The SDXC format allows for cards of up to 2 TB in volume but this is still the biggest we’ve seen so far. Microdia says the card will set you back about $1,000 (about RM 3712) and that’s almost twice the price of your average flagship device. However it should be mentioned that the vast majority of smartphones and subsequent microSD compatible devices do not yet support such a large external storage capacity; with the  and the  eing the only ones so far that can support up to 2TB. You could argue that the card is quite future proof but it’s not entirely feasible till more phones (and cameras) can support microSD cards of this magnitude. But if you still insist on The Xtra Elite will also be featuring a Ultra High Speed (UHS) bus with data transfer rates of up to 300MBps and will be using version 4.0 of the Secure Digital standard which also gives it an additional row of pins under the usual ones. The card is mostly expected to be used my pro photographers by the manufacturer due to the large volume and speed. The card goes on sale in July though the final retail price hasn’t been finalised as of yet but this is one microSD card you don’t want to accidentally lose.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The practically weightless Facebook Lite app is finally here
tags: Android,Facebook,facebook lite,facebook lite google play store,Google Play Store,mobile app
contents: For countries that don’t have the benefit of fast internet or good data coverage opening up the Facebook app can be quite a pain with the connection more or less ruining the experience. Initially available in developing countries, Facebook has finally launched the “diet” version of the app on the Google Play Store, Facebook Lite to help developing countries deal with sluggish data connections by trimming down the access fat for a simpler experience. The app has already been in development for about a year with the purpose of having it functional on any Android device regardless of what’s under the hood. Basically the features that have been removed are the most data sucking ones, like video and features like Nearby Friends to create a smoother experience even on older Android phones. The app also uses much lower-res thumbnails when displaying images so users won’t be running their data like water. To sum it up, the app is designed to use as little as possible and this is reflected in its practically weightless download size of 1MB. If you want to give it a go you can download the app  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Sony Xperia Z3+ gets improved driver for wet tracking
tags: Android,Sony,Sony Xperia Z3,touch driver,wet tracking,Xperia Z3
contents: By the looks of things Sony Mobile is finally doing something about their touch driver. For those who have used Sony’s water resistant smartphones or tablet while wet, you would have discovered that the tracking is not entirely accurate when there is water on the screen. For the   however they’re already trying to fix the issue by updating the touch driver to work better while the phone is damp. The video below shows that the wet finger tracking has been given a much needed tweaking and it now works a lot better. Check out the video after the break to see just how functional the phone is while wet.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Gionee Elife E8 to feature an enormous 23 megapixel camera and is set to launch June 10th
tags: elife e8,Gionee,gionee elife e8,gionee elife e8 launch,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: Following some  about  Elife E8 smartphone, the 6 inch device will apparently be sporting a 23.7 megapixel camera on top of other specs that might put it up there with the other flagships. Of the confirmed specs for the E8, the device will have a 23.7 megapixel primary camera that can capture images up to a maddening simulated 100 megapixels resolution. Under the hood, the Elife E8 will have an octa-core processor running 2GHz mated to 3GB RAM as well as 32GB storage. The device is rumoured to have a fingerprint scanner as well, and will be packing a 6 inch QHD AMOLED display to boot. There’s also some news on the Marathon M5, that it will be packing a very large 6,020mAh battery which Gionee says will be able to run for up to four days on a single charge. They haven’t said much about the so-called   feature but we will have to see it to believe it. The phones are set to launch in Beijing come June 10th and we should have more information on the phones come launch.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Qualcomm and Blocks Wearables are teaming up to make modular smartwatches
tags: blocks,blocks wearables,CES 2015,Kickstarter,modular smartwatch,Qualcomm,SmartWatch,wearable
contents: UK based Blocks Wearables is in the process of making the world’s first modular wearable that it has named Blocks, and is getting some help from  to produce it’s innards. The prototypes were shown off earlier this year at CES Las Vegas and they are confirmed to be running on a Snapdragon 400 SoC. The key selling point of the smartwatch is that it’s very modular, like the  . You will be able to customise it as you see fit and the strap of the watch contain blocks that have swappable component sections which is how you will be able to mix and match. So if you want to add additional things like a GPS or a heart-rate monitor sensor, additional batteries or maybe even 4G LTE, you could just yank out a link and replace it with one you need. Even the smartwatch’s face can be swapped out from a square one to a round one if you so like. Interestingly, the device will be running on Android Lollipop instead of Android Wear and this will allow it to be compatible with both iOS and Android devices respectively. The watch planned to be produced via a crowd-funded campaign that’s set to emerge sometime within the next few months.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Honor 7 is set to launch on June 8th
tags: Honor,Honor 7,honor 7 launch,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: A brand new teaser for the Huawei Honor 7 has emerged and it has revealed a launch date. The phone has already been leaked a couple of times now, one of which shows off the rear of the device as well as the   the phone apparently will possess. The device has been hinted at a June release so this could very well be it. The teaser itself doesn’t reveal much besides a launch date and a well-known Einstein quote – “Imagination is everything” in Chinese. Rumour also has it that there will be two versions of the device but we don’t know if they will be launched simultaneously. From what we know about the honor 7 variants are that they are built using aircraft grade metal for their outer shells and both the devices will have similar innards save for the RAM.

author: Amin Ashaari
title: Huawei P8 users get VIP treatment — one-to-one device replacement, free delivery and more
tags: huawei,Huawei customer service,Huawei customer service Malaysia,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Malaysia,Huawei P8 VIP Service,Huawei P8 VIP Service Malaysia
contents: has big ambitions to become one of the best technology brands in the world. In just a few short years, the unknown from China grew to claim the 94th position in Interbrand’s top 100 brands list. Today, Huawei is the top-3 leading brand in the global smartphone market and a major global force in telecommunications and networking. Despite the success, the brand still has a mountain to climb when it comes to brand awareness and perception, because let’s face it, when it comes to prestige or premium, Huawei is not the first name that comes to mind, but the brand is moving in the right direction and it’s heading there fast. One such move is the introduction of the P8 VIP Service that upcoming   users will be able to enjoy customer service that’s beyond what most other brands provide. Under the P8 VIP service, P8 users get a one-to-one device exchange for any faults or problems within the first 12 months of purchase. On top of that, if you bring in your P8 for repairs, you will get it delivered to you for free and if for any reason, the screen on your Huawei P8 is damaged, you can get one-time screen replacement for free. The only other brand that we know off that offer a similar level of customer service is Samsung with its   for the Galaxy S6 and S6 edge.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The larger Samsung Galaxy S6 Plus rumoured to be unveiled soon
tags: galaxy s6 plus,galaxy s6 plus launch,rumour mill,Samsung,samsung galaxy s6 plus
contents: Some new details about Samsung’s Galaxy S6 Plus have surfaced alongside the initial rumours that   as the aforementioned phone. Earlier it was rumoured that the device was set to appear during IFA Berlin later this year but now it appears that it will be revealed a bit sooner than the trade show. It’s said the debut will happen in the few coming weeks though the actual dates are not certain. To recap the specs, Project Zero 2 is said to have a smaller 5.4 or 5.5 inch dual-curved Super AMOLED display and will be sporting a Snapdragon 808 hexa-core processor under the hood. The device is also expected to come with a 16 megapixel rear camera and 5 megapixel front snapper as well as 32GB internal storage. Of course, none of these details have been given full confirmation from Samsung so it should still be taken with a grain of salt till the actual launch comes around.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Android Lollipop is finally coming to the Zenfone 4, 5 and 6
tags: Android,Android 5.0 Lollipop,Asus,ASUS ZenFone,ASUS ZenFone 4,ASUS ZenFone 5,ASUS ZenFone 6,OS update
contents: After declaring that the Zenfone 5   for some time to come last week, the brand has just released some great news; owners of the  ,   and   can now upgrade to Android 5.0 Lollipop. As of the moment the updates are still rolling out over the air but if you absolutely cannot wait you can head over to ASUS’s site and download it via PC to update your phone manually. As for the versions, the Zenfone 5 A500KL will be getting version 3.23.40.52, while the Zenfone 4 A400CG will be getting version 7.3.3 while the Zenfone 6 A600CG and A601CG will be getting Lollipop too but it doesn’t look like you can get it any other way besides manually for now. You can get the download updates here for the  ,   and  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 8.0 gets TENAA certified, could be world’s thinnest tablet
tags: Android,galaxy tab S2,rumour mill,samsung galaxy tab s2 8.0,samsung galaxy tab s2 launch
contents: Now we have proof that the Galaxy Tab S2 8.0 is indeed on its way since it has just received TENAA certification. According to the tablet’s overall dimensions at 198.2 x 134.5 x 5.4 mm, this could very well be the thinnest tablet to date, measuring in at a paltry 5.4mm.

author: soyacincau
title: Celcom Xpax teases new product, wants you to believe its magical
tags: Free Internet,Magic SIM,MagicSIM,prepaid,Xpax,Xpax MagicSIM,Xpax Prepaid
contents: : Xpax #MagicSIM is now   offering free unlimited messaging, free high-speed internet and free calls/SMS.  Over the past few days, Celcom prepaid brand Xpax has been teasing its new Magic SIM prepaid without providing even the slightest hint of its plan offering. They engaged a couple of social influencers to create the   hype. To top it off, some online retailers claimed to have sold out the Magic SIM without any notice of its sales in the first place. Even their   wasn’t able to reveal any info until stocks are “replenished”. What we do know is that Xpax’s Magic SIM claims to give you more free internet than anyone else. The current Xpax prepaid offers   each month with its Free 10 minutes for 3 sessions a day that’s activated by dialing *118#. Hopefully the new free internet offering would be quota based instead of a time-based activation which is quite a hassle to manage.  If you’re dying to know what Magic SIM is all about, it will be officially launched tomorrow at noon. Do follow us on   for the latest updates. You can view the #MagicSIM teaser after the break.

author: soyacincau
title: Unboxed: Huawei P8
tags: Android,huawei,Huawei Malaysia,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Malaysia,Huawei P8 Unboxing,smart phone,Unboxing Video
contents: Huawei aspires to take on the latest flagships with its new   smart phone. Trying to shred off its perception of making cheap phones, the new P8 emphasises on premium build materials and design. In order to provide an upmarket experience from the start, the packaging of the Huawei P8 is quite different from the rest. Instead of a usual paper box, the latest Huawei Flagship comes in a hard plastic case that opens from the side. Immediately you will see the side of the device, showing off its aluminium frame body that’s only 6.4mm thick.  To recap on the specs, the Huawei P8 for Malaysia with 3GB of RAM and 16GB of storage, which is expandable with microSD up to 128GB. The front gets a 5.2″ Full HD display and it runs on their own Hi Silicon Kirin 930 Octa-Core processor (4xA53 @ 2.0GHz + 4xA53 @1.5GHz). For imaging, there’s a main 4-colour (RGBW) 13MP camera with OIS while selfie duties are handled by its higher 8MP front camera. Powering the P8 is a 2,680mAh capacity battery and it runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop out of the box. While the P8 doesn’t come with any fancy fast charging capabilities, it gets a USB charger that pushes just 1Amp instead of a higher 2Amp output. The Huawei P8 is   and it is available for pre-orders at VMall. Check out the unboxing video below.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The HTC One ME, the affordable variant of the One M9+ has been announced
tags: HTC,htc one me,Mediatek,mediatek helio x10,one m3,smartphone
contents: HTC has officially announced their brand new HTC One ME, designed to be the cheaper alternative to the One M9+. Sharing similar design elements from both the  and   with a polycarbonate and metal frame. The new phone will have a 64 bit 2.2GHz octa-core Helio X10 processor as well as a 5.2 inch Quad HD display at 1440 x 2560 resolution, a fingerprint sensor as well as LTE and dual SIM support. The device will be running on 3GB RAM and 32GB expandable memory as well as a 2,840 mAH battery. As for the camera the One ME has a single 20 megapixel rear camera with 4K video recording capabilities as well as a dual LED flash and the front snapper will be a 4 megapixel UltraPixel camera for selfie shots. The phone will also be getting dual front facing BoomSound speakers like the rest of its kin. The HTC One ME will launch first in China and other Asian markets but exactly where and when has not yet been announced. The pricing also has not been confirmed either but the phone will come in meteor grey, gold sepia and rose gold colour variants that are common to HTC’s design.

author: soyacincau
title: Huawei P8: An impressive alternative to more expensive flagship phones
tags: Android,Dual Sim,huawei,Huawei Ascend P8,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Launch,huawei p8 lite,Huawei P8 Lite Malaysia,Huawei P8 Malaysia,Huawei P8 South Pacific Launch,mobile devices,Mobile OS Android,smart phone
contents: The   flagship smart phone is officially launched in our South Pacific region and it is a huge step up from its predecessor, the  . For the Malaysian market, Huawei Malaysia has  at VMall at  . In Singapore it will be available starting tomorrow 3rd June for SGD699. With the   and the   being top contenders for a high-end smart phone, Huawei aims to position itself as an alternative without burning a hole in your pocket.  In terms of design, the Huawei P8 gets a metal unibody design that’s only 6.4mm thick. That’s thinner than the Galaxy S6’s 6.8mm and iPhone 6’s 6.9mm thickness. The screen is a 5.2″ IPS Full HD display but with thinner bezels, it feels like a much smaller device in the hand. The overall build is much improved over the Ascend P7 and we   quite similar to the  . Powering the P8 is Huawei’s in house developed 64-bit Kirin Octa-Core 930 processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. The early Kirin processors like the 910T on the Ascend P7 was quite mediocre, but the newer ones including the Kirin 920 on the   has been quite remarkable. On-board it gets 16GB of storage which you can put on a microSD card into its second SIM slot of the device. As photography is among the main usage of a smart phone, Huawei is put more emphasis on its camera capabilities. The 13MP main camera has Optical Image Stabilisation but Huawei claims it has been improved to tolerate shakes better at 1.2 degrees, double of what other smart phones are capable of.  On top of that, the P8 also boasts the world’s first 4-colour 13MP sensor. According to Huawei, this offers better brightness by 32% and 78% noise reduction in low light. The P8 also gets a DSLR-level ISP which helps to optimise its picture quality. In terms of features, the Huawei P8 is proud to showcase its light painting capabilities built in with its camera app. There’s no need to adjust shutter speed or manul settings and all you’ll need to do is to select the right mode and start drawing with any light source.  For more epic videos, the P8 has a rather unique Director mode that works in-sync with 3 devices You can have each P8 set up to capture different angles and the director mode lets you select the combine the right footages for the final video on the fly.  Being a flagship, a smart phone should be able to last as long as your busy schedule. With a 2,680mAh non-removable battery, Huawei reckons that the P8 could last up to 1.5 days in normal use or up to 1 full day with heavy usage. While most new flagships are boasting quick charge, Huawei surprisingly lacks any fast charging features on the P8. If the P8 does deliver all day battery life performance like the  , many wouldn’t mind the omission of a quick charge. On the software front the P8 runs on the Android 5.0 Lollipop with its own custom EMUI 3.1. There are a couple of smart features including a rather different knuckle sense. This lets you screen capture and crop using your knuckles. There are a couple of features that help to boost its WiFi and 4G LTE connectivity including a faster network lock-on while roaming. Also announced during the regional launch is the Huawei P8 Lite, an affordable compact version that’s also coming to Malaysia. It gets a smaller 5″ display that pushes lower HD 720p resolution, Under the hood, it gets a mid-range Kirin 620 processor with 2GB RAM, which is similar to the  . It gets 16GB of storage, 13MP + 5MP cameras and a 2,200mAh capacity battery. The P8 lite will be available in Singapore at month end for SGD329. During its London launch, there’s a larger   model boasting a huge 6.8″ display, 32GB of storage and a whooping 4,360mAh capacity battery which is rated to last more than 2 days. For our region, Huawei has no plans to bring this yet. If they do consider, it is likely towards the end of the year.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: ASUS announces the ZenPad 8.0 and the ZenPad S 8.0, has interchangeable functional backplates that change everything
tags: Android 5.0,Asus,asus computex,ASUS ZenPad,asus zenpad 8.0,asus zenpad launch,asus zenpad S 8.0,computex 2015,Tablet,zenpad 8.0,zenpad 8.0S
contents: Announced today at  are two new tablets from ASUS’s ZenPad series, the ZenPad 8.0 and ZenPad S 8.0, with the former being the first to feature a backplate that is more than just decoration; it actually adds features to your tablet. The new tablets have been a long time in the coming, with   hitting the internet ahead of launch detailing the style and specs of the devices. Both devices sport a dual-texture design with a leather-like appearance for better grip and of course, style. On the surface, the tablets already look like they could give Samsung’s tablets a run for their money, with much better specs under the hood as well as the versatility that comes with the interchangeable Zen Case back covers for the ZenPad 8.0. In terms of internals the  ZenPad 8.0 will be getting an 8 inch IPS display at 1280 x 800 resolution and will be packing an Intel x3-C3200 processor under the hood alongside a 4000mAh battery. Most importantly the device supports interchangeable covers that either amp your battery life by a whopping 15 hours with the Power Case or turn your tablet into a personal entertainment device by giving it six additional speakers and is the first tablet to support DTS 5.1 Surround Sound with the Audio Cover. This combined with the fact that the unit already has two front facing speakers should make it quite the device to watch movies on. The ZenPad 8.0 will also have a simple 5 megapixel rear and 2 megapixel front camera combo and will be available as a LTE/WiFi and WiFi only model. The ZenPad S 8.0 on the other hand is all business, with a 64-bit Intel Atom Z3580 processor, 4GB RAM as well as a USB 3.0 Type-C connector which is a first for ASUS. The display will be similar to that of the ZenPad 8.0 but will have a much higher 2048 x 1536 resolution similar to that of an iPad mini. The device will also comes with the Z Stylus which seems to be very similar in function to that of Samsung’s S-Pen, albeit sized more like a normal pen with a 1.2mm writing tip as well as pressure sensitivity. Both tablets will be coming in 8GB and 16GB expandable storage variants, Android 5.0 and ASUS’s Tru2Life display tech for sharp images and crispy colours.

author: soyacincau
title: Huawei P8 priced at RM1,799. Pre-order starts today at 3:08PM
tags: Android,Dual Sim,huawei,Huawei Ascend P8,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Launch,Huawei P8 Malaysia,huawei talkband B2,Huawei TalkBand B2 Malaysia,mobile devices,Mobile OS Android,smart phone

Strangely, despite the pre-orders starting today, the   has indicated 2nd – 18th June as registration of interest period. author: Sirap Bandung
title: ZTE Nubia X8 leaked, will have 4GB RAM, bezel-less QHD display and a massive battery
tags: Android,mobile,nubia x8,rumour mill,smartphone,ZTE Nubia X8
contents: Seems everyone is gunning for the bezel-less look, with ‘s next possible flagship sporting the very same. Dubbed the Nubia X8, this new phone was accidentally leaked on ZTE’s own website and has subsequently been pulled down but not before the internet got a hold of the details. In terms of form factor, the Nubia X8 has an extremely scrawny 7.9mm thick frame but manages to squeeze in some pretty good specs. The phone is expected to have a 5.5 inch or 6 inch bezel less QHD screen with a 1440 x 2560 resolution, on top of 4GB RAM and a choice of 32GB or 64 GB expandable storage that can handle up to 64GB. No word yet of the processor the device will be packing but it will also have support for 4G LTE and 3G on top of having Android 5.0 Lollipop out of the box. The device will also be sporting a very massive 5,120 mAh battery which should keep the phone juiced for a long period of time, possibly in support of all that extra multi tasking the phone will be capable of with the huge 4GB of RAM. The heavier 201g weight the Nubia X8 is mostly due to the battery but it’s a fair trade off for the battery you will be getting. We don’t have details yet for the possible pricing or release date but the phone will be available in Black and Gold colour variants.

author: soyacincau
title: ASUS ZenWatch 2 now more stylish with digital crown and magnetic charger
tags: Android Wear,ASUS ZenWatch,ASUS ZenWatch 2,ASUS ZenWatch 2 Launch,ASUS ZenWatch 2 Official,Computex,computex 2015,Smart Watch,WI501Q,WI502Q
contents: Barely a year since the original    , ASUS has released its new   that’s also powered with Android Wear. With newer smart watches putting more emphasis on fashion and style like the  , the new ZenWatch now comes with 3 case colours and a choice of 18 different strap and colour combinations. To better suit men and women, the ZenWatch 2 now comes in 2 sizes of either a 22mm or 18mm width strap option.   At the front, it gets a similar AMOLED display that’s protected by a curve 2.5D Gorilla Glass 3. It is also water resistant rated at IP67 which allows it to be submerged under water at about 1 metre for up to 30 minutes. In terms of body colours, the stainless steel body comes in Silver, Gunmetal or Rose Gold colours. For the active lifestyle, the durable rubber strap is available in Blue, Orange, Red and Taupe colours, while the leather strap option comes in Khaki, Brown, Gray, Blue, and Orange. For the ultimate luxury look, the stainless steel link bracelet comes in body matching Silver, Gunmetal or Rose Gold colours. If you need something even more exclusive, ASUS has partner with Swarovski to produce a special leather strap with embossed diamond patterns with a couple of Swarovski crystals.  In terms of usability, the ZenWatch 2 now comes with a digital crown which offers an alternative way to navigate around the watch. In addition, they have also included a magnetic charger which is not only more effortless to rejuice but claims to be faster as well. They have also included a couple of software enhancements such as a new Wellness app, smart companion features and other various integrated ZenUI features that goes well with your ASUS Zenfone smart phone. Without giving specific numbers, ASUS claims that the battery life has been improved over its predecessor. For the larger WI501Q model (22mm width), it even comes with a mobile power bank, which is basically a dock with a built-in battery similar to the Samsung  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Love taking selfies? Now there’s a Zenfone for that.
tags: asus zenfone selfie,computex 2015,rumour mill,smartphone,ZenFone,zenfone selfie,zenfone selfie launch,zenpad tablet
contents:
We   that ASUS was launching a selfie oriented smartphone and the very same was launched today at  . As predicted the smartphone has a 13 megapixel front and rear camera which sport Dual LED Real Tone flash on both ends for more natural looking selfies. The rear camera will also feature a rear laser autofocus as well as a large f/2.0 aperture. In terms of form factor, the Zenfone Selfie looks very similar to that of the Zenfone 2, especially in terms of the volume rocker come shutter button out back. 
 The Zenfone Selfie itself will be sporting a 5.5 inch IPS display with Full HD resolution at 403ppi that features Gorilla Glass 4 to protect against those accidental dings and scratches. Under the hood it will have a 64-bit Qualcomm Snapdragon 615, but we have yet to confirm the amount of RAM the device will be packing but we suspect it would be around the 2 – 3GB mark. The device does share a lot in common with the  , that also features similar 13 megapixel cameras with dual-tone flash front and back. However the Selfie doesn’t enjoy the same water resistance that the Desire EYE has but instead benefits from a rear laser autofocus that should result in faster focusing. The Desire EYE also has a better Snapdragon 801 processor as opposed to the Selfie’s Snapdragon 615. Other camera-related enhancements include a HDR selfie mode, real time Beautification, Low Light Selfie and a new ZenMotion gesture dedicated to snapping you a selfie. The Zenfone line of phones are already well known to have good low light capabilities so we believe the Zenfone Selfie won’t be too different. The Zenfone Selfie will have a bunch of optional accessories available as well, namely the ZenFone Selfie Swing which essentially functions as a stand for the phone. You also get the ability to immediately view your selfie through the ZenFone Selfie MyView case without having to turn on your display so you can save on power. The device will be rocking a lot of different colour variants to choose from, with both matte and metallic colour options with matching MyView cases. Price and availability have also yet to be confirmed but we should find out relatively soon.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: HTC launches Desire 826G+ and 626G+ budget smartphones for the Taiwanese market
tags: Android,HTC,HTC Desire,HTC Desire 626G+,HTC desire 826G+,mobile devices,smartphone
contents: HTC has just introduced two new dual-SIM smartphones that share quite a few bits in common, with the exception of screen size and a few other features. Both devices will be sporting the same octa-core 1.7GHz MediaTek MT6592 CPU as well as 1GB RAM, 8GB storage and 2,600mAh battery. They will also be running on HTC Sense UI 6.0 based on Android 4.4.2 KitKat. The processor is also the same one that’s under the hood of the dual SIM   so performance wise the devices should be relatively similar. Here is where the devices get a little different. The HTC Desire 826G+ will have a 5.5 inch display packing 720p as well as a 8 megapixel front camera and a 13 megapixel rear camera as well as BoomSound Support. The Desire 626G+ on the other hand has a slightly smaller 5 inch 720p HD display and has a 5 megapixel front and 13 megapixel rear camera combo instead. It’s pretty evident that the phones are likely aimed mostly at the selfie taking crowd, with the Desire 626G+ being the slightly lower end (and therefore more affordable) model. The devices will be retailing for TWD 4,990 (about RM 596) for the Desire 626G+ while the Desire 826G+ will retail for TWD 5,990 (about RM 716). The new phones will be sold in Taiwan but there hasn’t yet been any word whether or not the phones will go global or at least be released in this region.

author: soyacincau
title: Huawei P8 Lite spotted in SIRIM database. It’s coming to Malaysia
tags: Android,huawei,Huawei P8,huawei p8 lite,Huawei P8 Lite Malaysia,Huawei P8 Lite Specs,Huawei P8 Malaysia,smart phone
contents: The   will be launched in   region with   in Malaysia tomorrow. If you’re looking for something more affordable, the P8 Lite appears to be heading to our way.  A new Huawei device   has just being spotted in our Malaysian SIRIM database. Looks like this would be hitting our shores along with the P8 in mid-June. Spec wise the P8 Lite is said to have a 5″ HD 720p display, a 1.2GHz Octa-Core Kirin 620 processor, 2GB RAM and 16GB of storage. It also gets a 13MP rear and 5MP cameras, along with a 2,200mAh capacity battery. The processor is similar to the Honor 4X but it comes with a tiny 2,200mAh battery. The P8 Lite also runs on Android 5.0 like its P8 siblings and it runs on their proprietary Emotion UI 3.1 on top. The Huawei P8 in the other hand offers a higher spec offering with a 5.2″ Full HD display with Kirin 930/935 processor mated to 3GB of RAM. On-board there’s 16GB of storage with a microSD expandable slot. For imaging, it gets a 13MP OIS main shooter plus a larger 8MP front camera. . You can check out our   from the Huawei ICT Roadshow. Stay tuned as we are currently in Singapore for the regional launch to give you the latest updates on the Huawei P8 availability and pricing in Malaysia.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The honor 6 gets a pricecut, sales starts 4th June
tags: Honor,Honor 6,honor 6 price cut,huawei,Huawei Honor 6,kevinngtk,promotion,smartphone,tipster
contents: As alerted by our frequent tipster   the   has has its prices slashed from RM 1059 to RM 899 just as the  is getting launched today. The device has barely been in the market for a year and this gives it even more value for money considering the price was adjusted for GST not too long back. Sales for the honor 6 with the new pricing will start on 4th June at 3.08pm, and they are offering the first customer to get the phone the device for free assuming you’re lucky enough to snag it first. To recap on the specs, the Honor 6 is quite an compelling device with a 5″ Full HD display and it runs on a 1.7GHz Octa-Core Hi-Silicon Kirin 920 processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. Taking pictures are handled by a 13MP Sony BSI camera and there’s also front facing 5MP camera, 16GB of expandable storage and a decent sized 3,100mAh capacity battery. You can purchase the  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: ASUS Zenfone Selfie heading to Malaysia in September under RM1K
tags: Android,Asus,asus zenfone selfie,asus zenfone selfie malaysia,asus zenfone selfie malaysia launch,rumour mill,smartphoine,zenfone selfie
contents: To recap on the specs,  Zenfone Selfie will be sporting a 5.5 inch IPS display with Full HD resolution at 403ppi that features Gorilla Glass 4 to protect against those accidental dings and scratches. Under the hood it will have a 64-bit Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 mated to 3GB RAM. The storage capacity has yet to be finalised as it will vary from country to country but we are expecting at least 32GB for the Malaysian market.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Grabbing drones out of the air is a seriously bad idea
tags: Accident,drones,Enrique Iglesias,flying drones
contents:
Whoever thinks that grabbing a   in midair is a good idea, you might want to think twice. Despite their flimsy nature drones are still whirling blades of death and attempting to snag one while its in flight is a lot more dangerous than people would believe. Enrique Iglesias has taken to using drones during his shows to get crowd shots and had developed the unfortunate habit of grabbing them mid-flight to get POV shots with his most recent attempt at his concert in Tijuana ending badly. So the singer sliced open his fingers on stage while attempting the stunt, spattering blood everywhere. To the singer’s credit he continued performing on stage despite being soaked in blood (and probably in a lot of pain) after the accident for about half an hour before being rushed on a flight to Los Angeles to see a specialist. Maybe he would have fared better if he had relied on something like the   instead. 
 So remember kids, grabbing flying machines out of the air isn’t cool, especially if you could end up missing your fingers.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The LG G4 goes for a two hour dip, will it survive?
tags: itechworld11,LG,LG G4,LG G4 smartphone,LG G4 water test,Video
contents: Another smartphone takes a dunking and this time the   is put to the test. Apparently this isn’t the first time the guys behind   have sent an phone for a swim as they’re known for sending lots of phones to their potentially watery depths to test out if they will survive. So will it? So while the phone will be able to take a bit of water it is still not water resistant and you will still need to act quickly to dry it out else you are risking permanent damage. So don’t take the LG G4 to the shower.

author: soyacincau
title: Can’t open Messages on your iPhone? Just summon Siri for help
tags: apple,Apple Watch,Crash,iMessage,iOS Bug,iPad,iPhone,iPhone 6,iPhone 6 Plus,Siri,Unicode Bug
contents: Currently there’s a   where a single message is able to crash the  ,   and even the  . This is due to its difficulty to render specific unicodes which results a crash or a reboot.  Apple has acknowledged the issue and they are working on a new software update. In the time being if you’ve received such message and couldn’t open Message properly, Apple wants you to ask Siri for help.  To be able to re-open Messages, Apple recommends the following steps: So far there’s no timeline on the new iOS software update but if you want to prevent further random crashes, another   is to disable lock scren notifications for messages.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Lumia 940 and 940 XL rumoured to have USB type C connectors
tags: Lumia,lumia 940,lumia 940 XL,microsoft,Microsoft Lumia 940,Microsoft Lumia 940 XL,rumour mill,USB Type C,windows phone
contents: Rumour has it that the purported Lumia 940 and 940 XL won’t only have   but will also be sporting 20 megapixel cameras and USB Type C connectors. As of the moment the Lumia 940 is rumoured to have a 5.2 inch display on 2560 x 1440, 3GB RAM and 32GB internal storage on top of a 3,000mAh battery. They will also apparently sport a 20 megapixel camera which isn’t too alien for Lumia phones considering their heritage of having huge snappers out back. On the Lumia 940 XL phablet on the other hand will apparently have a larger 5.7 inch display but similar internals as the Lumia 940 with the exception of a slightly larger battery at 3,300mAh and a Snapdragon 810 processor under the hood. Both phones will also apparently be sporting USB Type C connectors which might be used for the Continuit feature which will allow users to swap between touch and desktop modes. The connectors are able to carry video, power and data simultaneously so the inclusion of the tech would make data transfer a lot simpler if they do turn out to actually have them.
