The leaked roadmap below gives away the devices as well as the dates they will be rolled out on top of the specs of the devices. Take note that the schedule could very well be just for China markets and may not apply to global launch dates. June will be seeing the launch of the  which is expected to have a 5-inch 1080p display with a Snapdragon 810 MSM8994 processor alongside a 13 megapixel rear camera with OIS and a 5 megapixel front camera. Next would be the  with a 5.5-inch HD screen, Snapdragon 410 MSM8919 chipset with a 13 megapixel rear and 5 megapixel front camera combo along with the Xiaomi Redmi Note 2 Pro with a 5-inch 1080p display, Snapdragon 615 chipset and a similar camera setup as the Redmi Note 2, coming in July. Finally, November will be seeing the launch of the  which will be sporting a 5.2 inch QHD display, Snapdragon 820 processor and a 20.2 megapixel rear camera. Also on the list is three mystery Honor devices as well as the  which is due sometime in August which comes in two size variants of 5.5-inch and 5.2-inch flavours sporting a 13 megapixel rear cam for the 5.5-inch variant and a 16 megapixel camera for the 5.2-inch variant, with both models sporting a Kirin processor. Hopefully Xiaomi will still be sticking to their launch dates after the leak, though it may not bode so well for the company to have such information divulged it’s given the fans a lot of be excited about in the months to come.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung’s Gear A smartwatch might launch with the Galaxy Note 5
tags: gear A,note 5,rumour mill,Samsung,samsung galaxy note 5,samsung gear A,SmartWatch,Tizen,wearable
contents: Heads up, Samsung’s round smartwatch is likely to be launched alongside the   at IFA this year, marking the official appearance of the  . The watch will be Samsung’s first round smartwatch and will also be the brand’s first wearable to use a rotating bezel ring to interact with the device. Other details about the smartwatch is that there will be two variants of the device, a crown shaped power button and wireless charging. It will also be running on Tizen and very likely one of Samsung’s Exynos chips as well. Unfortunately, Samsung has never really stated when it will launch the Gear A, but since Samsung has a habit of launching it’s smartwatches alongside flagship devices there’s a fairly high chance it will either make it’s debut with the Note 5 or show up sometime later this year, as sources claim that the delays are for the sake of ensuring the product is not rushed in development. Still, this is mostly hearsay and should be treated as such till more details about the watch surface.

author: soyacincau
title: Maxis offers the HTC One M9+ from RM1,699
tags: HTC,HTC One M9,HTC One M9 Malaysia,HTC One M9 Plus,HTC One M9 Plus Malaysia,HTC One M9 Plus Maxis,Maxis,MaxisONE Plan
categories: Android,HTC,Maxis,Mobile Devices,Mobile OS,Players on the Field
contents: The   has arrived in Malaysia at RM2,599 and if you want to get it on contract, you can get on contract with the MaxisOne Plan.  The One M9+ is a different variant of the original One M9 and it features a higher resolution Quad HD 5.2″ display with a MediaTek 2.2GHz Octa-Core processor underneath. It also comes with 3GB RAM and 32GB of storage which is expandable with microSD. At the back, it gets a 20MP main camera that comes with a secondary camera for a Duo camera set up. Meanwhile its Ultrapixel 4MP camera is moved to the front for selfie duties.  On Maxis, the HTC One M9+ are priced as follows with 24 months contract: Durign sign up, you would need to pay 4 months subscription upfront as advance payment which will be refunded back to your monthly bill usage. So if you’re taking up the MaxisOne Plan at RM128/month, you would need to pay RM512 during registration. Prices listed above does not include 6% GST. At the moment, only the Silver colour version is being offered at their  . You can read more details of the HTC One M9+ in our local  .

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung Galaxy Note 5 details emerged along with Project Zen
contents: With the   and   out of the way, it is obvious that Samsung is working on the   as their next big thing. Like the past Galaxy Note launches, the upcoming Galaxy Note 5 should be making its debut at IFA 2015 that’s happening in early September.  The folks at Sammobile had acquired a few interesting details of the upcoming flagship phablet. Unlike the Galaxy Note 4, there would be only one variant for the Galaxy Note 5 which possibly means that there won’t be a unit running on Snapdragon 810 or 820 processor. The display of the standard Galaxy Note 5 would be a flat screen that pushes either 2K (Quad HD) or 4K resolution.  In terms of processor, it is rumoured to be having a newer Exynos 7422 unit which is their first all-in-one solution with an integrated CPU, GPU, RAM, storage and modem in a single chip. However there’s also a possibility that the Note 5 could be running on a newer Exynos 7430 processor.   For the curve display variant a.k.a.   replacement, it is speculated as “Project Zen” internally. Unlike the Galaxy S6 edge and Galaxy Note edge which are essentially the same device with a different display, Project Zen apparently would be a very different device and the hardware may not be entirely high-end.  The display is said to be featuring a smaller 5.4″ or 5.5″ dual-curved Super AMOLED display and runs on a Hexa-Core Qualcomm Snapdragon 808 processor that’s powering the  . Other spec details includes an S-Pen, 16GB of storage, 16MP main camera with OIS and a 8MP front camera. Being a notch below the Galaxy Note 5, perhaps we could be seeing a smaller price gap between the two new models. Currently, the Galaxy Note Edge and the Galaxy S6 edge are priced RM500 more than its normal flat screen version.

author: soyacincau
title: Uber has finally arrived in Penang
tags: mobile app,penang,Penang Taxi,Transport App,Transportation,Uber,Uber in Penang,Uber Malaysia,Uber Penang
contents: Attention Penangites, Uber – Your   has finally arrived. Penang is Uber’s 3rd Malaysian city after Kuala Lumpur and Johor Bahru, and they are available now throughout the island. One of the benefits of Uber is that you can request for a clean and safe ride directly from your smart phone. Another convenience of using Uber is that it is completely cashless, as your trips are charged automatically to your assigned credit or debit cards. This means you can just hop on and off an Uber ride without worrying about small change.  In terms of vehicle, there’s only a single “Uber” option and their website lists Proton Saga, Perodua Myvi and Toyota Vios as their available options.  In terms of rates, the base fare is RM2 and they charge both RM0.35/minute and RM0.70 per KM for the trip. For a start, there’s limited number of vehicles so wait times would be longer than usual. This is expected to be improved over time once they have recruit more drivers onto their system.  As an early promo, you can enter the promo code UBERINPENANG to redeem 2 free rides worth RM30 each. You can download the Uber app which is available for  ,   and  .

author: soyacincau
title: OPPO R7 passes SIRIM certification. Expected to be released soon.
tags: Android,Dual Sim,Oppo,Oppo R7,OPPO R7 Malaysia,smart phone
contents: It is no secret that OPPO is about to release its new    . This is the successor of its current   that’s super thin at 4.85mm and it carries over the similar durable stainless steel frame and back.  Ahead of its global announcement, the OPPO R7 has just passed our Malaysian SIRIM certification with the model R7f. From the little certification details, the R7 has dual-SIM slots and it will support 4G LTE in both 1800MHz and 2600MHz.  Just to recap what OPPO has revealed so far, the R7 appears to be similar with the current R5 but it gets a couple of new additions. At the front, there’s a physical home button which is probably the first for OPPO. There’s a possibility that the home button could double up as a one touch fingerprint scanner for easier unlocking.  For the front, it gets a 2.5D screen which has a slight rounded edges at the sides that’s similar to the iPhone 6 and Galaxy Note 4. Being an R series, you can expect this to be super slim but it may not be as thin as their current R5. If they are plan to push this as a flagship, OPPO should considering putting a larger battery capacity into this one. As usual, you can expect OPPO’s VOOC rapid charging technology which does 0-75% in just 30 minutes.  With the device being certification in our local SIRIM database, it looks like Malaysia would be among the first wave countries to receive it after its global announcement. The OPPO R7 is said to be   in May.

author: soyacincau
title: ASUS ZenFone 2 officially launched in Malaysia
tags: 4GB RAM,Android,Asus,ASUS Incredible ZenDay,ASUS Malaysia,ASUS ZE500CL,ASUS ZE551ML,ASUS ZenFone 2,ASUS ZenFone 2 4G RAM Malaysia,ASUS Zenfone 2 4GB RAM,ASUS ZenFone 2 Consumer Launch,ASUS ZenFone 2 Malaysia,ASUS Zenfone 2 Malaysia Launch,ASUS ZenFone 2 Price,smart phone,Zenfone 2 Malaysia
contents: ASUS Malaysia has officially launched its   smart phone series in Malaysia. As revealed earlier  , we will be getting a total of 5 variants with price starting from RM599 for the base model. For those looking forward to own the 4GB RAM variant, is is priced from RM1,099 with 32GB of storage.  The full Malaysian pricing are as follows. The ZenFone 2 was launched at its   where fans can get to purchase the device on the spot. All 5 models are available but with limited quantities in selected colours. You can get more details of the device in our  .  From the event, ASUS Malaysia has also announced that   on contract as well. On Digi, they are only offering 2 variants, the ZE550ML and the ZE551ML with 32GB. For existing loyal customers of at least 1 year, you can get it free with   during registration.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Snake is making a return for touchscreen devices
tags: Android,iOS,mobile app,Mobile Game,nokia,smartphones,Snake,snake rewind,snake rewind game,windows phone
contents: We’re sure most people still remember the old glory days of playing Snake on their Nokia phones, in all it’s monochrome glory. Those days are long behind us, the times when you were stuck with whatever software was on your feature phone, and almost always there would be Snake. Now the game is making a comeback for touchscreen phones thanks to Nokia engineer Taneli Armanto who was originally responsible for putting the game on the Nokia 6110 and developer Rumilus Design for a fresh take on good ol’ Snake. The game has been aptly named “Snake Rewind” both as a revisiting to classic Snake as well as one of the game’s mechanics that lets you “rewind” if you happen to Game Over. Graphics are quite minimalistic but sports a lot of special effects that are more commonplace in today’s games. It also looks like there will be a healthy mix of old and new features, with missions you can complete in the game as well as visual modes that imitate Snake from past and present, so if you fancy playing Snake on a Cathode Tube screen or exactly the way it was on the Nokia 6110 you can do so.can do just that. No news yet on how much the game is going to be priced, but it looks like it might be a freemium game because you seem to be able to purchase rewinds. Snake REwind is expected to crop up on Windows Phone, Android and iOS app stores on 14th May. In the meantime, check out the game trailer below.

author: soyacincau
title: You can get the ASUS Zenfone 2 from RM0 on Digi
tags: Android,Asus,ASUS ZenFone 2,ASUS Zenfone 2 DiGi,ASUS ZenFone 2 Malaysia,DiGi,smart phone
categories: Android,Asus,DiGi,Mobile Devices,Mobile OS,Players on the Field
contents:
: Zenfone 2 is   on Digi Online Store. The   is also available on contract via Digi and existing loyal subscribers can get it for free with zero upfront payment. Out of the 5 models launched for Malaysia, Digi is offering the mid-range ZE550ML and its higher-spec ZE551ML variant with 4GB RAM.  The ZenFone 2 (ZE550ML) comes with a 5.5″ HD 720p display and it runs on Intel’s 1.8GHz Atom Z3560 processor with 2GB RAM and has 16GB of storage.  If you prefer something better, the ZE551ML from Digi gets a higher resolution 5.5″ Full HD display, 2.3GHz Intel Atom Z3580 processor with 4GB RAM, along with 32GB of storage. Outright, both are priced at RM749 and RM1,099 respectively (inclusive with GST). The full Digi Zenfone 2 bundled offer is as follows: 
 During registration, there’s an advance payment between RM120-800 depending on plan and it will be rebated across your contract period. All plans are tied with 24 months duration except for Smart Plan 78 which has an additional 12 months option.  As a special promo for exising Digi subscribers that have been with them for at least a year, you can pick up either devices for free and there’s no upfront payment required. However this is only limited to its highest Smart Plan 148. Those attending the launch event can pick up the Zenfone 2 via Digi today and it will be officially available to everyone next week on their online store.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi Mi Note Pro launched. Improved with lower price tag
tags: Mi Note,Mi Note Pro,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Mi Note,Xiaomi Mi Note Pro,Xiaomi Mi Note Pro Availability,Xiaomi Mi Note Pro Sales
contents: Xiaomi has officially announced its  , which is the higher spec variant of its Mi Note flagship phablet. It gets a 5.7″ Quad HD display, Qualcomm’s top of the line Snapdragon 810 processor and a whopping 4GB of RAM.  During its   in January, the Mi Note Pro was priced at 3,299 CNY (about RM1,900). Now they have reduced its pricing to 2,999 CNY (about RM1,728) and it even comes with a couple of tweaks as well. With the 64-bit 2.0GHz/1.5GHz Octa-Core Snapdragon 810 processor powering the Mi Note Pro, there’s always a concern with regards to heat. For the Mi Note Pro, they have improved its thermal efficiency and it maintains a cool 36.3 degree Celsius after 20 minutes of gaming. In terms of performance, it pushes over 63,000 points on Antutu which is higher than other Snapdragon 810 smart phones. According to Xiaomi, the HTC One M9 scores around 57,000 points while the LG G Flex 2 trails behind slightly at about 56,000 points. The Mi Note Pro obviously has the added advantage as it has 4GB of LPDDR4 RAM.  In terms of display, the Mi Note Pro also gets a Sunlight display which is similar to the recently launched  . Under bright outdoor sunlight, the display adjusts its contrast on the pixel level in real time for better readability.   In the battery department, the Mi Note Pro gets a slightly larger 3,090mAh capacity battery, which is merely 3% more (90mAh) than the standard Mi Note. It also supports Quick Charge 2.0 (9V 1.2A) that is capable of juicing it up from 0-70% in one hour. For greater efficiency, the Mi Note Pro boasts Parallel charging technology where it has two charging modules which increases its charge rate while distributing heat evenly.  The rest of the device remains unchanged with a 13MP Sony f/2.0 main camera with image stabiliser, while the front gets a 4MP camera which is similar to HTC’s Ultrapixel camera. For storage, it gets 64GB on-board which isn’t expandable. The Mi Note Pro also supports 4G LTE with Cat 9 through carrier aggregation and it support speeds up to 450Mbps. Out of the box, it will run on Android 5.0 Lollipop with MIUI 6 skin on top. The Mi Note Pro will go on sale in China on 12th May. You can check out our   with the standard Mi Note over  .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: First Impressions:  ASUS ZenFone 2 – Loads of RAM, brilliant camera and some interesting accessories
tags: Android,Android 5.0,Asus,asus lolliflash,asus zenflash,ASUS ZenFone 2,ASUS ZenFone 2 FIrst Impressions,ASUS ZenFone 2 Launch,ASUS ZenFone 2 Malaysia,first impressions,ZenFone 2,ZenUI 2.0
contents:
ASUS’s latest contender to the premium-but-affordable smartphone war is none other than the  . It made headlines being the first equipped with the biggest amount of RAM you could find on a smartphone. In terms of looks, the Zenfone 2 looks pretty much like the rest of the family with its metallic back and general styling, with the smartphone coming in at a 3.9mm thickness at its thinnest point. They’ve also deviated a bit from its flat rectangular back to a slightly curved design that is supposed to be easier and more comfortable to hold and therefore harder to lose your grip. Also new is a rear mounted control just underneath the camera that can be used to snap selfies or adjust the volume. There are 3 distinctive versions of the Zenfone 2 that are hitting the market, with the higher end Zenfone 2 (ZE551ML) being home to a 5.5” full IPS screen, monstrous 4GB RAM, quad-core 64-bit 2.3GHz Z3580 Atom processor, 32GB storage and a 13 MP f/2.0 rear cam and 5 MP front snapper with a generously sized 3,000 mAh battery on top of dual SIM capabilities. There’s also a larger 64GB storage version available if you must have that extra storage. The Zenfone 2 (ZE550ML)’s slightly lower end sibling is just a notch below with a 1.8GHz Z3560 quad-core processor, 2GB RAM and a 5.5” 720p IPS display but otherwise shares the rest of the phone’s qualities. Both phones will be running Android 5.0 Lollipop with ZenUI 2.0 on top and will get an extra 5GB ASUS web storage. At the lower end of the spectrum, there’s the ZE500CL which comes with a smaller 5″ HD 720p display and it runs on an older 1.6GHz Z2560 processor that’s powering the previous Zenfone series. The specs internally are a notch down with a 8MP main and 2MP front cameras, while the battery is smaller as well at 2,500mAh.  While the phone itself isn’t something ridiculously innovative, it does have a few aces up its sleeve. Aside from having a crazy amount of RAM that would no doubt make it capable of handling high load apps, it also has one of the better cameras we’ve seen on a smartphone. It’s got enough modes to satisfy any shutter bug and the HDR mode makes quick work of photos that would otherwise look overexposed in bad lighting. For demanding situations, there’s a Super Resolutions mode where it combines 4x 13MP photos to produce a clearer picture with greater detail while reducing noise. The Zenfone 2 has officially launched in Malaysia and they are priced as follows: 
ZE500CL (5″ HD, 1.6GHz Z2560, 2GB RAM, 8GB ROM) – RM599 
ZE550ML (5.5″ HD, 1.8GHz Z3560, 2GB RAM, 16GB ROM) – RM749 
ZE551ML (5.5″ FHD, 1.8GHz Z3560, 2GB RAM, 32GB ROM) – RM899 
ZE551ML (5.5″ FHD, 2.3GHz Z3580, 4GB RAM, 32GB ROM) – RM1,099 
ZE551ML (5.5″ FHD, 2.3GHz Z3580, 4GB RAM, 64GB ROM) – RM1,299 Also launched alongside the ZenFone 2 earlier in Jakarta is a few new accessories that aren’t the same steak and potatoes you usually see when it comes down to cases and camera goodies. For starters assortment of optional back covers are certainly a breath of fresh air, taking full advantage of textures and shapes to make some rather unique covers both visually and physically. The shapes are available in five designs, with two symmetrical patterns and three asymmetrical patterns to choose from. Speaking of covers, they’ve also released an updated version of their flip cover, called the View Flip Cover Deluxe which has a larger view port than its predecessors and pretty much functions in such a way that you can go about your business without having to open the lid for basic functions. It’s essentially the same as the original View Flip Cover, with the exception that the cover seems more snugly fit to the phone and you can access more features via the ring of commands accessible from the window.  Some might find the cover very convenient with the added bonus of saving power by not having to utilize the entire screen but for functions besides what is available (like settings, camera, music and so on) you will still have to pop it open. The recent regional event also saw the launch of two new camera accessories as well as a powerbank; namely the ZenFlash, LolliFlash and the ZenPower 10050mAh powerbank. The aptly named ZenFlash is a rear mounted camera accessory that supposedly is able to turn your ZenFone 2 into a high end DSLR-like camera. It attaches via a set of suction cups which in turn sticks to a special sticker you attach to the rear the ZenFone, and the Xenon flash is 100x times brighter than the ZenFone 2’s own LED flash. It does give a huge boost to the details of photos taken in low lighting conditions and connects to the phone via the microUSB slot. Accompanying it is the circular LolliFlash which we hope is named after it’s similarity to a colourful lollipop, that affixes to the headphone jack of the phone. Its purpose is to act as a dual-toned LED torch to get more natural toned selfies, but also comes with a set of three colour filters in white, blue and purple that also function as protective covers for the device. The LolliFlash is priced at 119,000 Rupiah (about RM 33) which makes it a really cheap plug in flash for your phone that hardly puts a dent in your wallet, while the ZenFlash will retail for about RM 67. About the size of a business card, the   is not just small but it can juice even bigger devices thanks to a higher 2.4A output that charges quicker than standard 2.1A based powerbanks. The only thing we’d say is missing is a dual USB charging setup but for something this small being able to hold enough juice (10,050mAh) to power up your smartphone multiple times a day, it sounds pretty good to us. The powerbank is unfortunately only available for the Indonesian market at the moment, but it would be great if they make it available over the entire region given that it could make for a good competitor for Xiaomi’s super affordable powerbanks of the same capacity. In Indonesia, the ZenPower costs 269,000 Rupiah which is about RM75. Of course, prices could be very different if they get a local launch in Malaysia.

author: soyacincau
title: Android M to be announced at Google I/O 2015
tags: Android,Android M,Google I/O,Google I/O 2015
contents: After Lollipop, Google is now preparing to release its next iteration for its Android operating system. With its incremental alphabet naming convention, the next version would start with the letter M and it would take probably a few months before they reveal its final name.  For the Android M, Google is appears to be focusing on improved notification and greater voice controls beyond the typical “OK Google”. So far no word on the design but we reckon they would be some subtle tweaks from its current   that was introduced with Lollipop.  About the same time last year, Android L was   during Google I/O 2014 and it was officially   in October. That’s also the same time they had announced its   phablet and   tablet which came with Lollipop out of the box. In terms of OS adoption rate, Lollipop is still far from dominating the Android platform. At the  , Android 5.0 Lollipop takes 9% of total Android devices, while the latest Android 5.1 having just 0.7%. Most devices, close to 40% are still running on Android 4.4 KitKat and the biggest hurdle comes from device makers that are slowly pushing updates to its current handsets.  With the Chinese brands aggressively pushing cheap and cheerful handsets, they are notoriously known for slow software updates. Only recently we are seeing new devices being announced with Lollipop out of the box but there’s still no visibility of them upgrading their current KitKat flagships to Lollipop. In their home market, software updates for these Chinese brands doesn’t seem to be a priority as personalised themes and UI are more critical in their home market. As comparison, the mainstream brands such as HTC, Sony and Samsung have already pushed Lollipop updates internationally even for last year’s models. With Android M coming up soon, the software gap will increase if manufacturers don’t keep up with the latest updates.  Google I/O 2015 is   on 28th May and it will be streamed live over YouTube. If you want to know what’s in store for Android, this is one event you won’t want to miss.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Sony announces the Xperia C4 and C4 Dual selfie smartphones
tags: android 5.0 smartphone,mobile device,Sony,sony xperia,sony xperia c4,sony xperia c4 dual,sony xperia c4 launch,Xperia
contents: Originally nicknamed the  , Sony has finally lifted the lid on their latest selfie centric smartphone the Sony Xperia C4 and it’s sibling the Xperia C4 Dual. The successor to the  , both phones are going to be pretty similar, sharing the same specs and form with the exception of the Xperia C4 Dual having dual SIM support. The smartphones will sport a 64-bit octa-core MediaTek MTK6752 CPU at 1.7GHz that’s mated to 2GB RAM, a 5.5 inch full HD IPS display with Sony’s BRAVIA tech and 16GB expandable memory. It will also have LTE support on top of a 2,600mAh battery as well as Android 5.0 Lollipop out of the box. As expected the Xperia C4 will be featuring a 13 megapixel rear camera alongside a 5 megapixel front camera, both of which have an LED flash as well as Autofocus and HDR modes. This is an upgrade from the Xperia C3’s 8 megapixel rear camera and they also sport a slightly larger battery as well as more RAM and double the internal storage. No news of the price yet but the phones will be available in certain markets starting June 2015 and will come in White, Black and Mint (green) colour options. Check out the video for more details:

author: Sirap Bandung
title: ZTE Nubia Z9 officially launches, has a bezel-less display
tags: Android,flagship zte,nubia UI 3.0,nubia z9,smartphone,ZTE,zte nubia Z9,zte nubia z9 launch
contents: It’s official, the  was just launched in Beijing and the phone features a bezel-less, edge to edge screen. ZTE’s latest flagship will come in three variants, all sporting the same specs but with different RAM and storage options which pretty much influences their pricing. Under the hood, the ZTE Nubia Z9 features a Snapdragon 810 processor, NFC, 16 megapixel f/2.0 rear and 8 megapixel Sony front camera  combo alongside a 2900mAh battery and Nubia UI 3.0 out of the box. But what really makes it special here is the 2.5D glass display which is a 5.2 inch 1080p screen that has a 0.8mm bezel which uses some optical sorcery to reflect the on-screen content to give it a bezel free look. The phone itself will be just  8.94mm thick, without a protruding rear camera. The Z9 also gets a sound boost thanks to Neosound 4.0, an AKM4961 Hi-Fi processor and Dolby 7.1 surround sound. The phone also features a FIT interactive frame that allows the phone’s body to be touch sensitive and react to gesture controls that will allow users to activate the camera, take screencaps and adjust the brightness among other things. The Exclusive edition of the phone also gets their new TIO patented fingerprint tech on the power and volume rockers that can be used to unlock the phone. As for the price, the Nubia Z9 is certainly priced like a flagship, with the Classic version coming with 3GB AM and 32GB storage costing 3499 CNY (about RM 2025) and the Elite version comes with 4GB RAM and 64GB storage for 3999 CNY (about RM 2315) and the Exclusive variant that comes with TIO tech, 4GB RAM and 64GB storage for a rather ridiculous 4499 CNY (RM 2604) The Z9 is currently on pre-sale in China so it shouldn’t be too long before resellers get their hands on the device locally.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Qualcomm denies Snapdragon 810 overheating woes, is launching a new SDK later this year
tags: chipset,processor,Qualcomm,Qualcomm Snapdragon,Snapdragon,Snapdragon 810,Snapdragon 820,zeroth,zeroth sdk
contents: Despite tests and complaints from the industry in general Snapdragon producer Qualcomm has repeatedly denied that their chip tends to run a lot hotter than they claim. Tim McDonough claims that the rumours about the chipset overheating are unfounded, as the early versions of the   and   which overheated were in their testing phase and not ready for commercial release. He also stated that these “pre-release models” were made to find bugs, with pre-release hardware being different from commercial hardware and somewhere along the line someone took those test results and leaked them on the internet. The issue said to have paved the way for Samsung using their own Exynos chip on the   and  but the Snapdragon 810 chipset can be found powering the HTC One M9,   and the LG G Flex 2. However, the company does have hopes that it’s Snapdragon 820 chip that will launch later this year to do much better. It will feature a computing platform called Zeroth that is intelligent enough to know if the phone is outdoors or indoors and the time of day to manually adjust the phone’s camera for the best photograph settings. It’s also capable of indexing images by keywords thanks to image recognition abilities. The company is planning on releasing a SDK for Zeroth for developers to play around with, which is part of Qualcomm’s strategy to win back whatever support it can after the controversy regarding the Snapdragon 810.

author: soyacincau
title: ASUS Malaysia to release its ZenWatch soon?
tags: Asus,ASUS Malaysia,ASUS ZenWatch,ASUS ZenWatch Malaysia,SIRIM,Smart Watch
contents: Looks like ASUS Malaysia is bringing its   officially to Malaysia soon. It has just passed SIRIM certification with the model number WI500Q, which will be distributed by Dynamics Distribution and ECS Astar. Announced  , the ZenWatch is probably the most elegant looking Android Wear considering the rest of the Android Wear players have turned to the more classical round shape. This comes as a surprise as initially ASUS Malaysia   of bringing their first wearable device to our market. Instead, it was only sold at selected countries. The ZenWatch gets a 1.63″ AMOLED display that pushes 320×320 resolution and it runs on a mainstream 1.2GHz Snapdragon 400 processor with 512MB. There’s 4GB of storage, Bluetooth 4.0, 9-axis sensor and an embedded bio sensor to track your heart rate.    Most recently, local retailer DirectD has started   of the ZenWatch at RM799. Can ASUS Malaysia priced it lower? If it goes below RM700, this could give the Pebble Steel that’s currently priced at US$199 (about RM715) a run for its money.

author: soyacincau
title: Sony Xperia E4g now available in Malaysia with Celcom’s First Basic 38 Plan
tags: Android,Celcom,Celcom First,Celcom FIrst Basic 38,First by Celcom,smart phone,Sony,Sony Xperia E4g,Sony Xperia E4g Celcom,Sony Xperia E4g Malaysia
contents: The Sony Xperia E4g is finally here, offering a compact sized 4G LTE device that’s also easy to use for non-smart phone users. Priced at RM549, the Xperia E4g is now being offered on Celcom contract from as low as RM158 (excluding GST).   In terms of specs, it gets a 4.7″ IPS display that does qHD resolution of 960×540 and underneath it runs on a Quad-Core 1.5GHz MediaTek MT6732 processor with 1GB of RAM. You also get 8GB of storage and a microSD slot for expansion. For taking pictures, it has a 5MP camera with LED flash that supports auto scene recognition and HDR, while the front camera shoots at 2MP.  Powering the device is a non-removal 2,300mAh capacity battery which comes with Sony’s phenomenal up to 2 days of battery life. You can potentially stretch this further with Stamina mode enabled.  Considering this is also targeted for first time smart phone users, the Xperia E4g also has the option to switch to a simplified home screen where it displays your crucial apps up front with a more basic interface. If you don’t want to spend too much on mobile subscription, the device is bundled on contract with   that offers 3GB of data and 50 minutes of calls + 50 SMS at only RM38/month. For the Xperia E4g bundling, you’ll need to add-on   content package that comes with 2 Movie Passes at RM10/month. This brings up the monthly subscription to RM48/month.  The Xperia E4g from Celcom is priced as follows (before GST): During sign up, you would need to pay an upfront payment of RM100 (12 months) or RM250 (24 months) which will be rebated back to your bills across 10 months. For more info, head over to Celcom’s   product page.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Galaxy S6/S6 edge to get more camera features including RAW support with software update
tags: Android,android 5.1.1,camera update,galaxy S6,OS,S6 edge,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge
contents: The   and  currently have one of the best smartphone cameras in the market, but there is still room for improvement. With the software update that Samsung is working on, they are going to be even better. The update will be part of the Android 5.1.1 update when the OS officially hits the two devices, and it will possibly add support for the full Google camera API which includes features like shutter speed and the ability to shoot in RAW format, which are features already on the   and the  . Also, the camera update will be part of devices that are codenamed Samsung Zen/Noble, where Noble is the codename for the Samsung Galaxy Note 5 which is predicted to be launched in the second half of this year. Development for the Galaxy Note 5 is still in it’s early stages but the update will set the stage for better software features for the next flagship Note phone.

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung Galaxy S6 and S6 edge now available from U Mobile
tags: Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia,samsung galaxy s6 edge u mobile,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia,samsung galaxy s6 u mobile,U Mobile
categories: Android,Mobile Devices,Mobile OS,Players on the Field,Samsung,U Mobile
contents: If you’re planning on getting the   or  , U Mobile is now offering both devices on contract bundling. The Galaxy S6 is offered from as low as RM1,266 while the S6 edge is offered from RM1,690, excluding GST. Instead of the usual U88 and U Plus plans, both smart phones are tied with their Ultimate Device Plans which starts from RM65/month with 3GB of data.  The base Ultimate Device Plan 65 comes with 3GB of mobile data and 60 minutes of voice calls to all network. For internet, there’s no extra charge for excess usage but speeds will be throttled down. If you need more data, the Ultimate Device 95 plan offers 5GB of data and 90 minutes of calls for RM95/month. For heavy usage users, the Ultimate Device Plan 135 comes with 6GB of data, 130 minutes of calls and 65 SMS to all network.  The excess usage rates are similar across all 3 plans with voice calls being charged at 5 sen per 30 seconds (10 sen/minute). Meanwhile SMS are charged at 3 sen each within U Mobile and 8 sen to other networks.  On U Mobile, the Galaxy S6 and Galaxy S6 edge are priced as follows (without GST) on 24 months contract: During sign up, you’ll need to fork out between RM360-RM960 depending on plan as an advance payment. This will be rebated back to your bills on a monthly basis. However this can be waived if you purchase the device via credit card and if you opt-in for their monthly auto debit payment. On top of that, they are also offering 0% Easy Payment Plan if you’re a credit credit card holder of CIMB, Maybank, HSBC, RHB, Ambank, UOB, Standard Chartered and Citibank.  In terms of colours, the Galaxy S6 is offered in either Black, White and Gold while the S6 edge is offered only in Gold. Both models come with 32GB storage which is priced outright at RM2,599 (Galaxy S6) and RM3,099 (Galaxy S6 edge).  For more information, you can check out U Mobile’s   and   product page.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi flagship models will never come with a microSD slot and it’s for your own good
tags: expandable memory,Hugo Barra,mi 4i,Mi Note,microSD,smart phone,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Flagship,Xiaomi Mi 4i,Xiaomi Mi Note
contents: In Xiaomi’s flagship line up including the  ,   and  , the lack of a microSD slot seems to be a pain point for users. In an interview with Engadget, its VP for Global, Hugo Barra explained that the decision is made for the sake of user experience.  He emphasised that microSD cards are incredibly prone to failure and the availability of cheap and unreliable cards had made the situation worse. In most cases, inferior cards cause performance issues, instability and crashes which will eventually frustrate their users. As a result, most people would blame it on the device for a terrible experience without considering that the root of the problem lies on the expandable storage.  Xiaomi isn’t the only one having the stand against microSD. Even Google has offered no microSD slots on its Nexus devices, except for its first model, the Nexus One which was made by HTC. Google’s Martias Duarte   while microSD cards are ideal for users, they are actually confusing for users. For example when saving photos, videos and documents, users have to decide where does it go. Later on, they might not know if it is stored on the phone or on the card. He concluded that the overall experience to deal with microSD cards for the normal user is just too complicated. Despite that, the Android OS itself still supports microSD storage and it depends on manufacturers to offer it. If you look at the current flagship options, there are many that have started ditching the microSD card with Samsung being the latest candidate on the Galaxy S6. For Samsung, their reason is on aesthetics as well as performance. Their new flagship utilises a   storage which is almost 3X faster than standard eMMC 5.0 storage and having a microSD card might be a bottleneck for its performance. Other players that opt-out from having a microSD slot on their flagship include Motorola, OnePlus and even Meizu. For those who insists on having an expandable storage, you still have LG, Sony Xperia, Huawei and HTC that supports it. Interestingly Xiaomi does offer microSD expansion on their Redmi series but that’s obviously due to its tiny 8GB of storage which simply isn’t enough. However the usage of microSD for the Redmi was   and eventually they allowed you to save photos, videos and music directly onto the microSD instead of its internal storage.  The reason of simplifying the user experience seems sound and this somewhat affirms Apple’s tradition of having no expandable storage since day one of its iPhone. However if that’s the case, Xiaomi should really consider raising the minimum storage of their flagship models to at least 32GB. 16GB is simply not enough these days as the base operating system and native apps would have take up nearly 6GB on a fresh device. They do have larger 64GB version of their Mi 3, Mi 4 and even the Mi Pad but Xiaomi has hardly offered them outside of China. In the case for OnePlus, at least they did better by   when they launched in Malaysia.   While cloud storage seems to be the future, mobile internet connectivity isn’t exactly seamless for this to work especially in developing markets that Xiaomi is in. If you’re stuck with just 16GB of storage and with no microSD slot, your only option left is to get one of those  . What do you think? Is the microSD slot a critical factor in a flagship smart phone?

author: soyacincau
title: Huawei P8 is launching in South Pacific region next month
tags: huawei,Huawei Malaysia,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Launch,huawei p8 lite,Huawei P8 Malaysia,Huawei P8 Max,Huawei P8 Max Launch,Huawei P8 Max Malaysia,Huawei P8 Singapore,Regional Launch
contents: Huawei’s new   smart phone is coming very soon. They have just sent invites for its regional South Pacific launch that’s happening in Singapore on the 2nd of June 2015. Announced  , the P8 comes in 2 versions, a standard 5.2″ model and a huge 6.8″ phablet version. There’s also a third model, the   which could be making its debut in Singapore as well.  To recap on the specs, the P8 features a 5.2″ Full HD display and it runs on their top end Kirin 930/935 Octa-Core processor with 3GB of RAM. It also boast a world’s first 4-colour 13MP main camera that shoots in RGBW format with Optical Image Stabilisation. For selies, it gets a 8MP main shooter. Keeping the device running is a 2,600mAh capacity battery which Huawei claims to last up to 1.5 days on average or 1 day on heavy usage.  The P8 max, is their super-sized phablet which comes with similar underpinnings as the regular P8. The battery is larger at 4,360mAh which is rated to last up to 2 days of average use, however the camera is a notch down with a 5MP front shooter.  Both models support 4G LTE with dual-SIM. If you need expandable memory, the secondary SIM slot can also be used as a microSD expansion slot. The P8 is 6.4mm thin while the P8 Max is slightly thicker at 6.8mm. In terms of price, the P8 standard version goes for 499 Euros (RM1958) and 599 Euros (RM2352) for the premium model. The larger 6.8″ Huawei P8 max is priced at 549 Euros (RM2155) for standard and 649 Euros (RM2548) for Premium. With the regional launch happening next month, we can expect Huawei to bring both devices to our shores shortly after that.

author: soyacincau
title: Microsoft Surface 3 officially launched in Malaysia. An even compact tablet that can replace your laptop.
tags: microsoft,Microsoft Malaysia,Microsoft Surface 3,Microsoft Surface 3 Hands-on,Microsoft Surface 3 Launch,Microsoft Surface 3 Malaysia,Microsoft Surface 3 Malaysia Launch,Microsoft Surface 3 Malaysia Pre-order,Microsoft Surface 3 Pre-order,Senheng,Surface 3,Surface 3 Malaysia,Surface 3 Malaysia price
contents: Microsoft today has officially launched its   in Malaysia, its thinnest and lightest Surface yet. After a round of  , the Surface 3 will be available nationwide beginning 9th May across its network of retailers including Aone Plus, Harvey Norman, All IT Hypermarket, PC Image, Senheng/SenQ, SNS Network, ThunderMatch, Viewnet and Hello Station. While it is seen as an affordable version of the  , it shares the same design language including its magnesium-alloy chassis.  Available in 2 options, the Surface 3 is priced from RM1,989 with 2GB RAM and 64GB of storage, while the higher-spec 4GB RAM and 128GB storage variant is offered at RM2,389. It gets a 10.8″ Full HD display and it runs on Intel’s new Atom x7 processor, which claims to be 80% as powerful as their Surface Pro 3’s Core i3 model. Since it runs on Intel Atom, the Surface 3 is fan-less, making it silent compared to its Surface Pro 3. It also gets a pair of front facing stereo speakers, a 3.5MP camera at the front and a 8MP shooter at the back, which both are capable of shooting full HD 1080p videos. In terms of ports, it gets a single full sized USB 3.0, mini DisplayPort and a Micro USB charging port which allows you to charge with existing chargers and even powerbanks.  For expandable storage, there’s a microSD expansion slot located underneath the kickstand which opens up in 3 different angles. Overall, the Surface 3 is 8.7mm thick and weighs just 622 grams without the keyboard. Out of the box, it runs on Windows 8.1 which is upgradable to Windows 10 and it also comes bundled with one year subscription of Office 365 Personal edition. The Surface 3 Type Cover keyboard is sold separately at RM479 while the Surface Pen is priced at RM189. Other accessories available include a Docking Station at RM769 and a screen protector at RM179. For a touch of personalisation, you get to choose between Black, Bright Blue and Red colours for the Type Cover Keyboard and the Surface Pen. For more information, head over to the   page.

author: soyacincau
title: Mi 4i goes on sale in Singapore next week. Priced below RM800.
tags: Dual Sim,mi 4i,Mi 4i Malaysia,Mi 4i Singapore,Singapore,smart phone,Xiaomi Malaysia,Xiaomi Mi 4i,Xiaomi Mi 4i Malaysia
contents: Xiaomi’s new   will hit our shores this month in May. While we wait for Xiaomi Malaysia’s official announcement, our southern neighbour will commence its Mi 4i sales next Tuesday, 12th May at noon. In Singapore, the Mi 4i is priced at S$279, which is RM753 when converted directly with today’s rates. As usual, only the White colour version is available for purchase.  So when is Malaysia’s turn? The device has already passed our   certification, so it is likely to be officially available in the weeks to come. Just recently, the higher-spec   model has   in Malaysia but it comes only with 2G/3G support. Without 4G LTE, the Mi 4’s asking price of RM1,199 is a bit too much to ask considering there are better flagships out there with 4G support. So if you’re looking for faster connectivity, the Mi 4i would be a better option. It gets a 5″ Full HD display that’s optimised for outdoor use and powering it is a mid-range 2nd generation Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa-Core processor that’s mated to 2GB of RAM. On-board it gets 16GB of storage and it also comes with a 13MP main and 5MP front camera. In terms of battery, it has a larger 3,120mAh battery which is one of the largest capacity in the 5″ smart phone category. It supports dual-SIMs with 4G LTE. Out of the box, it runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop with their own MIUI 6 interface on top. Need something bigger? The 5.7″   appears to be making its way into Malaysia. It was also   in SIRIM’s database and it is likely to be priced around RM1,300-RM1,400 (2,299 CNY) once it gets here.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: APAC’s first Microsoft store to launch in KLCC
tags: APAC,KLCC,microsoft,microsoft store,microsoft store APAC,microsoft store malaysia,microsoft store malaysia launch
contents: Great news,  ‘s first physical store in Asia Pacific will be opening this week in Malaysia at KLCC. This is an interesting step for the company because the new store will not just drive sales but also give a much needed stronger local brand presence. Previously only selling through licensed distributors and  , Microsoft’s store is likely to be stocking not just software and their respective bundles but also their Microsoft Surface devices and Windows Phones. Located on the 3rd floor of Suria KLCC, the store should also make it easier for potential users to try their hand at new devices as well as get direct sales service should they desire to buy on the spot. We have yet to see exactly what Microsoft has in store for us but we will soon find out.

author: soyacincau
title: Will it Blend: Apple Watch Sport
tags: Apple Watch,apple watch sport,Apple Watch Will It Blend,Blendtec,Blentec,om Dickson,Video,watch,will it blend
contents: Destruction videos are getting silly, but nothing beats the   from Blendtec. As usual, Tom Dickson throws yet another shiny new device into his mighty blender.  With the latest   at hand, will the new smart watch blend? Watch the video to find out.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Oppo confirms R7 unibody and May launch date
tags: Android,metal unibody,mobile device,Oppo,Oppo R7,oppo R7 launch,oppo r7 may 20,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: Earlier in April we were teased a   (which OPPO has  ) but what they have confirmed now is a May 20th launch date as well as a full metal unibody. It’s unfortunate that the display is not a thing we will be seeing on the R7 but among other things we now know about the phone is that it will have a 20.7 megapixel rear camera, 4.7 inch screen with a 1080p display resolution as well as a profile that is expected to be under 5mm thick. The phone will also sport a 64-bit MediaTek MT6795 processor. As for the launch date, the OPPO R7 is to be revealed on the 20th of May and we will be expecting some great things from OPPO come launch.

author: soyacincau
title: The Surface 3 is probably the best tablet for those on the move
contents: Microsoft had been tinkering with the idea of a tablet PC since the early days of Windows XP. The first one I’ve played with was the Compaq TC1000 which essentially is a laptop with a rotatable touch screen display. It was heavy, impractical and the form factor wasn’t what you would consider as an ultra portable device. Most recently they have finally nailed it with its Surface line up and the latest   was introduced with the bold claim of being a tablet that could replace your laptop. Starting from RM2,729 excluding the keyboard, the Surface Pro 3 is on the high side, especially when you can get a decent spec laptop for less. So if you’re looking for a cheaper alternative, here comes the Microsoft Surface 3 that’s priced from under RM2,000. Not only it is cheaper but it is also the thinnest and lightest Surface yet.  The past non-Pro Surfaces are pretty basic with a rather limited Windows RT. While it looks the same, it doesn’t give you the full Windows experience like installing Windows based application. For the new iteration, the Surface 3 runs on Windows 8.1 and you can install programs like your everyday PC.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Next gen Moto X specs leaked
tags: Android,Android 5.1,mobile device,Moto X,moto X specs,Motorola,Motorola Moto X,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: With the big boys throwing out new flagships over the last few months, it seems   isn’t going to be left in the dust, with the specs of the next generation of   already making the rounds online. If the specs are true, the 3rd gen Moto X is looking pretty good, with a Snapdragon 808 under the hood with a   which is becoming popular for more phones as of late. The phone will also have a 5.2″ AMOLED display as well as a 16 megapixel rear camera and 5 megapixel front camera combo for the shutterbugs. It will sport Android 5.1.1 out of the box and will have a 32GB or 64GB storage variant with a huge 3280mAh battery. There’s no word of the exact dimensions yet but it’s likely to look similar to it’s predecessor. Motorola is likely to announce the new phone in September, if it follows the same timing as it did with the previous Moto X.

author: soyacincau
title: BlackBerry Leap now available for pre-orders in Malaysia
tags: 11street,BlackBerry Leap,BlackBerry Leap Malaysia,BlackBerry Leap Malaysia Price,BlackBerry leap Pre-order,BlackBerry Leap Price,blackberry malaysia
contents: The   is heading for Malaysia and it is now available for pre-orders through 11street. With the retail price tag of RM1,089 (inclusive of GST), the Leap is quite pricey the entry-level specs it offer. According to the  , the BlackBerry Leap would start shipping on 19th May. As a special promo, they are giving out 11street shopping coupon worth RM150 and the first 100 buyers will also get BlackBerry merchandises including a cap and a leather phone pouch. Announced during  , the Leap is BlackBerry’s new affordable full touch screen phone that’s seen as an upgrade of the  . It features a similar sized 5″ HD 720p display and under the hood it runs on a rather dated dual-core 1.5GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 Plus processor with 2GB of RAM. On-board it has 16GB of storage which is expandable with microSD. For taking pictures, it features a 8MP main camera while the front gets a 2MP unit. For an all day usage, the Leap has a 2,800mAh capacity battery which is rated to last 25 hours with heavy usage. It also supports 4G LTE as well as 802.11n WiFi and Bluetooth 4.0 LE.  Compared to the Z3, the Leap is slightly bulkier at 9.5mm and it weighs 170 grams. As comparison, the Z3 is 9.3mm thick and it weighs 164g. Out of the box, it runs on BlackBerry 10.3.1 which is loaded with BlackBerry Blend and BlackBerry Assistant.  For more info, you can check out 11street’s   page.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: More Vivo X5Pro specs surface, has 4150mAh battery and Funtouch OS 2.1
tags: Android,funtouch OS 2.1,mobile device,rumour mill,smartphone,Vivo,vivo x5pro
contents: The Vivo X5Pro recently had it’s  revealed and we even got a peek at it’s , but it looks like the leaks aren’t ending here as more specs have cropped up and it looks like the phone is going to have an enormous battery. Previously confirmed features are a Snapdragon 615 processor, 3500mAh battery, a rather unbelievable 32 megapixel front camera with phase detection focus and will be running Funtouch 2.0 based on Android 5.0 Lollipop with 3GB RAM. This could possibly mean that there will be two variants of the same smartphone where one has a smaller battery, but we won’t be holding our breath till it sees actual release.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The Vivo X5Pro to come with Iris scanner
tags: Android 5.0,fingerprint scanner,funtouch 2.0,iris scanner,mobile devices,rumour mill,smartphone,Vivo,vivo x5pro,x5pro
contents: Vivo has dropped another hint as to what their upcoming X5Pro is capable of, recently teasing some of the  . The latest teaser popped up on Vivo’s   account, with claims that the Iris scanner is so powerful that it can recognise unique vein patterns on the user’s eyes to be the perfect intelligent security lock for the phone. Other confirmed features are a Snapdragon 615 processor, 3500mAh battery, a rather unbelievable 32 megapixel front camera with phase detection focus and will be running Funtouch 2.0 based on Android 5.0 Lollipop with 3GB RAM. The Vivo X5Pro will also have a  as well as a fingerprint scanner at the phone’s rear. It seems a little overkill considering that the phone is already supposed to have a fingerprint scanner on top of the usual security features so could it be just be another marketing gimmick or a seriously useful piece of security tech? we’ll find out soon enough with the launch happening sometime in May.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Here is what the Windows 10 interface would look like on your phone, could be coming this September
tags: build 2015,microsoft,Microsoft Windows 10,mobile device,OS,rumour mill,Windows 10,windows 10 phone
contents: During Microsoft’s  keynote, the company has not only shown off it’s Windows 10 edition and how it would work across multiple platforms but also dropped a potential release date for the Windows Phone version of the OS. Apart from showcasing the interface that will be shared by both Windows 10 and Windows 10 phone devices, Microsoft has also made the Windows platform easier to port Android and iOS apps to, users can now use the same app across multiple platforms and have their work follow them with Continuum feature, where the interface morphs to your current device and seamless transition between each one. So far the experience looks quite seamless and basically it means you can hop from your laptop to your phone and back again without any interruption in your workflow. Microsoft is still going over the final, minute details like menu positioning but they’ve already finalised their landscape mode, which is a very welcome addition that would allow content to fit in ways Android and iOS still aren’t really capable of. As for the release date, this image is believed to be hinting at when Windows 10 for phones might actually hit the market but aside from being an example of how the landscape mode would look like the release date is no more than hearsay for now.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi Mi 4 3G version is now officially available in Malaysia
tags: Mi 4,Mi 4 3G,Mi 4 Malaysia,Mi 4 Malaysia launch,Mi 4 Malaysia price,Mi 4i Price,Mont Asia,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Malaysia,Xiaomi Mi 4,XIaomi Mi 4 3G Version,Xiaomi Mi 4 Malaysia,Xiaomi Mi 4 Malaysia launch
contents: The   flagship   due to its lack of extensive 4G LTE support. However for those who still wants the 5″ flagship that comes with a more premium metal frame, Xiaomi Malaysia has finally brought it in but it comes with only WCDMA 3G support. Unlike other Xiaomi products, the Mi 4 3G version will be sold via Mont Asia, a local distributor which will be having roadshows soon. The device is priced at RM1,199 which is quite expensive considering it lacks 4G LTE and there are other 4G LTE flagship alternatives like the  ,   and even the  .  Furthermore, the Mi 4 for Malaysia comes with just 16GB of storage without any microSD card support. If you’re interested, they can be contacted via WhatsApp at +6017-4590001 and Mont Asia unfortunately has limited nationwide presence with stores located at Northern states like Penang and Kedah. To recap on the specs, the Mi 4 has a 5″ Full HD display and it runs on a 2.5GHz Quad-Core Snapdragon 801 processor with 3GB of RAM. For imaging it gets a 13MP main and 8MP front cameras with both sides having a f/1.8 lens. It gets a 3,080mAh battery which is slightly smaller than the newer   global smart phone. Previously there are several   offering the Mi 4 with 4G LTE but it only supports 1800MHz which isn’t as extensive as the widely used 2600MHz frequency.  Would you get this? Or would you rather wait for the more mid-range spec   that comes with full 4G LTE support and a larger battery. It is coming this month and it is expected to be priced below RM800. If you’re looking for something bigger, the   will be coming to Malaysia soon and it   along with the Mi 4 3G version.

author: soyacincau
title: LG Watch Urbane is available in Malaysia at RM1,599
tags: Android Wear,DirectD,LG,LG G Watch,LG Watch,LG Watch Urbane,LG Watch Urbane Malaysia,LG Watch Urbane Malaysia Price,Review,Smart Watch,Video
contents: : DirectD is now   the LG Watch Urbane at RM1,299. The beautiful     internationally last week and DirectD is now making it available in Malaysia. Being an imported set, the LG Urbane Watch is priced at RM1,599, which is about the same price as the   which we’ve gotten recently.  It runs on Android Wear and it looks stylish with a round display that mimics a mechanical watch. At the front, it gets a clear 1.3″ P-OLED display that does 320×320 pixels resolution and it runs on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor with 512MB RAM and 4GB of storage.  You can take the LG Watch Urbane almost anywhere as it gets IP67 rated water and dust resistance as standard which allows you to submerge it up to 1 metre deep below 30 minutes. Keeping the lights on is a 410mAh capacity battery. For a more personalised look, the LG Watch Urbane accepts any compatible 22mm bands and by default, it comes with a leather strap out of the box.  There’s also a LG Watch Urbane LTE which isn’t coming to Malaysia. That comes with 1GB of RAM and a larger 700mAh capacity battery. Unlike the standard Urbane, the LTE variant runs on LG’s proprietary wearable platform that’s based on WebOS. Unfortunately the SIM is embedded and we are told that it would be sold only through participating telcos that offer it. Design wise, the LTE version looks more chunky and it gets additional 2 buttons compared to the standard version. In terms of colours, the Watch Urbane from DirectD is available in classic silver or pink gold, which looks closer to bronze in real life. If you’re interested, you can head over to DirectD’s   page. For those on Android that wish to stand out, this is probably the better alternative to the Apple Watch. You can check out our hands-on with both Watch Urbane and Urbane LTE over  .

author: soyacincau
title: You can get the ASUS ZenWatch in Malaysia at RM799
tags: Android Wear,Asus,ASUS ZenWatch,ASUS ZenWatch Malaysia,ASUS ZenWatch Price,DirectD,Smart Watch
contents: ASUS Malaysia   the Android Wear powered   but if you want it, you can get it in Malaysia from the folks at DirectD. They are   imported units of the ZenWatch at RM799 inclusive of GST.  The ZenWatch is probably one of the better looking Android Wear smart watch with a square screen and it features a 1.63″ AMOLED display that does 320×320 pixels resolution. Underneath, it runs on Qualcomm’s 1.2GHz Snapdragon 400 processor with 512MB RAM and it has 4GB of storage. It also supports Bluetooth 4.0, a 9-axis sensor and an embedded bio sensor that tracks your heart rate.  You can order the ZenWatch   or via at their new Gadget Mega Store at PJ or their main branch at Subang SS15.  You can check out some hands-on photos of the ASUS ZenWatch after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: HoloLens promo shows off early prototypes
tags: augmented reality,build 2015,microsoft,microsoft build 2015,microsoft holographic,Windows 10,windows 10 apps
contents: Earlier this year Microsoft announced the development of their HoloLens augmented reality headset but this new promotional video gives us a look of what the earlier prototypes looked like plus a glimpse of what the headset looks like from the inside. The promo video was shown at today and the headsets look pretty similar to the Google Glass prototypes when they were in development and the video shows just how complex wearable tech really is, especially when you try to cram everything into one device that’s meant to be worn on your face. Of course, Windows Holographic is still very much in development but today they’ve confirmed that Windows 10 Universal apps are already functional, letting you resize apps, place them on walls or set to float in space as needed.  Windows Holographic is no JARVIS but that is looking more and more like it could be a reality.

author: soyacincau
title: ASUS Malaysia to bring 5 variants of the ZenFone 2, priced from RM599?
tags: 4GB RAM,Asus,ASUS Malaysia,ASUS ZE500CL,ASUS ZE551ML,ASUS ZenFone 2,ASUS ZenFone 2 4G RAM Malaysia,ASUS Zenfone 2 4GB RAM,ASUS ZenFone 2 Malaysia,ASUS Zenfone 2 Malaysia Launch,ASUS ZenFone 2 Price,Zenfone 2 Malaysia
contents: : Malaysia will be getting 5 variants of the ASUS ZenFone 2, with price starting from RM599. The mid-spec ZE550ML model will be coming as well. Thanks   for the tip! ASUS has made its mark in the smart phone category with its  , offering high spec-like features in an affordable package. The new    was recently   for the South East Asian market, and it will be   this month. Now its appears that the official Malaysian Zenfone 2 pricing has been revealed thanks to  . They have posted some on site photos of what seems to be a closed door dealer event where they have announced   five Zenfone 2 variants with a starting price of just RM599. Based on the info they have obtained at the event, the ZenFone 2 will be priced as follows: Compared to  , Malaysians will get an even lower spec version for the entry-level option with a smaller 5″ display and it runs on an older Intel Atom Z2560 processor. This is similar to the current   that’s priced at RM559. For its mid-range model, the ZE551ML with a 1.8GHz Intel Atom Z3560 processor is similar to Indonesia’s spec at RM749 but we also get a larger 32GB capacity option at RM899, which is quite generous for its price.   For those wanting the best performance, the top end ZE551ML model with a faster 2.3GHz Z3580 processor and 4GB of RAM can be yours at RM1,099 for 32GB and RM1,299 for 64GB storage. ASUS is not only the first smart phone maker to introduce a smart phone with 4GB of RAM, but they are also priced lower compared to the competing mid-range smart phones.  Can the Taiwan manufacturer fend off competition from its mainland Chinese rivals? Looking at the price and specs alone, the answer is probably yes. Lets hope that ASUS Malaysia has enough stock to go around. The Malaysian ASUS ZenFone 2 launch is   on 9th May.

author: soyacincau

contents: Samsung’s promotional tie-up with the latest Avengers movie is going beyond the big screen. Apart from having Avengers themes for the   and the  , Samsung will be releasing Avengers themed handsets as well. According to Lee Young-hee, Samsung’s head of marketing for mobile division, a new Iron Man edition device in red will be released sometime in end May or early June. The above image is a   which looks pretty good in red that’s surrounded with a gold colour frame. Head after the break for more renders of what the Galaxy S6 edge Avengers edition models might look like.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 to be revealed in June
tags: Android,Android Lollipop,galaxy tab S2,rumour mill,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy Tab S2,tab s2,tab s2 8 inch,tab s2 9.7 inch
contents: Rumour has it that the next gen of Tab S tablets might be coming in a couple of months, and we already have some specs to go with it. Under the hood, the new tablets are likely to have a 64-bit Exynos processor, 3GB RAM as well as 32GB storage with microSD expansion, possible optional Cat.6 LTE support and a 8 megapixel rear and 2.1 megapixel front camera combo. The display on the other hand is rumoured to be a Super AMOLED with a 1536 x 2048 resolution and 4:3 aspect ratio. It’s likely to run on Android Lollipop out of the box. Like the recently launched  , the Tab S2 will come in an 8 inch and 9.7 inch variant. They are also expected to hit launch in Wi-Fi only and LTE supported models. The tablet is also expected to be very thin (sources say either 5.4 or 5.5mm) and to weigh in at 260g for the 8 inch model which could very well put the tablet at the world’s thinnest and lightest. June isn’t too far off so we’re likely to see more information on the Tab S2 as we approach release date.

author: soyacincau

tags: Redmi 2,Redmi 2 Malaysia,Redmi 2 U Mobile,U Mobile,Xiaomi Redmi 2,Xiaomi Redmi 2 Malaysia

On top of that, U Mobile is also giving a free powerbank for the first 100 customers. This offer is applicable at  .  To recap on the Redmi 2, this RM449 entry level smart phone offers a 4.7″ HD 720p screen, Quad-Core Snapdragon 410 processor, 1GB of RAM and 8GB storage that’s expandable with microSD. author: Sirap Bandung
title: Apple Watch Sport has a better, less reflective display than its pricier siblings
tags: apple,Apple Watch,apple watch edition,apple watch sport,DisplayMate,weabale
contents: Apple has been more than ambitious with their Apple Watch, with them crossing into essentially unknown territory in the way of wearable tech. While we have seen plenty about the watch already, there hasn’t been much details about the screen besides that it’s using a ‘Flexible Retina Display’ . The team behind decided to put the watch’s screen to the test and they’ve found that the Apple Watch Sport actually has a better display than that of the Apple Watch Edition. Granted the Apple Watch and the Edition are harder to scratch than the Sport due to their sapphire crystal displays which a tougher than normal glass.Unfortunately they reflect about twice as much light as well. Based on their tests, the Apple Watch with sapphire crystal has a reflectance of 8.2 percent which is almost double of that of Ion-X glass. Compared to an iPhone 6 which has a reflectance of 4.6 percent, an Apple Watch essentially reflects 178 perfect of the light reflected by the iPhone 6. DisplayMate hasn’t tested an Apple Watch Sport that has Ion-X glass but they feel that they would have similar results to the iPhone 6 and 6 Plus. Using sapphire could end up being an issue for smartwatches because the reflected light could impact the display visibility to the point the screen’s own brightness would be compromised and ultimately become difficult to see clearly. Check out our own impressions about the .

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung’ Galaxy Tab A arrives in Malaysia. Comes in two sizes.
tags: android samsung galaxy tab A,galaxy tab A,galaxy tab A 8.0,galaxy tab A 9.7,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy Tab A,Samsung Galaxy Tab A Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy Tab A Malaysia Launch,samsung malaysia
contents: , Samsung’s productivity tablet has finally landed in Malaysia, and it’s aimed not at entertainment but for those looking for on the go productivity but want something more affordable than the  . Named the  , it comes in two flavours, an 8 inch model and a 9.7 inch variants and both sport the same specs with the exception of screen size and battery. It is essentially designed for people who want to get work done on the road, featuring one hand grip operation, a light metalised look as well as S Pen and Note support for when inspiration hits. In terms of design it looks very similar to the Galaxy Tab S but it’s cheaper and a wee bit thicker than it’s higher end cousin which is priced at RM 1,699 and RM 1,999 for the 8.4″ and 10.5″ sizes. The Galaxy Tab A has a quadcore 1.2GHz Snapdragon processor, 2GB RAM and 16GB storage that can accept capacity of up to 128GB via a MicroSD slot. The tablet will also have a 5 megapixel rear camera as well as a 2 megapixel front snapper as well as Android 5.0 Lollipop out of the box. Both models sport a 1024 x 768 TFT screen with a 4:3 aspect ratio, but the 8 incher will have a 4,200mAh battery under the hood while the 9.7 inch model features a gigantic 6,000mAh battery. Users of the Galaxy Tab A will also get free exclusive content and services like 100GB of free OneDrive storage for two years as well as access to Galaxy Gifts which gives extra freebies for apps like Evernote, ArtRage and Shazam which include premium subscription access. You will also get the Microsoft Office suite which contains Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint preloaded in the Galaxy Tab A for convenience. The tablets are available now and will be priced at RM 1,299 for the 8 inch model while the 9.7 inch model will retail for RM 1,599, with both prices inclusive of GST. The Samsung Galaxy Tab A will come in Sandy White, Sandy Black and Smoky Titanium along with the S Pen. The Samsung Galaxy Tab A will also have a handful of optional accessories available for purchase, which include dedicated book covers for the Tab A as well as keyboards and adaptors. Check out more images of the tablet and accessories below. \ \

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung Galaxy S6 edge with 64GB storage is now available in Malaysia
tags: Android,Galaxy S6 64GB,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 64GB,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge 64GB,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia Price,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia Price,smart phone
