author: Sirap Bandung
title: This Apple Watch glass panel takes a drill to the face, leaves unscathed
tags: apple,Apple Watch,apple watch scratch test,iOS,iphonefixed,power drill,Video,wearable
contents: The   will be launching in a scant few weeks time, but for all you are paying for it will it actually stand up to everyday damage the way Apple says it will? granted it’s made of sapphire glass but wait till you see how much of a beating it takes, thanks to the guys behind iPhonefixed who take the Watch’s glass panel and proceeds to rub it against a brick wall, key it, whack it with a hammer and ultimately use a power drill on it. If the test is legit, this is definitely a huge plus point towards the Apple Watch in terms of durability. There are 3 Apple Watch versions – The Apple Watch Sports, Apple Watch and Apple Watch Edition. Only the more expensive Apple Watch and Apple Watch Editions are using Sapphire glass, while its cheaper Apple Watch Sports uses strengthened Ion-X glass.  Video after the break.

author: Sponsored
title: Samsung went back to the drawing board to create the most beautiful smartphone they’ve ever made
tags: Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Design,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia
contents: The Galaxy S series is now in its 6th year and Samsung has come a long way since its original Galaxy S   in 2010. At the time, it had set a new standard for a high-end Android flagship with a thin design, incredible Super AMOLED display and top notch internals.  No doubt the past few Galaxy S flagships have gotten better in hardware but its plastic build is not doing much justice to its capable performance. They have tried to make their smart phones feel more upmarket with the use of chrome and faux leather finishing, but that’s simply not enough to deliver a true premium feeling device. With today’s users demanding for more, Samsung has gone back to the drawing board for its latest Galaxy S6 flagship. Called as Project Zero, the new model was built from the ground up aspiring to create what’s next now and hopefully to set a new standard of smart phone design. The exterior has to be as top notch to reflect its new advancements on the inside. To deliver a premium experience, the first contact with the device is crucial. On the Galaxy S6 and Galaxy S6 edge, they have went with glass and metal as their core materials. For a more cutting edge design, the Galaxy S6 edge stands out as the world’s first device to feature a dual curve display. To create this is not an easy task and Samsung has used a unique 3D Thermoforming technology to create a double curve design for its front panel. Meanwhile for its back panel, the use of glass isn’t entirely new. To allow the Galaxy S6 and Galaxy S6 edge stand out, they have used a nano-thin multi coating process to give its back panels a vibrant and dynamic finish. This creates an illusion of flowing metal and the way it reflects natural light is stunning at various angles.  The Gold Platinum variant appears more vibrant than other typical gold smart phones while the Emerald Green colour is unique which you can’t find on any other premium device.  For a comfortable and an upmarket feel, the latest flagship uses a sleek metal frame which undergoes diamond cutting and anodizing processes for a more refined feel. The result is a surrounding frame that’s smooth to touch and it feels reassuring to hold in the hands. The frames are not the same across the range as each colour will get a different shade of colour for a unique look. To protect the Galaxy S6 and Galaxy S6 edge from daily scuffs and bumps, Samsung has used the latest Gorilla Glass 4 which is thinner, lighter and more damage resistant than its predecessors. For its body, a high strength aluminium that’s similarly used for aircrafts and automobile is being used. Samsung claims that it is 1.5X stronger and 1.2X more scratch resistant than other aluminium used on other smart phones today.

author: soyacincau
title: SenHeng lets you pre-order the Microsoft Surface 3 in Malaysia
tags: microsoft,Microsoft Malaysia,Microsoft Surface 3,Microsoft Surface 3 Malaysia,Microsoft Surface 3 Pre-order,Senheng,Surface 3,Surface 3 Malaysia,Surface 3 Malaysia price
contents: The newly announced   is now available for pre-orders at SenHeng. You can place your orders starting this coming Monday, 13th April and you can pick up one from RM1,989 for the base model with 2GB RAM and 64GB storage. Going up the notch with 4GB RAM and 128GB storage would cost you RM2,389. For the full productivity experience, the Type Keyboard is sold separately at RM479.00 and it comes in Black, Bright Blue and Red. In addition, SenHeng is offering free Surface 3 skins for pre-orders (while stocks last) and an extra 1 year warranty. To recap on the Surface 3, this is seen as the compact and affordable version of its Surface Pro 3 powerhouse. It gets a smaller 10.8″ Full HD touch screen display and underneath it runs on a quad-core Intel Atom x7-Z8700 processor that’s mated to either 2GB or 4GB of RAM depending on variant. Unlike the Surface Pro 3, it doesn’t get full flexibility for the kickstand and it settles for 3 fixed positions. There’s a 3.5MP front camera and a main 8MP unit that shoots Full HD 1080p videos. Out of the box it runs on full Windows 8.1 and it is upgradable to Windows 10 for free.

author: soyacincau
title: Experience the Zenfone 2 at ASUS Incredible ZenDay event

contents: The latest ASUS Zenfone 2 will be arriving on our shores very soon. ASUS Malaysia is organising a consumer event on 9th May and they are inviting the general public to be among the first to experience their latest smart phone.  The Zenfone 2 is ASUS new sequel for its affordable luxury smart phone offering. For 2015, they have upped their game with better finishing on the exterior and this time the Zenfone 2 is offered with higher specs including a 5.5″ Full HD display and a newer Quad-Core 2.3GHz Atom processor with a whopping 4GB of RAM. For those who can’t wait, several grey importers have started offering the Zenfone 2 and you can pick up its   at RM1,299 (before GST). Once it arrives here officially, you probably can expect a more affordable price tag along with an official local warranty.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi’s next smart phone to be called the Mi 4i?
contents: Xiaomi is announcing a   in India on the 23rd of April. This is quite unusual for Xiaomi as they have been launching all of their key products in their home ground, China. Until now there’s hardly any clues on the new model except for its teaser that says the “ “. From some clues we’ve gathered, the upcoming device could be called the Mi 4i. We can’t confirm right now but this might be an international variant of its current   with support for wider 4G LTE bands. On Singapore’s IDA (Infocomm Development authority) database, a new Xiaomi smart phone with the model 2015015 was recently certified and it carries a marketing name of “Mi 4i”. This comes right after the recent   smart phone that   in Singapore and Malaysia last month. When we searched further, the Mi 4i had also   on GeekBench 3 with Qualcomm 64-bit Octa-Core processor clocked at 1.65GHz along with 2GB of RAM. In terms of performance, it showed an average score of 473 for single-core and 1422 for multi-core which isn’t much better from a Redmi Note 4G. Of course, these are pre-launch figures and what’s interesting is that it was running on Android 5.0.2 Lollipop. As you probably know, the   isn’t coming officially into Malaysia and the Mi 4i (if that’s the actual name) could be alternative that you’ve been waiting for. In terms of specs, it appears to be a notch below the Mi 4 with possibly a Snapdragon 615 processor (instead of Snapdragon 801) that’s mated to 2GB of RAM (instead of 3GB).  However with Lollipop out of the box, this could be an interesting contender if it is priced below RM1,000. Since it is launching in India, it has to be compelling enough to compete with the likes of Micromax. We’ll find out more in 2 weeks time.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi is launching a new Mi Smart Phone in India
tags: Global Mi Phone Premiere,I is coming,mi 4i,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Global Phone Launch,XIaomi International Xiaomi Launch,Xiaomi Mi 4i,Xiaomi New Phone Launch
contents: After introducing the flagship  , Xiaomi will be announcing a new smart phone on 23rd April 2015 in New Delhi. This is Xiaomi’s first smart phone launch that’s held outside of China. No doubt this will be a significant device that’s targeted for the international market. The event is going to be huge as Xiaomi’s CEO Lei Jun, President Bin Lin and VP for Xiaomi Global Hugo Barra would be there as well.  Its tagline “i is coming” is still a huge question mark. Could this be a new product range that’s different from the standard Mi and Redmi series? Following the Redmi 2 and the Mi Note, we are guessing this could be a replacement of the Redmi Note which is due for a replacement. We’ll be at New Delhi for the launch, so follow us on   and   for the latest coverage.

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung releases its own Galaxy S6 and S6 edge drop test video
tags: Android,drop test,mobile device,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 drop test,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge drop test,Video
contents: To put its   to rest, Samsung has released another video of its Galaxy S6 and S6 edge being stress tested. This time, a test to determine if the latest flagships can withstand drops on the back and on the sides. This Galaxy S6 edge should be more prone to damage but Gorilla Glass 4 seems to be holding pretty well for direct impacts on the sides. The Samsung official drop test video appears to be too conservative for dropping only from chest height. For something more extreme, someone had did a drop test of the   at various heights. The double curve display phone has surprisingly managed to withstand the impact better than the metal clad iPhone 6 Plus.  Watch the official drop test video after the break.

author: Amin Ashaari
title: We asked you to vote for the best camera phone right now and here are the results
tags: camera,camera comparison,camera shootout,Galaxy Note Edge Malaysia,Galaxy S5 Malaysia,galaxy S6 edge,Galaxy S6 Edge Malaysia,Galaxy S6 Malaysia,iPhone,iPhone 6,iPhone 6 Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy Note Edge,Samsung Galaxy S5,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Camera,shootout,Sony Xperia Z3,Xperia Z3 Malaysia
contents: Last week,   a series of pictures taken using the  , the  ,  ,   and the  . Then we asked you to choose which of the phones took the best pictures, to make it fair (and interesting), we didn’t tell you which picture was taken using which device. You’ve diligently ranked the pictures and we’ve tabulated the results, and here they are. Based on your votes, it looks like the Galaxy Note Edge is a favourite, consistently ranked in the top three. The iPhone 6 and the Xperia Z3 didn’t fare well with both devices being ranked at the bottom two in most of the tests. Having the same camera hardware as the Note Edge, the Galaxy S6 received also ranked well among our readers. When it comes to camera performance, the Galaxy Note Edge is   you can get. In this test, you can see that it performed well in almost every condition, especially in challenging lighting conditions, as you can see in the Set 4. While the Galaxy S6 and S6 edge has the same camera hardware as the Note Edge (and  ), it looks like the Note Edge is slightly better optimised to produce better pictures overall. To be honest, we expected a lot from the iPhone 6 but in this test, it was ranked poorly in all but one of the sets, which is disappointing. Despite being a generation behind in terms of hardware, the Galaxy S5 did ok in this test. The Xperia Z3 however, failed to shine and is outclassed by its competitors. So what do you think? Did the result turn out as you expected? How well did your favourite phone do in the test? Let us know in the comments section.

author: soyacincau
title: HTC One M9+ and One E9+ officially announced
tags: HTC One,HTC One e9,HTC One E9 Plus,HTC One E9 Plus Launch,HTC One M9,HTC One M9 Plus,HTC One M9 Plus Launch,HTC One M9 Plus Official
contents: HTC has announced two more new devices, the   and the   that comes with a higher Quad HD resolution displays. Both devices were launched in Beijing and it could be making its way to other markets in Asia.  Following the launch of the HTC One M9 flagship at MWC 2015, the One M9+ is a step up with a slightly larger 5.2″ display that does a much higher 2560×1440 pixels resolution. Instead of Qualcomm’s top of the line Snapdragon 810 processor, it runs on a 2.2GHz MediaTek MT6795 Octa-core processor that comes with 3GB of RAM and 32GB of on-board storage. Camera wise, it remains unchanged with a 20MP main duo camera and a front facing 4MP Ultrapixel camera. While it looks the same as the all metal HTC One M9, the M9+ gets a fingerprint scanner that doubles up as a home button. Like the One M9, it gets 3 colours – Silver, Gold and Gunmetal Grey. Meanwhile the HTC One E9+ is a slightly bigger device with a 5.5″ display that also does Quad HD resolution and it runs on a similar MediaTek MT6795 processor. Being a notch below the M9+, it gets 2GB of RAM and 16GB of storage, which is also expandable. You can read up more details from our  . Head after the break for more images of the two new devices.

author: Sponsored
title: 5 Ways Maxis Protects you from Bill Shocks
tags: Expensive Bill,Maxis,Maxis DataRoam,Maxis Mobile Internet,Maxis postpaid,MaxisONE Plan,Pay As You Go Internet Rates,Postpaid,Postpaid Overcharge,Unmatched Customer Experience,Zero Bill Shock,Zero Bill Shocks
contents: Having a postpaid plan gives you the ultimate freedom to use. There’s no credits to top up and you would only need to pay at the end of your monthly bill cycle. However that also opens up a possibility of bill shocks for something which you thought you never use.  By now you’ve probably heard stories of people raking up bills of thousands of ringgit due to accidental data usage or simply for roaming on the wrong network.  Operator Maxis wants to change the way people look at Postpaid especially where there’s a stigma that the operators are all out to get you. Recently they made some drastic changes from the way they charge for calls and data as well as making internet usage overseas cheaper and worry free.  Is it just lip service or have they actually made a difference? Read on to find out. For those using the old classic postpaid plans, most customers would have switched to a brand new smart phone but still hasn’t gotten a dedicated data plan. Usually by default, Mobile Data is switched on and telcos would usually charge a rather expensive Pay As You Go rate of 10 sen per 10KB. That’s RM10 per MB and can you imagine how much would it cost if you watched a couple of YouTube videos? Since last year, they have   of its old Pay As You Go Rates with a more simplified mechanism. For every 50MB you use, Maxis charges just RM10 for each block. So if you use 80MB, you’re charged only RM20 (2 x 50MB blocks). The best part is that Maxis caps your usage to 250MB at RM50/month so you won’t be charged beyond that. Of course, your speeds would be throttled down but you can always subscribe to a data plan to regain your speed. Also if you accidentally enabled Mobile Data, Maxis will not charge if you don’t use beyond 250KB in a single month. This is just another safety net for those who just want to stick to WiFi for their smart phone internet needs.  When using mobile data on Maxis, they will constantly remind you especially if you don’t have a plan. If you’re using a data-less plan like Maxis TalkMore, you’ll receive a message that you’re on their Mobile Internet Plan of RM10 per 50MB.  Once you’ve started using, they will keep reminding you each time you utilised a block of 50MB along with a quick update of your usage. In our test, we got a total of 7 SMS from start until hitting 250MB, so you definitely can’t miss it. Each SMS also comes with a tip that you would save more if you subscribe to a data plan by dialling *100#. You can top up from as little as RM2/day for 100MB to RM48/month for 1GB.  Want to know how much you’ve used before your bill arrives? With the newly revamped  , you can always check your unbilled amount and remaining data quota in real time. If need to use a lot of data at one go especially when you use your smart phone as a WiFi hotspot, you can always top up RM2 for 100MB or RM5 for 500MB from the app. Alternatively you can do this by dialing *100#. When making a trip overseas, staying in touch has never been easier. Upon arrival at a new country, you are likely to be bombarded with SMS, telling you the best network operator to roam. Switching networks manually can be a hassle and there are cases where your smart phone would jump to a different network, which could result a very expensive roaming bill. Fortunately Maxis has gotten rid of such complications and they would guarantee that you will always be connected to the right network.  For a worry free travel, Maxis offers   (Fair Usage Applies) for only RM38/day at over 106 countries. If you want something more affordable for basic Instant Messaging, there’s a cheaper DataRoam Saver at 15 countries for only RM10/day. While DataRoam saver comes with just 50MB high speed quota per day, there’s no extra charge once you’ve exceeded. To activate, just dial *100# upon arrival before enabling Data Roaming on your smart phone.  Another good reason to roam on Maxis is that you can overcome the Great Firewall in China. So instead of getting a local SIM where you’re unlikely to access Facebook, Twitter and YouTube, you still can share your moments without restrictions on Maxis. This is possible since it reroutes your internet traffic through Malaysia.  Oh by the way, for MaxisOne Plan customers (MaxisOne Plan/One Plan Lite/Business One Plan/Business One Plan Lite), Maxis is giving   at selected countries. This is applicable from now until 30th April.  For the ultimate Worry Free experience, why not give   a try? For a flat RM128/month, the MaxisOne Plan offers unlimited domestic calls and SMS and 2GB of mobile internet. If you exceed your internet quota, there’s no extra charge and this means there’s no way for you to exceed RM128/month. The only way to incur more charges is if you make the following: For a more affordable alternatives, there’s also MaxisOne Plan Lite at RM78/month and MaxisOne Plan Start at RM58/month. Both offers unlimited calls and SMS but only within the Maxis/Hotlink network. For internet, they come with 1GB and 100MB respectively each month. The 5 claims mentioned here are part of Maxis  . Like most products in the market, you probably wonder if there’s any catch or hidden conditions. The word “unlimited” has been overused and there’s always a tingling sensation that there’s a hidden charge somewhere.

author: soyacincau
title: Apple pushes iOS 8.3 update with new Emoji Keyboard
tags: apple,iOS,iOS 8.3,iOS 8.3 Update,iOS update,iPad,iPad Air,iPad Mini,iPhone,iPhone 5,iPhone 5S,iPhone 6,iPhone 6 Plus
contents: A new iOS 8.3 update is now available for supported  ,   and iPod Touch devices. Apart from the usual bug fixes and performance improvements, the latest update also delivers a new emoji keyboard with over 300 new characters. If you are seeing some   from your friends, it is because they are using the new emojis that are visible to those on iOS 8.3 or OS X 10.10.3. Depending on what device you have, it is about 280MB-375MB to download and we recommend you to do so using WiFi. If you haven’t gotten any notifications yet, you can check under Settings > General > Software Update.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Xiaomi sold 2.12 million phones in 12 hours during Mi Fan Festival 2015
tags: mi fan festival,mi fan festival 2015,mobile device,Promotions,smartphone,Xiaomi
contents: In celebration of  5th birthday, the company held the   with Malaysia, India and Indonesia joining the fun for the first time. Xiaomi has hit their best ever online sales record, selling 2.12 million phones over 12 hours, equating to a total revenue of RMB 2.08 billion (about US 335 million) in sales, beating it’s own record of   last year during Singles day. Of the items sold were over 38,000 Mi TVs and over 770,000 smart appliances, inclusive of 200,000 Mi Bands and 247,000 Mi Power Strips.

author: soyacincau
title: Dell’s high-end Venue 10 7000 tablet announced
tags: Android,Dell Venue 10,Dell Venue 10 7000,Tablet
contents: Need a tablet can take up some of your laptop work? Dell has just announced its new Venue 10 7000 Android tablet, which is a full sized version of its wafer thin  . In terms of design, it gets a rounded hinge that’s similar to Lenovo Yoga 2 Tablet series. While it doesn’t have a flip out kickstand for various modes, the hinge on the Venue 10 7000 lets you attach a backlit keyboard which lets you tilt the tablet screen around up to 180 degrees.  Spec wise, the Venue 10 features a 10.5″ Super AMOLED display that does 2560×1600, which is similar to  . Under the hood, it gets an Quad-Core 2.33GHz Intel Atom Z3580 processor with 2GB of RAM along with a choice of 16GB or 32GB on-board storage options. At the back, it has a main 8MP shooter and an array of Intel RealSense cameras like its predecessor which more depth information and selective focus after a picture is taken.  While the Venue 8 is the thinnest tablet at 6.0, the larger Venue 10 7000 is slightly thicker at 6.2mm. It houses a 7,000mh capacity battery that’s rated to last about 7 hours and that makes it heavier at 598 grams while its 8.4″ Venue 8 weighs just 305 grams. The Dell Venue 8 7000 is priced at US$499 (about RM1815), putting it head to head with the Lenovo Yoga Tablet 2 Pro. For a full productivity set up, it will cost US$629 (about RM2,280) with the backlit keyboard. It ain’t cheap and Dell is targeting the device for top level corporate executives. For us, we’ll rather get the   that comes with a full fledged Windows 8.1 experience in a portable form factor.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Acer Liquid Z410 smartphone now in Malaysia
tags: Acer,Acer Liquid Z410,acer liquid Z410 malaysia,Acer Malaysia,Android,Android KitKat,Budget,budget smartphone,Dual Sim,liquid Z,mobile device,smartphone
contents: Acer has just announced the newest member of the   in Malaysia, the Acer Liquid Z410 budget smartphone.  This entry-level 64-bit 4G LTE smart phone was announced during   in January this year.   Under the hood, you’ll find a 64-bit 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6732 processor, 1GB RAM and 8GB of extendable storage, f/2.4 5MP rear camera and a 2MP front snapper. The phone also has a 4.5 inch IPS display that pushes a modest 960×540 resolution. Powering the device is a 2,000mAh battery and it runs on Android 4.4.4 KitKat out of the box. The phone also sports the customiseable AcerRAPID button out back, which can also be used to take group selfies and users who want easy connectivity with their notebooks to share and transfer files and information, there’s the Acer Extend function that lets you drag and drop files to copy. The phone itself has a slightly curved design and is only 9.9mm thin, weighing in at 145g which is not bad for a budget smartphone. The smartphone will retail for RM459, which is inclusive of GST and will be available in Berry Black as well as a 1 year local warranty. The Liquid Z410 will also have dual sim 4G LTE capabilities as well as Acer’s UI which they claim has customised profiles and UI for “users aged 7 to 70″. As far as price is concerned, it looks like you’re getting what you pay for, and there’s no confirmation if it is getting Lollipop any time soon. For this price range, it is pretty competitive and it faces the 4.7″   that’s priced at RM10 less.

author: soyacincau
title: LG G4 packs a faster f/1.8 lens for better low light performance
tags: Android,F/1.8 Camera Lens,LG G4,LG G4 Camera,LG G4 launch,LG G4 Specs,LG G4 Teaser,smart phone
contents: LG will be announcing its new flagship soon and they have their home rival, the   to beat. While the S6 boast a fast f/1.9 lens for both front and rear cameras, LG is raising the bar with a faster f/1.8 lens as highlighted in their first LG G4 teaser video. The LG G4 is confirmed to have a   display that’s similar to the current   but the new generation display boasts better contrast ratio and increased brightness of up to 30%. In terms of hardware, it was   that the G4 would use a   Hexa-Core processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. The main camera is likely to be a 16MP shooter that’s further assisted by Optical Image Stabiliser.  For u folks in Malaysia, the future of LG’s mobile business is still a   and until now there’s no visibility if they would offer the   which was announced in January. If you’re interested, fret not as   such as DirectD would likely to sell the device almost immediately after its international release.  The LG G4 will be announced on 28th April 2015 and we can more hints to come as we get closer to launch. Watch the teaser video after the break.

author: soyacincau
title: ASUS Zenfone 2 with 4GB RAM is now available in Malaysia
tags: 4GB RAM,Asus,ASUS ZenFone 2,ASUS ZenFone 2 4GB,ASUS ZenFone 2 Malaysia,ASUS ZenFone 2 Malaysia Price,DirectD,smart phone
contents: The   series is probably one of the most anticipated “cheap and good” smart phones especially when   as the first with 4GB of RAM. As grey import stocks start to trickle in, most of the   are the lower spec variant from a base ZE550CL version with 2GB RAM with HD 720p to the higher ZE551ML version with a 5.5″ Full HD display, 2GB RAM and 32GB Storage. If you’re looking for the ultimate, the folks at DirectD has brought in the top of the line ZenFone 2 for RM1,299 (before GST). This features a 5.5″ Full HD display, Intel 64-bit Quad-Core 2.3GHz Atom processor, 4GB RAM, 32GB storage, 13MP main + 5MP front cameras and a 3,000mAh capacity battery. As comparison, the similar spec with 2GB RAM is   at RM1091 with GST. It is available now with limited quantities at their DirectD Gadget Mega Store along Federal Highway as well as their DirectD Subang outlet.  The official ASUS Malaysia stocks is expected to arrive soon within  . They have sent invites for its regional South East Asia ZenFone 2 launch that’s happening in 2 weeks time. Hopefully they will have sufficient stocks to go around once it is officially launched in Malaysia.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: LG G4 event invite confirms F/1.8 lens and camera features
tags: Android,F/1.8 Camera Lens,LG G4,LG G4 Camera,LG G4 launch,LG G4 Specs,LG G4 Teaser,smart phone
contents: LG will be announcing their new flagship smartphone very soon, and as we   the LG G4 will be sporting a F/1.8 lens which is better because it lets in 11% more light than the F/1.9 lens that their  There is also laser focus sensor as well as a dual-tone LED flash with the volume and power buttons perched underneath, with the leather possibly hinting at a back cover styling but we’ll find out on 28th April when the launch happens.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung’s round Gear A smartwatch to have 3G and call support
tags: rumour mill,Samsung,samsung gear A,samsung orbis,SmartWatch,wearable
contents: No, we don’t have a real image of it yet, but  first round smartwatch codenamed the Orbis has been confirmed to launch as the Samsung Gear A and is likely to be Samsung’s most premium smartwatch offering yet. The Gear A will have two variants available, with one sporting standard Bluetooth connectivity and another one with 3G and calling support, with both models likely to have WiFi support as well. It’s a pretty smart move on Samsung’s part as the 3G model is likely to be more expensive than it’s simpler counterpart. The two main model numbers are SM-R720 and SM-R730, with the R730 likely the one with 3G support. It’s pretty obvious that they are trying to take the  to task on this one, and with the Apple Watch nearing release date, Samsung really needs to up the ante.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy S6 edge teardown reveals battery glued to curved screen
tags: curved screen,galaxy S6 edge,ifixit,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,samsung galaxy s6 edge teardown,teardown
contents: Looks like   is just as difficult to repair as the  , as shows by iFixit’s latest teardown of the curve-screened device. The glass backing and at the front is apparently very hard to remove without accidentally destroying it, and the battery buried under components and then very tightly adhered to the curved display which in itself is hard to take out. On the plus side, most of the parts are modular to an extent so apart from all the trouble getting the device open, replacing individual parts isn’t the worst part of fixing the S6 edge. Check out the full teardown after the break.

author: soyacincau
title: Next Honor 4X sale happening tomorrow
tags: Android,Honor 4X,Honor 4X malaysia,Honor 4X Malaysia Launch,Honor 4X Malaysia Price,Honor 4X Price,Honor Malaysia,huawei,Huawei Honor,Huawei Honor 4X Malaysia,smart phone,VMall.my
contents: The   is latest mid-range phablet to hit Malaysia with an affordable price tag of RM619 (inclusive of 6% GST). During its   on 1st April, Honor Malaysia has sold 3,000 units through its   online store. If you missed last week’s sale, the next one is happening tomorrow, 8th April at 4.08PM with both Black and White options will be available. For the 2nd batch, Honor Malaysia will be shipping out its stocks after 18th April. To recap ont he specs. the Honor 4X comes with a 5.5″ HD 720p display and it runs on a 64-bit Kirin 620 Octa-Core processor which appears to perform better than the Snapdragon 400 equipped Redmi 4G in benchmarks. It also get 2GB of RAM and has 8GB of on-board storage that can be expanded with microSD.  You’ll also get a 13MP main + 5MP front camera, a 3,000mAh capacity battery and dual-SIM slots which supports 4G LTE.

author: soyacincau
title: Microsoft Devices expected to launch its Lumia 430, Lumia 640 and Lumia 640 XL in Malaysia
tags: Microsoft Devices,Microsoft Lumia 430,Microsoft Lumia 430 Dual SIM,Microsoft Lumia 430 Malaysia,Microsoft Lumia 640,Microsoft Lumia 640 Malaysia,Microsoft Lumia 640 XL,Microsoft Lumia 640 XL Malaysia,windows phone,Windows Phone 8.1
contents: Microsoft Devices is having a launch event next week where they would unveil a couple of new devices for the Malaysian market. Fresh from  , they are likely to introduce its new   and  . Its most affordable entry-level   could be making an appearance as well based on the recent sightings in our Malaysian SIRIM database. The Lumia 640 and 640 XL are quite similar in terms of specs. Both are having a 1.2GHz quad-core Snapdragon 400 processor that’s mated to 1GB of RAM and has 8GB of expandable storage. What sets both of them apart is the screen size where the Lumia 640 gets a 5″ HD 720p display while the XL has a larger 5.7″ screen that also pushes the same HD 720p resolution.  Apart from the screen size, the cameras are different too. The smaller Lumia 640 gets a 8MP main + 1MP front camera combo, while its bigger XL version packs a 13MP camera at the back and larger 5MP unit for better selfies. Powering both devices is a 2,500mAh battery for the 640 and a phablet category 3,000mAh capacity for the 640 XL. Meanwhile the Lumia 430 is seen as a tweaked version of its current Lumia 435. It gets a modest 4″ 800×480 display and a 1.2GHz dual-core Snapdragon 200 prcessor, 1GB RAM and 8GB of expandable storage. Imaging is rather low rate with a main 2MP camera and a basic VGA shooter for the front. The only difference with the Lumia 435 is the battery where it gets a smaller 1,500mAh capacity battery. The Lumia 640 and Lumia 640 XL are expected to be priced between RM500-RM900 range. Meanwhile the entry-level Lumia 430 could be priced below RM300, which is their most affordable Windows device. From the looks of it, the 640 XL could come in 2 versions – 3G and 4G LTE which both supports dual-SIMs.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Could this be the real Sony Xperia C4?
tags: Android,Android 5.0 Lollipop,rumour mill,smartphone,Sony Mobile,sony xperia C4. xperia c4,sony xperia cosmos,Xperia,xperia cosmos
contents: Not too long ago we got wind that   was to be the successor of Sony’s Xperia C3, and now we have what looks like a proper render of the smartphone. From what we can tell, the smartphone has a pretty huge front facing camera with LED flash, and the smartphone will purportedly be launching in June or July this year with Android Lollipop under the hood. The phone will come available in three colours, black, white and turquoise as pictured in the image itself. Still no real news on what hardware lies within this midranger, but we hope to find out more soon.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Watch HTC knock its competitors out of the park. Literally!
tags: Baseball,HTC,htc advertisement,HTC One M9,HTC One M9 Promo,iPhone 6,LG G3,robinson cano,Samsung Galaxy S5,Video
contents: latest ad involves more than just a whole bunch of shiny new phones but also a bit of baseball fun as they’ve enlisted world class second baseman hitter Robinson Cano to knock them out of the park. They quite literally set up a makeship pitcher’s mound and lobbed Cano an  ,   and   to obliterate in glorious slow motion. Who doesn’t enjoy a little uh, friendly competition? Catch it yourself after the break.

author: soyacincau
title: Huawei releases teaser ahead of its P8 flagship launch
tags: Android,Huawei Ascend P8,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Launch,Huawei P8 Teaser,smart phone
contents: Huawei will be unveiling its new   next week on 15th April in London. To drum up more interest ahead of launch, they have just released its teaser video which doesn’t tell much about the device. Instead it features a mysterious guy walking around stealing lights from everyone he passes by. This could be an indication of better low light camera capabilities. From its  , the new P8 would still feature its iconic slim design with a metal frame design which could be 6.6mm thick. In terms of specs, it is likely to carry a more compact 5.2″ screen that does Full HD and powering it is a newer Kirin 935 processor that’s mated to 3GB of RAM. From what we’ve experienced with the latest Honor smart phones, Huawei’s in-house Kirin processor are getting more competent to give the more established processors like Qualcomm a run for their money. Like the new Samsung Galaxy S6 edge, it could come with 32GB of on-board storage and a possible 2,600mAh capacity battery that boasts longer battery life with better power management. Both front and back are expected to be made out of glass which could be toughen with the latest Gorilla Glass 4. It is also rumoured that it could carry a fingerprint scanner at the back, similar to its Ascend Mate 7 phablet. Watch the official teaser after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: The HTC One M9 is one tough device to repair
tags: Android,HTC,HTC One M9,htc one m9 teardown,ifixit,Phablet,smart phone,teardown
contents: has just done a teardown of HTC’s latest flagship, the   and if anything they’ve discovered that the device is going to be pretty tough to fix. If the teardown is any indicator, initially it wasn’t hard to take the device apart in the sense it was mostly held together with torx screws and didn’t require heating to open up unlike it’s  . But burrowing deeper into the device, it became pretty clear that it would be no cakewalk to fix if you happened to crack your screen. Unfortunately, it still scored a very low repairability score, no thanks to too much adhesives keeping the phone’s vital components together and thus making them more dangerous to remove without damaging them plus the inability to change the screen without tearing the entire phone apart first. You can check out the full teardown after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Apple adds guided tours to their Apple Watch page
tags: Apple Smart Watch,Apple Watch,Apple Watch Malaysia,Apple Watch Malaysia Launch,iWatch,SIRIM,Smart Watch
contents: Apple has updated the Apple Watch section of it’s website to include video walkthroughs of their wearable’s functions. Currently, you can watch an introduction video on the watch as well as videos highlighting the messages, digital touch and faces functions. By the looks of it, there are plenty more videos to come as there’s more “coming soon” phone feature videos at the bottom of the page, but what better way to educate users about their potential purchase? The Apple Watch will be going on  . Videos after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Sony Xperia Z4 live photos make the rounds
tags: Android,smart phone,Sony,sony xperia,Sony Xperia Z4,Sony Xperia Z4 Design,Sony Xperia Z4 Images,Sony Xperia Z4 Leak,Xperia Z4
contents: After leaks that gave us a peek at the upcoming Sony Xperia Z4   and   it looks like the real deal has been spotted in the wild. The new images basically cover all the bases of the phone, showing that it’s seriously sticking to Sony’s Xperia Z series styling from top to bottom, as well as an exposed microUSB port. With the amount of leaks trickling out, it’s likely that the phone might be getting a launch, possibly very soon. More images after the break.
